loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
La señora Fidelina es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es dueña de una ropería de prendas de vestir, tiene todo tipo de prendas siempre muy variadas, y es eso lo que gusta mucho a sus clientes.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que poco a poco se fue abriendo camino, y hoy día ya es muy conocida.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de camisas, pantalones, jeans y otras prendas, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Fidelina is from the city of Curuguaty. She is the owner of a clothing store. She offers all types of garments of many different kinds; that is what her clients like.

She is a very hard-working and persevering person, who little by little has opened up paths for herself. Today, she is very well known. 

She asks for this loan to buy shirts, pants, jeans, and other garments. In this way, she will be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is thankful for this opportunity to be able to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, jeans, and other garments to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various clothing items, jeans, shoes and other items.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Cornelia tiene 56 años, es soltera, ella tiene 1 hijo, por el cual ella está luchando, para poder darle todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Es una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora.
Doña Cornelia se inició en su negocio hace más de 15 años, ella comenzó con el capital que gano con el sudor de su trabajo en otra ciudad, para poder trabajar en lo que a ella le gusta, hacer cortes y confecciones, en la actualidad ya tiene más de una máquina para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, hace todo tipo de costuras y confecciones.
Este préstamo le servirá para comprar más insumos, para poder producir en mayor cantidad, lo que comprará es telas e hilos al por mayor.
texts.en: Cornelia is 56 years old, single, and has 1 son for whom she fights in order to be able to give him all that she couldn't have. She is a very enterprising and hard-working mother. Cornelia began her business more than 15 years ago. She started with the capital she earned with the sweat of her work in another city, to be able to work doing what she enjoys, making clothing. Today she has more than one sewing machine in order to be able to meet her customer's demands, creating all kinds of clothing and tailored items. This loan will enable her to buy supplies such as thread and fabric in large quantity,

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric in quantity.

loans.name: Teresa Aurora

texts.es:
Teresa Aurora tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica al cultivo de café, cuenta con más de 06 años de experiencia en este negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, con esto Teresa espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ventas y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
33-year old Teresa Aurora lives with her husband and four children in Pucará district, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in Peru’s northern mountains. The local people mostly earn their living as farmers, raise livestock, or run businesses. 

Teresa grows coffee and has more than six years’ experience in this line of work. She has very good personal and work references. The loan she is seeking will be used to buy compost and fertilizer for her coffee plants. With these purchases, Teresa hopes to be able to offer better quality coffee to her customers. Then she will sell more and be able to improve her own and her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: buy compost and fertilizer for her coffee plants

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 56 years old and resides at Balangasan, Pagadian City, Philippines. His wife is a teacher with three siblings.

As a family man, he raised his children by harvesting rice every cropping and has enjoyed 40 years of farming. He applied for a 10,000 PHP loan from GDMPC to buy pesticides and pay the cost of cleaning the rice farm. He plans to retire when he reaches 60 years old.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and pay the cost of cleaning the rice farm.

loans.name: Segundo Francisco

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 59 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su hija y su cónyuge en el distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a la venta de productos de plásticos, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 35 años y cuenta con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de más productos de plástico como loncheras, baldes y tapers para implementar su negocio, con esto Segundo espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes lo que aumentará su nivel de ventas, le generará mayores ingresos y le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Segundo is 59 years old, and he lives in his own house with his daughter and his partner in the district of Cayaltí, which is located in the province of Chiclayo in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. He lives in a community dedicated to business, agriculture, and livestock.

He sells plastic products. He has been doing this work for more than 35 years, and he has fixed clients, who offer very good personal and professional references for him. 

The loan will be used to buy more plastic products, including lunchboxes, buckets, and containers to stock his business. With this, Segundo hopes to offer a better variety of products to his clients, which will increase his level of sales. This will generate him more income and will allow him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more plastic products, including lunchboxes, buckets, and containers to stock his business.

loans.name: Luis Adan

texts.es:
Luis tiene 46 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte en taxi, contando con una unidad vehicular, cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su unidad vehicular ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones su vehículo y asi poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, con gran influencia en el negocio. Luis espera brindar una mejor atención a los clientes de la zona lo que le va a generar mayores ingresos que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
46-year old Luis is single and lives with his family in a rural part of Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on Peru’s northern coast.The local people mostly earn their living as farmers, raise livestock, or run businesses. 

Luis runs a taxi service and has one vehicle. He has more than five years’ experience in this line of work and very good personal and work references. He is seeking a loan to repair and service his vehicle which is in a poor state of repair. Then he will be able to offer a nicer vehicle and better service to his clients. This will have an important effect on his business: he will earn more money and be able to improve his own and his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: repair and service his taxi which is in a poor state of repair

loans.name: Señor De Torrechayoc - Tutiruyoc Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC-TUTIRUYOC,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de de La Convención ,distrito de Echarate y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Maribel tiene 35 años de edad es soltera y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracia sal empeño que le pone cada di a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC-TUTIRUYOC communal bank. The bank is located in the La Convención province, Echarate district, Cusco deparment.

Our member Maribel is 35 years old, single, and has 3 children. She alternates her daily work with farming. Her business is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She also raises small animals, and in this way helps her family get ahead.

Maribel seeks a loan to buy seeds and other items. She is thankful for the awarded loan and promises to make her payments on the established schedule. The other members of the group work in agriculture and raising animals.

The person with the covered face in the photo doesn't belong to the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for transportation for traveling to customers’ homes. With a car, she will save significant time wasted on public transportation.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia works hard to support her family. Emilia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Emilia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business like fish nets and bamboo. Emilia has been in this business for 2 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business like fish nets and bamboo.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a hardworking married man. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in cattle rearing and selling and has been able to earn a living.

He is optimistic of having a big developed business and a model farm around his area, but has been limited by high transportation costs and prolonged drought where animals lack water and grass.

He is planning to use the requested loan to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening to sell.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El Sr. Rafael tiene 28 años, está acompañado hace 5 años con la señora María de 23 años, es una pareja joven que se está esforzando por poder salir adelante y dar a su pequeño hijo de 3 años todo lo que necesita para una vida digna y sin privaciones.
El señor Rafael es chatarrero (compra – venta de productos reciclables) hace ya 2 años de forma individual, comenzó en este rubro trabajando como empleado, posteriormente con ayuda de su suegro quien le facilito un capital para poder emprender en el trabajo como propietario  de su propia empresa, tiene un vehículo en el cual hace su recolección.
 El cliente pide este préstamo en la compra de cartón, plástico, hierros, etc., que podrá revender lo que le permita entregar en forma permanente los pedidos que tiene de las Empresas de Reciclaje  y así asegurar su ingreso mensual que le permita vivir mejor.
texts.en:
28-year old Sr. Rafael has been married for five years to 23-year old Sra. María. The couple are working hard to get ahead and provide their 3-year old son with all he needs for a good life.

Rafael has been an independent scrap dealer (he buys and sells recyclable items) for two years. He began this line of work as an employee but then, with financial help from his father-in-law, he was able to open his own business. He has a vehicle to collect the items.

Rafael is seeking a loan to buy cardboard, plastic, iron etc. which he will be able to re-sell. He will be able to have a permanent arrangement with recycling companies ensuring a regular monthly income, which in turn will allow him to have a better life.

loans.use: buy cardboard, plastic, iron etc. to re-sell

loans.name: Adèle's Group

texts.fr:
Le BV de Diambars Doumassou est crée en 2013 le 13 décembre 2011. Groupe solidaire entre elles, le commerce de détail est la principale activité qu'elles mènent. 
Assise à l’extrême droite de la photo et levant la main,Diénaba est l'emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 02 garçons.
Avec le prêt reçu elle achète des paniers de poissons en gros à 20 000 f et du tissu pour revendre au détail.
Elle revend le poisson à 2 000 f le kg et le tissu à 15 000 frs le boubou.
Les bénéfices générés par l'activité lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins familiaux mais aussi de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Diambars Doumassou’s loan group was created on December 13, 2013. The women help one another; their main activity is retail.

All the way to the right in the photo, with her hand raised, is Djenaba, the group’s highlighted borrower. She is 37 years old, married, and a mother of five, including two boys.

With the loan granted, she will purchase wholesale fish baskets for 20,000 XOF, and fabrics to retail. She resells the fish for 2,000 XOF per kilo, and the fabric for 15,000 XOF per dress.

Profits from the business allow her to provide for her family and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy baskets of fish and fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MADRES TRABAJADROAS, la socia continua dedicándose  a ejercer su carrera de docente, la socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua trabajando en uno de los jardines de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar materiales para su trabajo.
texts.en: The member belongs to the Madres Trabajadoras communal bank. She continues working as a teacher. She finds herself satisfied with the awarded loan and promises to make her payments on the established schedule. The member continues working in one of the schools in Cusco city. She is a responsible and hard-working person, and she supports her family through her work. She seeks a loan to buy supplies for her work.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her work as a teacher.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MADRES TRABAJADORAS “,la  socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de costura, la socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua con su taller donde confecciona  pantalones, vestidos entre otros, la socia desea  poder seguir trabajando para así poder apoyar a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar telas entre otros.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Communal Bank “Madres Trabajadoras” [Working Mothers]. She continues to manage her sewing business. The borrower is very satisfied and appreciative of the support that has been given to her in this manner, so she promises to repay her debts according to the established terms. She continues to produce trousers, dresses, and other garments in her workshop. The borrower wants to keep working so that she can support her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other supplies.

loans.name: Guillermo Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en una comunidad pequeña de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores desde hace 5 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, Javier ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecerlos a un mejor precio, con esto Javier espera mejorar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Javier is 38 years old and lives with his wife and children in Cayatli, a small community. The people in this community work in agriculture, business, and cattle. It is located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, in northern Peru.

Along with his wife, they raise and sell small animals, a business they have had for 5 years. The business is located in the rear part of their home. Javier seeks a loan to buy balanced feed to fatten his animals and in this way offer them at a better price. With this, Javier hopes to improve his income and in the long term improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten his animals

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Aida works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fish. Aida is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net.

loans.name: Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place le 12 Décembre 2009. Il est composé de  femmes déterminées à changer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles viennent dans ce sens entamer leur onzième cycle dans le programme. Elles entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Binta (debout à l’extrême droite), est emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 08enfant (05 garçons et 03 filles). Elle  s’active dans  de condiments en détail, s’approvisionne au louma de Yarang et revend à Kolda.

 Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 5kg de nététou à 400f le kg ; 1 panier de poisson séché à 40000f et une bouteille de 20 litre de citron à 5000f pour le revendre en détails et paie un  transport de 5000f.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille, renforcer ses épargnes et aider dans la scolarité de  ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was set up on December 12, 2009. It is made up of women determined to change their living conditions. To this end, they just started their eleventh loan cycle in the program. They live in solidarity and help one another out. Their main business is retail.

Mrs. Binta (standing all the way to the right) is the group’s highlighted borrower. She is 46 years old, married, and a mother of eight (five boys and three girls). Her business is the retail of condiments. She gets her supplies from the market in Yarang and resells in Kolda.

With this loan, she plans to purchase 5 kilos of netetou (a local spice), for 400 XOF per kilo ; one basket of dried fish (40,000 XOF) and a twenty-liter bottle of lemon juice (5,000 XOF), which she will retail. She also pays 5,000 XOF for transportation.

With her profits, she intends to improve her family’s living conditions, to increase her savings, and to help pay for her children’s school expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 5 kilos of netetou (a local spice), for 400 XOF per kilo ; one basket of dried fish (40,000 XOF), and a twenty-liter bottle of lemon juice (5,000 XOF); and to pay a 5,000-XOF transportation fee.

loans.name: Fatoumata Lamarana's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place le 12 Décembre 2009. Il est composé de  femmes déterminées à changer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles viennent dans ce sens entamer leur onzième cycle dans le programme. Elles entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatoumata (debout à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 30ans marié et mère de 8 enfants dont 1 garçon et 7 filles. Elle s’active dans le commerce de fruits, sacs et chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne à Diaobé et Dakar pour les revendre à Kolda.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 10 sacs d’orange de 50kg à 8000 le sac, des sacs à main à 5000f l’unité pour les revendre à 10000f  si c’est le sac et les chaussures à 12500f et paie un transport de 6400f.

Elle compte avec ses bénéfices améliorer ses épargnes, payer ses intérêts et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was set up on December 12, 2009. It is made up of women determined to change their living conditions. To this end, they just started their eleventh loan cycle in the program. They live in solidarity and help one another out. Their main business is retail.

Mrs. Fatoumata (standing all the way to the right) is the group’s highlighted borrower. She is 30 years old, married, and a mother of eight (one boy and seven girls). Her business is the retail of fruits, handbags, and shoes. She gets her supplies from Diaobé and Dakar and resells in Kolda.

With this new loan, she plans to purchase ten 50-kilo bags of oranges at 8,000 XOF per bag, handbags costing 5,000 XOF each and retailing for 10,000 for 12,500 XOF.  She also pays 6,400 XOF for transportation.

With her profits, she intends to improve her savings, pay her interests, and improve her children’s living conditions,

loans.use: to buy ten 50-kilo bags of oranges at 8,000 each, handbags at 5,000f a piece, and shoes; and to pay a 6,400-XOF transportation fee.

loans.name: Helario

texts.en:
Helario is a 40-year-old father who is raising his family in a rural community. He makes a living through farming and hog raising. Despite the hardships they experience, he is determined to raise the living status of his family and educate his children.

He would like to strengthen his hog-raising business but he has limited capital. For this reason, he is requesting an additional PHP 15,000 to buy hog feeds, vaccines and vitamins for his hogs. He is hoping that his loan request will be funded so that he will be able to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vaccines and vitamins for his hogs

loans.name: Binta  Alassane's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place le 12 Décembre 2009. Il est composé de  femmes déterminées à changer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles viennent dans ce sens entamer leur onzième cycle dans le programme. Elles entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Binta (debout à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle s’active dans la vente de d’huile de palme, d’arachide et de patte d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne à Diaobé pour le revendre à Kolda en détail.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 20 litre d’huile de palme à 16500f, 08 bidons  de l’huile d’arachide à 17500f et 05 sceaux de patte d’arachide à 8000f le sceau pour le revendre en détail et paie un transport de 11000.

Ses bénéfices lui permettront de renforcer ses épargnes, améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et construire un habitat pour sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was set up on December 12, 2009. It is composed of women determined to change their living conditions. To this end, they just started their eleventh loan cycle in the program. They live in solidarity and help one another out. Their main business is retail.

Mrs. Binta (standing all the way to the right) is the group’s highlighted borrower. Her business is the retail of palm oil, ground nut, and ground nut butter. She gets her supplies from Diaobé and retails in Kolda.

With this new loan, she plans to purchase twenty liters of palm oil for 16,500 XOF, eight jugs of peanut oil for 17,500 XOF, and five buckets of ground nut butter at 8,000 XOF each, all for retail. She also pays 11,000-XOF for transportation.

Profits will allow her to increase her savings, improve her children’s living conditions, and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy twenty liters of palm oil for 16,500 XOF, eight jugs of peanut oil for 17,500 XOF, and five buckets of ground nut butter at 8,000 XOF each; and to pay a 11,000-XOF for transportation.

loans.name: Genny Del Rocio

texts.es:
Portoviejo capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador. Conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo, ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señora Genny, tiene 40  años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen un  hijo de nueve años que estudia en quinto año básico, ella tiene casa propia.
Doña Genny es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de zapatillas por catálogo. Trabaja dos días a la semana en las mañanas, su hermana le ayuda con la venta pero la mayor parte es ella quien la realiza, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar sandalias que están en ofertas y así poder tener mayores ingresos. Este es el cuarto año en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta la atención médica y las facilidades de pago. Sus sueños es que su hijo termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the Manabí province in Ecuador. Known as the first and oldest city in the Ecuadorian coastal region, it is gaining ground as a tourist destination since this canton has beach, city and countryside.

This is where Genny lives. She is 40 years old. She is separated and has a nine-year-old child from this union who is in fifth grade. She owns her own home.

Doña Genny is a homemaker. She sells casual shoes by catalog in order to earn her own income. She works two days a week in the morning. Her sister helps her with the sales but the most of it is done by her. Her products can be bought on credit, and she collects every eight days. She has been doing this work for the last three years, and it is going very well. 

This loan is to buy sandals that are on sale in order to increase her income. This is her fourth year in the credit group and she likes the medical attention and the ease of payment. She hopes that her son will finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy sandals.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: As the married parent of three children, Rowena works hard to support her family. She has a food-selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by running a general store. Rowena has requested a loan for PHP 20,000 from NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, and vegetables. She has sustained her business with help from four prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en: Warlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs an ice-candy business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 29,500 from NWTF to buy the ingredients she needs to make more items to sell. Warlita successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build up her business. NWTF is re-listing Warlita's business profile again to support her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-selling business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 51-year-old married mother of nine children, four of whom are still in school. For 20 years she has raising and fattening pigs in the Philippines. 

Susana has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business, and has now requested a new loan for PHP 15000 to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a restaurant business in the Philippines for 16 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Ofelia, who has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF, is borrowing PHP 16000 to buy additional ingredients such as meat, vegetables, canned goods, etc. for her restaurant. She dreams to build and expand her enterprise to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 52 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like candies, canned goods, soap, groceries, etc.

Zosima has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from an electronic shop. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like candies, canned goods, soap, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Roesemarie

texts.en:
As a married woman, Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fish vending. 

Her past loan from NWTF helped Rosemarie sustain her business activities; she is now requesting a new loan for PHP 6000 to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Rosemarie hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of providing a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 44 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Norma has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is 41 years old and lives in Sipaloc, Sibutad. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself plowing the rice field. In need of additional working capital, Mila joined Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans and recently requested a loan for 14,900 PHP, which she will use to buy two sacks of fertilizers and to pay for labor. Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income and provide for the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en: Bernadeth is 31 years old and a widow with one child. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, milk, coffee, etc. Bernadeth has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Bernadeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en: Macrina is 58 years old and married. Macrina works very hard to provide for their daily needs. Macrina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, eggs, canned goods, beverages, etc. Macrina has been in this business for six years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. In the future, Macrina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, eggs, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Juna

texts.en:
Juna works hard to support five children. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Juna has requested a PHP 6,750 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Juna is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Joseta

texts.en:
Joseta is 62 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more merchandise to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, spices, coffee, soft drinks, etc.

Joseta has been in this business for 29 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, spices, coffee, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 49 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She lives in in the Philippines and earns a living by raising pigs. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Leny has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell to her customers.

Salvacion has been in this business for four years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Myrna works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Myrna is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ruena

texts.en:
Ruena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ruena is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ruena has a buy and sell plastic ware business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more plastic ware.

Ruena has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Ruena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more plastic goods to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 37 years old, married and has three children who are in school.

Victoria is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Umazi operates a stall selling grocery vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing rental houses.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Wanzala

texts.en:
Wanzala is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over one year, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Ana Veliz

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando más capital para comprarse una moto cierra que utilizara únicamente para la eliminación de la maleza en las tierras que próximamente cultivara, espera seguir ampliado el área de cultivo.
El préstamo anterior le genero un impacto positivo a Ana en su negocio, puesto que la cosecha ha sido muy abundante, actualmente tiene estabilidad económica con la que responde a sus compromisos y su familia tiene una vida saludable.
texts.en: Ana is requesting more capital to buy a chainsaw which she will use to clear brush from the land she will soon farm. She hopes to continue expanding her crops. The previous loan had a positive impact on Ana's business because her harvest has been abundant. Currently, she has financial stability so she can meet her obligations and her family is healthy.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw which she will use to clear brush from the land she will soon farm.

loans.name: Zhirayr

texts.en:
Zhirayr is 21 years old and lives alone in Kapan, a city in the Syunik region. Despite being so young and alone, he is already a farmer and the owner of a big and rich orchard. Here he has a lot of apple, pear and mulberry trees.

During the week, Zhirayr sells his orchard harvest at wholesale. He also built a greenhouse, which brings him a really good income during the winter period; here he cultivates tomato, cucumber, and a great assortment of greens. Zhirayr combines his agricultural activities with his work at the Kapan combine.

Zhirayr will be thankful to have this Kiva loan, which he wants to use for repairing the fence of his orchard and also to buy some seedlings for the coming spring sowing activities.

loans.use: to repair the fence of his orchard and to buy some seedlings for the coming spring sowing activities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy controllers, used video games, cables etc. for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: improve his home with a ceramic floor.

loans.name: Llapanchispac Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Tadea, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de verduras como zanahorias, lechugas, tomates entre otros, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua vendiendo las verduras a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zanahorias, lechuga entre otros.
  Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de cabinas de internet, negocio de restaurant, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de ropa.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
The members belong to the 'Llapanchispac' communal bank. This bank is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

The loan recipient is Tadea. She continues with her business selling vegetables such as carrots, lettuce, and tomatoes, among others. She is grateful to those who are supporting this dream and she is committed to paying her installment payments on time. 

Tadea continues selling vegetables to the customers that request them. She is a responsible and diligent person, thus she is able to get her family ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy carrots and lettuce, among others.

The other members work in businesses such as internet cafes, restaurants, grocery stores and clothing stores. The individual whose face is covered does not belong to the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy carrots and lettuce, among others.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica, 45, is from Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Richard, a stevedore, and has three children. Only one of her children goes to school.  She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her child to school. 

Jessica operates a small variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also grills and sells barbecue for added income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 700 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy grocery items such as a sack of rice, charcoal and soda as well as fresh meat for her barbecue sale. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help fund their everyday needs and the schooling of her child.

Jessica hopes to maintain and grow her business so they can have a better life. She prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and fresh meat to sell.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 55 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Amelita is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Amelita has been farming rice for eight years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 38 years old and married with four children. With three of her children in school, Ailyn works very hard to provide for them.

Ailyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

Ailyn has been in this business for four years now and sells a variety of items such as coffee, soap, canned goods, sugar, candies, salt, and other groceries.

In the future, Ailyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mchekwisha

texts.en:
Mchekwisha is a single woman with four children, none of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her place of business.

With the loan of 50,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mohpari

texts.ru: Мохпари проживает в городке Куляб вместе семьей. Она замужем и у нее четверых детей. 3 дочерей по 22,17 и 7 года. Один сын в возрасте 14 лет. Дети ходят в школу. Мохпари очень трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина. Она любить трудиться. Мохпари 6 лет своей жизни занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота. Она свободное время занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она трудиться, чтобы заработать и обеспечить семью. Сейчас Мохпари хочет расширить деятельность. Она берет кредит для купли крупнорогатого скота, и на оставшуюся часть денег она купить окно и дверь для дома. Мохпари очень важно Ваша помощь.
texts.en: Mohpari lives in the small city of Kulob with her family.  She is married and she has four children (three daughters who are 22,17 and 7 years old, and one son who is 14 years old).  All her children attend school.  Mohpari is very hardworking and responsible.  She loves her work.  For the past six years of her life, she has been raising cattle.  In her spare time, she also sews women's clothes.  She works hard in order to make a living and support her family.  At the moment, she would like to expand her activity.  She is taking a loan to buy cattle, and with the extra money, she will buy a new widow and a door for her house.  Your support is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Nara liked her first Kiva partnership very much and hopes for Kiva support once again. She lives with her beloved husband in Vanadzor city, which is in the Lori region. She is 29 years old and she has the higher education of a pedagogue. For six years, she has worked at the school as a teacher of mathematics and informatics. She also organizes paid private courses in mathematics at her house; some groups of pupils attend these courses to get better prepared for their lessons and the others are getting prepared for their entrance examinations. She is greatly respected, a little bit strict and a clever pedagogue, which is why all her pupils usually have great success in their exams and at school as well.
 
Nara is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams since she wants to repair the separate room in her flat where she passes her courses and to buy a big table and chairs to work in comfort both for her pupils and for herself.

loans.use: to repair the separate room in her flat where she passes her courses and to buy a big table and chairs to work in comfort

loans.name: Glenda Xiomara

texts.es:
La señora  Glenda Xiomara  de 43  años de edad es casada , tiene  05 hijos  que depende de ella, vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace varios años  al negocio de la elaboración y venta de artesanías.
Doña Glenda Xiomara  desde muy joven se ha dedicado al negocio de artesanías porque sus padres también se dedicaron a esta actividad y le enseñaron para que su negocio fuera creciendo, actualmente en su taller trabajan dos  hijas las cuales le ayudan mucho con la producción.
Doña Glenda Xiomara  está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de materia prima como ser leña, tierra, chiriviscos,  tinto, etc.  Con el apoyo de este crédito pretende comprar por mayor la materia prima y de esta manera satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.
 Su sueño es tener el mejor taller de artesanías de la zona. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Enero del 2015
texts.en:
Glenda Xiomara, 43 years old, is married, has 5 dependent children, lives in a community in the south of Honduras, has her own house, and has worked for some years in a business making and selling crafts. 

Since she was very young, Glenda Xiomara has worked in the craft business, because her parents also worked in this field and taught her so that her business would grow. Currently two daughters work in her workshop, which helps her a lot with the production. 

Glenda Xiomara  is asking for the loan to purchase raw materials such as firewood, earth, kindling wood, dye, etc. With the support of this loan, she plans to purchase the raw material in bulk and in this way satisfy her customers' demand and get the income necessary to get ahead with her family.

Her dream is to have the best craft workshop in the zone. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – January 2015

loans.use: to purchase firewood, earth, kindling wood, dye, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analiza is 31 years old and has one child in school.

Analiza has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed.

Analiza has been in this business for one year. In the future, Analiza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare his garden by ploughing, weeding and buying chemicals

loans.name: Jose Reinaldo

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y a la crianza de ganado, desde hace 10 años tiene su negocio propio, trabaja en horario de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde, heredo de sus padres el oficio, José es un hombre de familia, vive con su esposa e hijo, ambos son dependientes.
Invertirá en los costos de recolección de la cosecha de granos básicos y comprara equipo para picar el zacate con que alimenta a su ganado, así realizara los trabajaos con menor dificultad y a su ganado no le faltara alimento en esta época de verano.
Su anhelo es tener un negocio con bases más fuertes para que le dé mejores utilidades con las que piensa ir cancelando sus deudas y cambiar las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
José makes a living harvesting basic grains and raising cattle. For 10 years, he has had his own business and works from seven in the morning until three in the afternoon. He inherited the business from his parents. He is a family man and lives with his wife and son, both of which are dependents. 

He will invest in the costs of harvesting basic grains and will buy equipment to chop the hay that he feeds his cattle. He will be able to carry out his work with less difficulty, and his cattle will not lack feed in the summer. 

His desire is to have a business with a stronger founder so that he’ll have better profits, which will go to paying off his debts and changing his family’s circumstances.

loans.use: to invest in the costs of harvesting basic grains and buy equipment to chop the hay he feeds his cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new camera and work in a studio.

loans.name: Herly

texts.en:
Herly is 40 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Herly has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Herly has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Herly would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Cherill

texts.en:
Cherill is 33 years old and married with two children. With both of her children in school, Cherill works very hard to provide for them.

Cherill runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, toothpaste, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Cherill has been in this business for eight years now and sells a variety of items such as soap powder, shampoo, conditioner, pampers, vinegar, canned goods, coffee, soft drinks, and other groceries. 

In the future, Cherill would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, toothpaste, shampoo, and groceries

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is a hardworking man who wants a loan to buy produce such as maize, rice and groundnuts to sell. He deals mainly in produce and rentals that earn him income. He has been in business for 10 years, having started the business with the aim of catering for his family's needs. He wishes to educate his children though he is challenged by inadequate capital to buy business stock.

loans.use: to buy produce such as maize, rice and groundnuts.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Creciendo Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo cuenta con actividades consolidadas, que les ha permitido crecimientos a nivel de la actividad productiva y personal, ya que han logrado mejorar su condición de vida. El trabajo en equipo ha permitido tener un crecimiento importante en el patrimonio ya que les ha traído beneficios a nivel interno en el grupo, especialmente cuando se les presente alguna emergencia, se les puede prestar para su necesidad urgente y lo devuelven con un bajo porcentaje de intereses. Con el fin de lograr mantenerse con sus actividades productivas.

Doña Brígida una de las integrantes de este grupo desde el inicio en la zona de San Vito, para el apoyo de mujeres que desean superarse y salir a delante, vive en Fila Mendez, lugar de mucha pobreza y casi ninguna fuente de empleo, a no ser que inicien con lo propio, como en el caso de doña Brígida, tiene 45 años de edad y vive con su hijo menor de edad, el cual está en la escuela. Con el esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado dar estudio a sus hijos; por medio de su microempresa, dedicada la crianza de cerdos para engorde. Ella ofrece  carne de cerdo o el cerdo con tres meses de nacido.
El objetivo de este préstamo es comprar más cerdos, concentrado para su alimentación y los diferentes desparacitantes e inyecciones que necesita para que los cerdos logren crecer adecuadamente.
Entre sus metas destaca salir adelante para que su hijo menor y ella tengan un futuro mejor, que puedan estudiar y apoyar los ingresos del hogar. Por ahora la dificultada más grande ha sido la económica, pero han encontrado en Fundación Mujer un apoyo para su micro emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group works in consolidated activities, which has allowed them growth in production as well as at the personal level to improve their living conditions. Teamwork has allowed for a significant increase in equity and benefits within the group. As in the case of an emergency, a loan can be made for an urgent necessity and then paid back at a low rate of interest. The goal is to keep up production.

Brígida has been a group member from the beginning, when it originated in the San Vito area to support women who want to better themselves and get ahead. She lives in Fila Mendez, a place of great poverty and almost no employment, unless you start your own business, as did Brígida. She is 45 years old and lives with her young son, who is in school. With effort and work she has put two children through school. Her business is raising and fattening pigs. She sells pork and three-month-old pigs. The purpose of this loan is to buy more pigs, concentrated feed, and the injections and vaccines required for the pigs to grow adequately.

She wants to succeed so that she and her young son can have a better future. She wants him to be able to go to school and to help support household income. Until now the greatest impediment has been financial, but Kiva partner Fundación Mujer (Women's Foundation) has provided support to her microenterprise.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pay for their feed and upkeep for six months.

loans.name: Aristides Alfredo

texts.es:
Arístides, es casado, vive con su madre, su manera de generar ingresos económicos es salir a revender  pan por las mañanas y en el resto del día práctica la crianza de pollos, el negocio lo implemento para cubrir necesidades familiares y tiene como dificultad el poco espacio para la granja.
El capital será de ayuda para comprar pollos, concentrado, vacunas, etc., para cumplir el propósito de mejorar la granja, espera tener más clientes que demanden sus productos para aumentar su ingresos y cancelar su deuda.
Su visión es comprar una propiedad  cercana para instalar la granja, pues tendrá oportunidad de tener mayor cantidad de pollos y les dará mejores cuidados.
texts.en:
Arístides is married and lives with his mother. He generates income by reselling bread in the morning and by raising chickens the rest of the day. He works to meet his family's needs and faces the difficulty of not having enough space for his farm.

This loan would help him buy chickens, concentrated feed, vaccines, etc., for improving the farm. He hopes to have more clients who want his products so that he can increase his income and pay off debts.

His dream is to buy a nearby property for the farm. Then he could have more chickens and give them better care.

loans.use: buy chickens, concentrated feed, vaccines, etc., for farm improvements.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques; Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban Koulouba l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, chaussures plastics, pagnes wax, savon et du lait en poudre. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 6ème   cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bassitan  (femme debout en 3ème  position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des chaussures plastiques de meilleures qualités et de toutes les pointures au marché de Kalaban. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 600 paires de chaussures plastiques en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails à en ambulant et à Kalaban à une clientèle mixte. Madame Bassitan espère avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité afin d’augmenter son volume et assurer l’entretien des enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The six women of the group Benkadi are married for the most part in monogamous households; the women average 32 years of age and three children each, all living in Kalaban Koulouba, a district of Bamako. And they know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses at the Kalaban market.

With the goal of building up their inventories, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 6th solidarity loan. 

Ms. Bassitan (the woman standing third from the left in the photo) is famous for selling plastic footwear of the best qualities in all sizes at the Kalaban market. She intends to use her loan to purchase 600 pairs of plastic shoes wholesale at the big market. Her retail sales are made to a mixed customer base in Kalaban by going door to door. 

With this loan, Ms. Bassitan hopes to have an average monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business to increase her volume and ensure her children’s care at home.

loans.use: to purchase plastic footwear

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Rosa está en su ciclo número 5º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Cada una de ellas se unieron para procurar un mejor estilo de vida, no solo para ellas, sino también para sus familias.
Justina es vendedora de comidas y bebidas, es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, es por ello que ya tiene una clientela muy bien formada que siempre le pide las deliciosas comidas que hace. Comenta que le gustaría poder tener una gran tienda donde poder vender sus comidas, y es por ello que se está esforzando cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser carne, condimentos, verduras, hortalizas y demás, de manera a seguir deleitando sus clientes con las delicias que hace. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de ir mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa Group is in their fifth loan cycle. The group is a committee of women, all of whom work and help each other to cope. They came together to seek a better lifestyle, not only for themselves but also for their families.

Justina sells meals and drinks. She is very good at what she does. For this reason, she has a significant clientele who always seek out the delicious meals she makes. She would like to have a big store where she could sell her meals; that is what she works toward every day.

Jusina is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for her meals, such as meat, condiments, vegetables, and all the rest, in order to continue delighting customers with the treats she makes. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to keep improving every day.

loans.use: buy meat, condiments, vegetables and more.

loans.name: Los Tromes Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal LOS TROMES, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
El socio Jorge tiene 38 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es separado, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de  materiales de construcción como ladrillos, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de ladrillos.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Los Tromes communal bank; the bank is located in Cusco province.

Jorge is 38 years old, has 2 children, and is separated. He divides his time between his daily activities and his business selling construction materials like bricks. He has been in this business for a good while, which is going well thanks to the dedication that he puts each day into his business. He wants to be able to continue working so, in this way, to continue supporting his family.

The member asks for a loan to purchase bricks.

He is grateful for the offered loan and promises to make the established payments.

The other members work selling construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase bricks.

loans.name: Lorgilen

texts.en:
Lorgilen is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending and her butcher shop businesses. Lorgilen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell to customers.

Lorgilen has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Leilanie

texts.en:
Leilanie is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leilanie is 40 years old and has four children who are in school.

Leilanie has a buy and sell of rice business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of rice to sell.

Leilanie has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Twaranyuzwe Group

texts.fr:
Stany  fait partie du groupe  Twaranyuzwe et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a  44 ans et est marié à Sandrine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 8 à 14 ans, tous étudient.
Il a sous sa charge 1 enfant, membre de sa famille. 

Il fait le commerce de haricot, du riz,...dans sa boutique  depuis  8 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, et de haricot, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  importer ses produits, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Stany is part of the group Twaranyuzwe and lives in Bujumbura. He is 44 years old and married to Sandrine, a farmer. Together they have four children, from 8 to 14  years old, of whom all are students. He is responsible for one child, a family member.

Stany has been doing commerce in beans, rice, … in his store for eight years. 

He is on his 1st Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase a large quantity of rice and beans to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to import his goods and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of rice and beans to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Vidala

texts.en: Vidala works hard to support her family. Vidala is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Vidala requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business. Vidala has been in this business for 10 years now. Vidala would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: As a married mother of four children, Andrea works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Andrea is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers. Andrea has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Leah works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of rice business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Leah is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Leah has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of rice and beans to cook and resell in her restaurant, so as to earn more

loans.name: Yonah

texts.en:
Yonah is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is a retail shop, alongside farming. He was inspired by the need to earn a living and cater for his family.

He faces a challenge of scarcity of resources to buy more items for the shop. However, he hopes to expand his business into wholesale and have educated children.

He is requesting a loan to buy more items such as soap, crates of sodas, sugar, Nomi, boxes of water, and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more items such as soap, crates of sodas, sugar, Nomi, boxes of water, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, está necesitando un nuevo crédito con el que podrá comprar maíz, cal, bolsas, leña y gas propano para elaborar la venta de tortillas, al administrar bien el nuevo préstamo y  cubrir las demandas de sus clientes está manteniendo su fuente de ingresos con vida.
El crédito anterior le dio la facilidad de obtener materiales de construcción, para vivir junto a su familia en mejores condiciones, así como también parte de la materia prima para su negocio. Con las nuevas ganancias a respaldado el pago de sus cuotas y puede dar un mejor salario a su empleada.
texts.en:
Catalina needs another loan with which she will be able to purchase corn, lime powder, bags, firewood, and propane gas to make and sell tortillas. As she manages the new loan well and meets the demand of her customers, she is maintaining her source of income alive. 

The previous loan gave her ease in getting construction materials to live with her family in better conditions, and also part for the raw material for her business, as well.  With the new earnings she has supported making her payments and she can give a better salary to her employee.

loans.use: to purchase corn, lime powder, bags, firewood, and propane gas to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more maize to stock in order to sell during the next season.

loans.name: Maria Marcelina

texts.es:
María, vende paletas de sabores, su familia está formada por un hijo mayor de edad y una nieta menor de edad, todos viven en la misma casa y colaboran en el negocio, lo tiene desde hace 4 años y quien le ayuda más es su nieta, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades.
Con el financiamiento comprara paletas de sabores, sodas, agua, jugos, golosinas, etc., ofrecerá otro tipo de producto a sus clientes esperando mantenerlos satisfechos y recuperar su inversión con ganancias que utilizara para que en su hogar existan menos necesidades y para cancelar su deuda.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para heredárselo a su nieta y que esta tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
María sells flavored popsicles. Her family is made up of an adult son and a granddaughter who is a minor. They all live in the same house and work together in the business. She has had it for 4 years and who helps her the most is her granddaughter. To date, she hasn't had any difficulties.

With the loan, she will purchase flavored popsicles, soft drinks, water, juice, sweets, etc. and will offer another type of product to her customers, hoping to keep them satisfied and to get a return on her investment with earnings that she will use so that in her household there are fewer needs and to pay off her debt. 

Her dream is to expand her business to leave it for her granddaughter and that the granddaughter has a better future.

loans.use: to purchase flavored popsicles, soft drinks, water, juices, sweets, etc. to offer other types of products to her customers, hoping to keep them satisfied.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina, comenta que el crédito anterior ha sido muy importante para continuar trabajando en el campo y mantener su ganado saludable, continua viviendo sola, tiene menos deudas y un estilo de vida con más comodidades.
Está decidida por un nuevo crédito para pagar obreros que le ayuden a realizar los cultivos de granos básicos y una máquina para tener alimento suficiente para su ganado en época de verano.
texts.en:
Aquilina says that the previous loan has been very important to continue working in the countryside and keep her livestock healthy. She continues to live alone, she has fewer debts, and a lifestyle with more comforts.

She has decided to take out a new loan to pay workers who help her to raise her basic grains and a machine to have sufficient feed for her livestock during the summer.

loans.use: to pay workers who help her to cultivate the basic grains and a machine to have sufficient feed for her livestock during the summer.

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Jane, who is in her mid 40s is married and has three children who are still in school.  

She has been running two projects: raising chicks for selling and a motorcycle transportation business.  She has been in these businesses since 2005.  She works from 5 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be one of the many loans Jane has taken from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to purchase broilers (chicken for meat) and layers (chicken which lay eggs), and sold chicken for meat and sold eggs as well.  She also bought a motorcycle.  

She is doing great and appreciates Kiva for the support of her group which is happy and can support their family, and can take their kids to good schools now.  

She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, built her house, and covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy chicks, chicken feed, and will service her motorcycle. 

She dreams of buying a car and to be able to supply quality chicken to her customers.

Jane will share this loan with her loan group "UNITY" which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks, chicken feed, and to service her motorcycle

loans.name: Rosalia Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Rosalía” está conformada por 05 socios entusiastas. Este es el caso de Ida  de 38 años de edad, conviviente con 03 hijos dependientes. La Sra. Ida es una madre empeñosa que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trata de sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente se dedica  a la venta de muebles del hogar, Se siente feliz pues cada vez mejora su economía. En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la compra de más sillas, mesas y stands. El anhelo de ida es ir mejorando su negocio. El grupo “Rosalía” agradece a Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Ida se encuentra parada en la parte posterior, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo negro floreado.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rosalía" consists of five enthusiastic members. This is the case with Ida, who is 38 years old and married with three dependent children.

Ida is an earnest mother who provides for her family with hard work and dedication. Ida sells home furniture. She is happy because her finances are always improving. She is requesting a loan to buy more chairs, tables and stands. She longs to improve her business.

The Rosalía group is grateful to Kiva for its support. Ida is standing in the back in the photo. She is the first on the left and is wearing a black, floral print shirt.

loans.use: buy more chairs, tables and stands.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Cecilia, a 27-year-old, very hardworking, honest, and ever smiling mother of 4 children. 

She lives with her husband in the lush hills of Nandi hills, in the rift valley region of Kenya. 

Cecilia passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past eight years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding the large family she has requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are crops and a personal business that she does in order to provide food for her large family. 

In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. Cecilia has a free space in her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk prices in the recent past have been going up, so Cecilia, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she learned that she will not only get milk from the cow, but also manure and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms. 

Cecilia said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agricultural based loans and their interest rate is low and on a reducing basis. 

She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo and from the training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro finance institutions. 

Cecilia hopes that with the additional profits she will be able to start adding value to her business by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. 

This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her 4 school-going children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Gazmir

texts.en:
Gazmir’s profession is a barber. His name means “joyous” in English. He is 33 years old, married and has a 7-year-old son. He has been photographed with his son in front of their so-called “house” that needs repairs. The loan that he is requesting will be used for this purpose.

Gazmir owns about 2,700 square meters of agricultural land where he has planted thirty olive groves and plants for seasonal feed, such as corn and fodder, for his animals, and veggies for the family’s consumption. Also, he has two pigs and twelve chickens. Gazmir’s wife works in a shoe factory for a pay of around $220/month, and from his profession he makes some $500/month.

loans.use: to make renovations to make the house liveable, since his family lives very poorly, as seen in the background of the photograph.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en: Adelita is 45 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Adelita works very hard to provide for them. Adelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, coffee, groceries, etc. Adelita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, candies, shampoo, soap, junk foods and other groceries. In the future, Adelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, coffee, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
Dila lives in northern Albania where the cold weather is bitter and it snows a lot.  

She's been wanting to improve the living conditions of her family for a long time now; thus, this loan that she is requesting from you will be used for just that. 

In the meantime, she wanted to thank her lenders for helping her previously, and hopes that they will help her again.

loans.use: to improve the family's living condition by making some repairs to their home

loans.name: Maria Florinda
