texts.es: Doña Maria con su primer financiamiento compro los insumos agrícolas que fueron necesarios para atender sus cultivos de café, logro pagar mano de obra calificada la que ayudo a llevar a cabo el corte del grano y recolección del mismo, a la aplicación de los diferentes fertilizantes y demás que hicieron el trabajo con el que los resultados eran los esperados. Ella logro satisfacer la necesidad que tenía en ese momento gracias al crédito que fue financiado a través de los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma. Ella espera ser nuevamente apoyada con un segundo crédito para llevar a cabo nuevamente la compra de fertilizantes y demás insumos que son necesarios para proteger sus cultivos y evitar que los mismos puedan ser dañados o atacados por alguna plaga
texts.en: Maria, with her first loan, purchased the agricultural supplies that were necessary to care for her coffee crop. She managed to pay the cost for skilled labor which helped her carry out the cutting and harvest of the grain, to the application of the different fertilizers, and other work that they did, with the results as hoped for. She managed to satisfy the need that she had at that time thanks to the loan that was financed by the different investors through the platform. She hopes to again be supported with a second loan to again purchase fertilizers and other supplies that are necessary to protect her crop and prevent them from being damaged or attacked by a pest.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure, pesticides and pay labor costs to tend her coffee crop.

loans.name: Carlos Gilberto

texts.es:
Carlos es  un hombre sisero y muy amable, vive en una comunidad de Sololá, tiene 33 años de edad, y vive muy feliz mente con su familia.
Carlos es un hombre dedicado al trabajo para generar  buenos ingresos  y así poder sacar adelante a su familia, según la experiencia de Carlos, es de que gracias a los créditos que en ADICLA  se le ha dado, el mejoro sus servicios de car Wash, con esta inversión el mejoro la clientela y genero mejores ganancias, pero Carlos ahora quiere modernizar sus herramientas es por ello que solicita un nuevo crédito para poder así prestar un mejor servicio, el con este prestamo piensa comprar una bomba para lavar vehículos.
El sueño de Carlos es poder contar con este prestamo cuanto antes así poder economizar el agua y tiempo, para mejorar sus ingresos y de esa maneja poder mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Carlos is a very sincere and friendly man. He lives in a community in Sololá and is 33 years old. He lives happily with his family. Carlos is a man who is dedicated to his work to generate good income and be able to get his family ahead. It is thanks to the loans that ADICLA has given him that he has improved his car washing services. With this investment he has increased his clientele and generated higher income. But Carlos now wants to modernize his tools so he is requesting a new loan. He is thinking of buying a pump for washing cars with this loan. Carlos' dream is is to be able to obtain this loan as soon as possible to be able to save water and time, increase his revenues and in this way be able to support his family.

loans.use: to buy a pump to wash cars.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven que vela también por las necesidades de su  familia, tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres, en una comunidad de Sololá.
Carlos es un muchacho muy dedicado, trabajador y responsable, Carlos a pesar de las condiciones económicas que sus padres tienen no se a limitado a seguir estudiando, el ahora desde hace 2 años trabaja en la municipalidad de  su comunidad,  con los ingresos que el genera ayudad a sus padres al sostenimiento de su familia, Carlos es un buen estudiante, que le encanta preparase día con día para que algún día sea un gran profesional al servicio de su comunidad, pero para seguir haciéndolo  Carlos tienen un inconveniente que él no cuenta con una computadora,  entonces el viéndose ante esta necesidad ha decidió realizar un prestamo que lo utilizara para comprar una computadora, para poder seguir preparándose como  profesional.
El sueño de Carlos es conseguir este prestamo cuanto antes para poder  comprarse la computadora  y ser un buen profesional y así algún día poder comprar construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Carlos is a youth who looks out for the needs of his family. He is 23 years old and lives together with his parents in a community of Sololá. Carlos is a very dedicated, hard-working and responsible man. Carlos in spite of the economic situation of his parents has not stop studying.

He has been working for 2 years now for the municipality of his community and with the income he generates he helps his parents with the sustenance of the family. Carlos is a good student and he loves to prepare day by day to become a great professional serving his community.

But in order to continue to do this Carlos has a problem that he does not have a computer. Facing this he decided to request a loan which he will use to buy a computer so he can continue to prepare to become a professional. Carlos's dream is to get this loan as soon as possible and become a good professional and one day be able to construct his own house.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 42 years old, married, and has three children.

Divina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Divina has borrowed and paid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eleven years and also earns additional income from selling personal products.

Divina aspires to save money in order to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for her business

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Ben is a 35-year-old farmer whose main source of income is milk. He decided to concentrate his efforts in dairy farming since he comes from Kapsowar, where milk is in increasingly high demand due to an upsurge in the population. Ben is seeking a loan to buy barbed wire. His dairy cows have been trespassing and eating his neighbors' crops, which has led to massive losses for both his neighbours and him because he was forced to pay for the crops that were destroyed. Through this loan, he will save the money that he previously spent on paying for damages. All that Ben waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: To buy barbed wire to retain his dairy cows.

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para complementar la compra de un vehículo, pues su negocio está creciendo y la inversión le facilitara el traslado de la mercadería que oferta en su negocio y con la que elabora la venta de comida.
Para ella el financiamiento anterior ha sido de gran ayuda para mantener con vida la tienda y el comedor, la economía familiar ha mejorado permitiéndole así dar a sus hijos una mejor educación y alimentación.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting new financing for the purchase of a vehicle, as her business is growing and the investment will make it easier for her to transport the merchandise that she sells in her business and uses for making her food sales.

The previous financing has been a great help to her in keeping the store and food stand alive, and her family’s financial situation has improved, allowing her to provide her children with a better education and diet.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle, as her business is growing, and the investment will make it easier for her to transport her merchandise.

loans.name: Lusera

texts.en:
Lusera is 48 years old and lives with her retired parents in the village Agarak of Lori region. 

Lusera completed a higher education and for many years now has been working as an accountant at the local school. 

She successfully manages both her work and farming activities, for which she has good plans. In her farm she has cows, calves, sheep, and also a lot of beehives. With the help of her parents she sells her farm products such as milk, meat, and eggs to retailers. 

Her farm’s honey is the best in the village and she has a lot of customers, who impatiently wait for the season in order to buy honey from Lusera’s farm. 

She has been doing her best to keep the farm in perfect running order since her father established it.

She asked for a loan in the amount of 700,000 Armenian drams to buy several bulls and also hay for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy several bulls and hay for her cattle

loans.name: Yedida

texts.en: Yedida lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is a hardworking woman who wants a loan to buy general merchandise like sugar, salt and soap. After running a retail shop for sometime, her greatest desire is to expand her business into wholesale to earn more profits despite how the difficulty of inadequate capital affects her business returns.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Seap's Group

texts.en:
Aged 52 years old, Seap is a married mother of two children living in a rural village of the Prey Prorsob district of Kratie province, Cambodia. Pig raising is the main source of the family’s income. She has been in this business for 36 years.

Seap’s group consists of two members who are both female, living in the same village. She is a first-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pig feed. She hopes to fatten her pig.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov, 41, is married and lives with her husband and four children in a village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is a rice farmer who has been farming rice for 23 years. To supplement the income, she also works as a paid worker. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day.

This is the third cycle for Pov with Kiva's partner VisionFund. The past loans have helped her to better support her business. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to get more crops from her farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Kenya Leonor

texts.es:
Kenya es una joven de 19 años de edad, residente de lorica un barrio humilde, con problemas de orden público, pero ante todo con muchas personas de buen espíritu y ganas de darle un cambio radical a su vida.
Kenya quiere estudiar, tener vivienda propia, tener locales comerciales, dejar su huella en el mundo, ser un ejemplo a seguir de los pequeños que están en futuro y por eso solicita un préstamo con la intención de iniciar una actividad productiva, la cual es venta de mercancía de uso personal, como crema dentales, productos de aseo para el hogar entre otros.
Con este apoyo ella dispondrá de capital suficiente para surtirse y poder comenzar de manera rápida una forma de sostenimiento para ella y su familia, esperando tener progreso para no solo trabajar si no también estudiar.
texts.en: Kenya is a 19 year old youth who lives in Lorica a poor neighborhood with some law and order issues. But also with many people of good spirit and the desire to make radical changes in their lives. Kenya wants to study, have her own home, her own business, leaving her footprint in the world. And be an example for the children she will have in the future to follow. So she is requesting a loan with the intention of starting a productive business of selling personal use products like tooth paste and cleaning products for the house amongst others. With this support she will have sufficient capital to stock up and start rapidly a way to sustain herself and her family. She hopes to progress so she doesn't only have to work but can also study.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products like tooth paste, lotions amongst others to begin her sales.

loans.name: Lin

texts.en:
Lin is aged 22 years old and married. She lives with her husband and one small child in a rural area located in the Prey Prorsorb district, Kratie province. 

She makes a living through farming rice and selling grocery items. Having been in this business four years, she can earn about 20,000 KHR per day to feed the family, but she can only manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day.

This is the first loan for Lin with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now requesting a loan of 4,000,000 KHR, she is going to use this loan to purchase more grocery items for her store and use a portion of it to pay for labor fees for operating her farm. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for her store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has an animal sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.  

Elvira is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Shaheen Akhtar

texts.en:
Shaheen Akhtar is a 42-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. Her husband has been running a carton shop for past 18 years. He is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Shaheen Akhtar's husband wants to purchase different kinds of cartons and papers for business purposes, but due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy all these things to resell. Therefore Shaheen Akhtar has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these things and also help him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.

Shaheen Akhtar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his business.

loans.name: Najuma

texts.en:
Najuma is a 29-year-old mother of one, aged three years, from Kambuzi, Kigoma, Bushenyi district. She is a drug shop operator who works 12 hours a day. She started this business on July 15, 2013 to generate an income and treat the local population which was in need in her area. She was referred to UGAFODE by one of the institution’s clients and so this is her first loan from UGAFODE.

She has applied for a loan of UGX 5,000,000 to purchase construction materials for her building which is under construction, where she will transform the drug shop to enlarge it into a bigger clinic. She hopes to have a good and standard medical facility around the Kambuzi area to treat the sick who are mostly her clients. She faces the challenge of most clients coming to buy drugs and not having enough money plus poor government policies that are ever against the operation of a drug shop. Also, without forgetting the lack of enough income to buy in bulk which would give her leverage on price thus availing herself of cheaper drugs for the local population. She describes herself as an honest lady and thanks UGAFODE as a whole very much for the support rendered to her in the business.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for expanding the drug shop

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armand is 29 years old and a single man who works as an accountant in the district’s administration. His family has been practicing agriculture for about 25 years now and so has Armand since his late teens. They own about 24 dynyms of agricultural lands (one dynym is 1/10th of a hectare). In 11 of them are planted cherry orchards and 1 dynym has an apple orchard. Note that his village is built in the hills where orchards are considered most appropriate for the geography. On 5 dynyms they plant wheat and rye and the other 5 they have rented out for $150/year.

Armand is requesting this loan to renovate the family house.

loans.use: to make renovations to the family home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, lime, sand, and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her cover her university fees

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Joel works hard to support his family.

Joel has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling sea-shells. 

Joel is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for his fishing business.

Joel has been sustaining his business activities through his past 13 loans from NWTF. 

He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream of saving enough money to expand his business and continue to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 32-year-old married man from Deir El Balah city. He lives with his wife and one small son. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also has a rickshaw where he transfers goods for the local traders. It is a good business and supports the family with a good income.

Abdallah took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw in place of the old one. By taking this loan, Abdallah will be able to improve his business and increase his income.

Abdallah appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw in place of the old one.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Benkan sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques; Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban Koulouba l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, produits cosmétiques (mèches à cheveux, encensoirs,…), des habits de la fripouille, de l’échalote, de l’oignon et du poisson fumé. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ier  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa  (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande renommée dans la vente de mèches de meilleures qualités au marché de Kalaban. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 cartons de mèches pour cheveux à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kalaban à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes. Madame Awa souhaite avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui serait utilisé pour prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The six members of the Benkan group are married women living mainly in monogamous families. On the average, they are 31 years of age, with two children. They all live in Kalaban Koulouba, a neighborhood in the city of Bamako, and know each other as neighbors as well as through their work as vendors at the Kalaban market. The group members sell cosmetics (hair extensions, incense burners etc), second-hand clothing, shallots, onions and smoked fish. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first solidarity loan.

Mrs. Awa (the one standing on the far left in the photo) is well known as a vendor selling best-quality hair extensions at the Kalaban market. She plans to use her loan to buy five bags of hair extensions in Bamako. She sells retail in Kalaban, mainly to female customers. With this loan, Mrs. Awa anticipates earning an average monthly revenue of 40,000 francs, which will be used for some everyday household needs.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions for resale.

loans.name: Gjeline

texts.en:
Gjeline, a villager and mother of three, wants your financial help to buy a dairy cow and register the land she owns in the cadaster (a public registry). Agriculture/livestock has been the practice that she has been pursuing for all these past 24 years, since the collapse of the previous regime. However, as she says, she knew nothing better to do, since she had no education or other means to earn an income for her family.

Gjeline owns about 9750 square meters of agricultural land where she has some fig and plum orchards and also grapevines and plants used mainly as feed for her animals and seasonal veggies for the family. Currently she’s got one cow, yet not of a good breed. Thus she now wants to replace it with a better one, so that it could produce more milk. She’s also got some chickens for the family’s use. Gjeline and her husband receive a retirement pension of approximately $288/month each.

loans.use: to replace a milk cow that currently does not produce much milk and register the land she owns in the cadaster.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan, who is a 21-year-old married woman, lives in the Ozurgeti district. She has a 3-year-old son and a husband who is temporarily unemployed. The family lives in poverty, having no source of income.

In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. She decided to start a trading business with a loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Ketevan’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Ketevan will purchase stock of various kinds of home products, such as bed linens, kitchen utensils, blankets and so on. She will sell the mentioned products in her community and as increased will get the chance to make minimum wage for her son's welfare.

Ketevan and her husband rely on the good will of Kiva lenders and will be very grateful for giving them a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To purchase stock of various home products and start trading

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 26-year-old married man from Deir El balah city. He lives with his wife in a small simple house. 

Fadi works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income, and also has a rickshaw he uses to transport goods for the local traders. It is a good business and helps support the family with a good income.

Fadi took a $563.00 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to replace the old one. 

By taking this loan, Fadi will be able to improve his business and increase his income.

Fadi appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Marilou is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Moayad

texts.en:
Moayad is 23 year old single man living in Ajloun with his family. 

Moayad is in his third year of studying finance. 

His father’s income is not so good these days and he could not help Moayad in covering his university fees, so Moayad is working a part-time job besides attending to his studies, 

Moayad has a talent for drawing and he likes it; he thinks of developing this talent and expanding on it after he graduates. 

He needs the loan in order to pay for a part of his semester fees, which will help him achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for a part of his semester fees

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina tiene 28 años de edad, es madre de una niña de 9 años, viven en la casa de su mamá. Karina cuenta con licenciatura en Terapia Física,  desde que salió de la universidad se le ha complicado colocarse en un puesto laboral donde reconozcan sus capacidades y buen servicio, por lo que se especializo en Fisioestética, trabajo durante dos años en Estética Tatiana Jiménez y un año en Stetik Center, después de malas experiencias laborales decide brindar sus servicios a domicilio y con ayuda de su madre comprar parte del equipo y algunos productos para ofrecer: consulta de terapia, línea de ojos permanente, masajes, cejas permanentes, limpieza facial y depilación en diferentes zonas del cuerpo. Actualmente cuenta con compresas frías y calientes, equipo de depilación, Puntas de Zafiro, calentadores de cera y una camilla portátil algo vieja. Por contar con su carnet de terapeuta consigue los productos a precios accesibles y para el equipo le brindan buenos descuentos, por lo que desea aprovechar y comprar lo antes posible lo que necesita para brindar un servicio de calidad.Hace 4 años termino su carrera universitaria y desde entonces trabaja en lo que estudio y hasta ha logrado implementar nuevas y mejoradas técnicas. 
La microempresa cuenta con un buen mercado, la mayoría son asalariados de la comunidad y barrios aledaños, desea ampliar sus zonas de atención, más ahora que cuenta con vehículo y puede trasladarse a cualquier lugar que la necesite. Asegura que los servicios que brinda siempre van a ser necesario o de continuidad para su clientela, indica que no cuenta con competencia porque nadie trabaja tan bien y barato como ella. Se diferencia de las demás estéticas porque ella cuenta con un título universitario y experiencia en esta rama. 
Ella indica que es muy consciente del cuidado al medio ambiente, por lo que utiliza pigmentación vegetal, separa los desechos y los químicos no los desecha en la tierra o alcantarillas. Desea este crédito para comprar materia prima que le permita brindar el mejor servicio con el producto adecuado, esto con el fin de lograr crecimiento empresarial y llevar el sustento a su hija.
texts.en:
Karina is 28 years old and is the mother a nine-year-old daughter, and they live in her mother’s house. She has a degree in physical therapy. 

Since Karina left the university, it has been difficult to find a job that recognizes her capabilities and good service – which is why she specialized as an aesthetician. She worked for two years at Estética Tatiana Jiménez (a beauty clinic) and one year at Stetik Center (a health spa). 

After poor working experiences, she decided to provide her services at home and with the help of her mother she bought part of the equipment and various offerings – including therapy consultations, permanent eyeliner, massages, permanent eyebrows, cleansing facials and waxing in different areas of the body. 

Currently, she has a hot and cold press, hair removal equipment, sapphire tips, a wax heater and a somewhat old portable stretcher. 

By having her therapy license, she obtains the products at an affordable price and is given a good discount on the equipment. So, she wants to take advantage and buy it as soon as possible in order to provide a quality service. Four years ago, she finished her degree at the university and since then has been working in the field she studied and has implemented new and improved techniques. 

Her small business has a good market. The majority are employed members of the community and surrounding areas. She wants to expand her area of service, now that she has a vehicle and can transport what she needs to any place. She ensures that the services she provides are always necessary or routine for her clients. She says that she has no competition because no one works as well and as affordably as her. She differentiates herself from other aestheticians because she has a college degree and has experience in the line of work. 

Katina says that she is very conscious of the environment, as she uses plant-based pigments and separates the waste and discarded chemicals in the land or sewage. She wants a loan in order to buy raw materials that will allow her to provide the best service with the right products, as well as achieve business growth and provide sustenance for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and equipment.

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en:
Eddah is a single woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a dairy farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her primary customers are dairy milk cooperative societies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of animal feeds.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy another dairy cow and animal feeds. Her business goal is to have more cows within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be independent.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy another dairy cow and animal feeds

loans.name: Yanet Roxana

texts.es:
Yanet tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su esposo en casa propia en una comunidad grande en la zona rural del distrito de Zaña que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y venta de leche, así como también a la siembra y venta de alfalfa, cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado así como para realizar reparaciones del lugar donde los cría (corrales). De esta manera Yanet espera hacer crecer más su negocio y obtener más ingresos lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yanet is 38 years old. She is in a common law marriage. She lives with her husband in her own house in a large community in the rural area of  the Zaña district. It is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru. Life in the district is peaceful. The residents work in agriculture, cattle raising and trade. 

She works raising cattle and selling milk, as well as growing and selling alfalfa. She has more than 3 years' experience in the business and very good personal and work references in the area. She is asking for the loan to buy a larger quantity of cattle as well as to make repairs to the place where she raises them (the pens). This way, Yanet hopes to grow her business more and obtain more income, which will allow her to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of cattle as well as make repairs to the place where she raises them (the pens).

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a dairy and poultry farmer dying to get her hands on the horticultural market. 

She is a proud mother and has been doing crop farming, too, for subsistence purposes. She also grows vegetables, a bit of maize and grass for her cow. 

She is seeking a loan to grow vegetables on a bigger scale for commercial gains. 

The demand for horticultural products such as fruits and vegetables has grown steadily in Kenya in recent years. They have become one of the top traded agricultural products, but there is still plenty of room to expand. 

Gladys is very excited to start commercialization of her crops. With your $25 loan, this can be easily achieved. 

She will rely on other sources of income to pay the initial installments on the loan, but in no time the horticultural farm will start pumping in income. 

The profits will be plowed back into the business to fuel growth. 

Her increased income will raise the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 29 years old, married, and has two children, who are both in school.

Jenelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jenelyn has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eleven years and also earns additional income from fruit vending.

Jenelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
Jhon es un hombre de 42 años de edad con un peculiar negocio de herrajes, se dice peculiar pues esta ubicado en una zona rural donde priman la cría de animales y la agricultura, pero de igual forma existen personas como Jhon que complementan el comercio con negocios que deben tener todo pueblo o vereda para evitar a las personas largos desplazamientos o costosos transportes de mercancía.
Jhon Inicio su actividad económica por gusto al trabajo independiente, por necesidad económica y por la necesidad de emplear su tiempo en algo productivo, y ahora viene solicitando un préstamo muy considerable para la compra de láminas y pago a proveedores.
La Razón del monto es justificada debido a que Jhon cada que va a comprar insumos lo debe hacer en grandes cantidades, básicamente porque debe desplazarse a la ciudad y el costo de transporte es muy elevado, al comprar en cantidades grandes, mitiga dichos gastos que en muchas ocasiones son innecesarios.
Jhon Solicita tu ayuda, sabe que es un monto grande pero en verdad requiere de tu apoyo de tu confianza para sacar su herrajería adelante.
texts.en:
Jhon is a 42 year old man with a peculiar business of metalwork, peculiar because it is located in a rural zone where raising animals and agriculture take precedence. But just as well there are people like Jhon who complement the market with businesses that are needed in every town or street to help people avoid long journeys or the costly expense of transporting merchandise.

Jhon started his business because he likes working independently, because of economic need and the need to spend his time doing something productive. He is now requesting a very considerable loan to buy metal sheets and to pay suppliers. The reason for the amount is justified because every time Jhon has to buy consumables he has to buy them in bulk, this is because he has to travel to the city and the transportation costs are very high, by buying in large quantities he reduces said expenses which on many occasions are unnecessary. 

Jhon is requesting your help, he knows that it’s a large amount but he really needs your support and trust to move his metalwork business forward.

loans.use: to buy steel sheets and aluminum for his shop

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Julie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Julie is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Julie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre tranquilo que goza de su vida, su actividad económica es la cría y venta de aves y ganando porcino siendo su principal ventaja es que tiene su negocio al lado de su casa, lo que le ha permitido realizar el rol de trabajador y poder estar cerca de sus hijos que tiene 4 y 1 años de edad.
Luis inicio su trabajo por gusto, quería una actividad que le permitiera estar cerca de su familia y la aprendió gracias a su hermana.
Sus metas para este año 2015 son poder generar empleo y mejorar el flujo de venta por lo que necesita un apoyo financiero para la compra de aves, alimento y cerdos, buscando tener alianzas con carnicerías o proveedores de la zona, buscando ventas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Luís is a quiet man who enjoys his life.  His business is raising and selling poultry and pigs. His principal advantage is that his business is next to his house, which has allowed him to work and be near his children, ages four and one. 

Luís started his work by choice; he wanted an occupation that would allow him to be near his family, and he learned it from his sister.

His goals for 2015 are to be able to generate employment and improve sales flow, so he needs a loan for the purchase of poultry, feed, and pigs. He is seeking partnerships with butcher shops and other suppliers in the zone, as he is seeking to sell wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase poultry, feed, and pigs, in order to improve his business.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 48-year-old married woman.  

She has been running a business in crockery sales for many years, with her husband who is also shown in the photo. 

She offers various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls etc. 

Her husband also assists her in selling them to the people of their community and in the local market. 

She makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR. 

In this way she would be able to purchase a variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls, and glasses in various sizes and designs. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase crockery such as tea sets, bowls, and glasses in various sizes and designs

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 51-year-old married woman. 

She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching.  She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. 

Some years ago she started her business of tailoring in order to run her household activities. 

At this time, she is working hard to continually earn income for her family's everyday expenses. 

She has now requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles, and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time in order to boost her earnings.  She wishes to spend her earnings on providing a quality life for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles, and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 35-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his wife and one son in a small simple house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also has a rickshaw where he transfer goods for the local traders. It is a good business and supports the family with a good income.

Nidal took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw instead of the old one. By taking this loan, Nidal will be able to improve his business and increase his income.

Nidal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw instead of the old one

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 32-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his wife in a small simple house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also has a rickshaw where he transfers goods for the local traders. It is a good business and supports the family with a good income.

Khaled took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw instead of the old one. By taking this loan, Khaled will be able to improve his business and increase his income.

Khaled appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw instead of the old one.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 29-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his wife and two daughters in a small simple house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also has a rickshaw where he transfers goods for the local traders. It is a good business and supports the family with a good income.

Ahmad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw instead of the old one. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to improve his business and increase his income.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw instead of the old one.

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es: Don Octavio es un señor que logro estudiar solamente la escuela primaria, su actividad siempre ha sido la comercialización de cerdos junto a su esposa, a través de estos ingresos ha sacado adelante a su familia sus hijos ya son independientes, ahora sus ingresos son solo para el y su pareja. Don Octavio solicita el crédito para continuar adelante con su actividad, comprara cerdos y concentrados para el engorde de los mismos, desea aprovechar la temporada buena para adquirir el producto ya que hay ocasiones que se escasean y el precio aumenta.
texts.en:
Octavio, a man who was only able to study until primary school, has always be involved in selling pigs.  He sells them with his wife and the income that the business brings in has allowed him to move his family ahead.  His children are independent now and this income only goes towards him and his wife.  

Octavio is requesting a loan to continue with his business and buy pigs and feed to fatten them.  He wants to take advantage of the current good season to get this product that is sometimes scarce or more expensive.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed to continue his pig selling business

loans.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es: María tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre, compañero de vida y  su hija.  Ella es una mujer increíble quien trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia. Su compañero de vida le apoya en la economía de su hogar y juntos van saliendo adelante. María desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, hierro, ladrillo, etc. para reparar las condiciones de su vivienda. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y de esta forma dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old and lives with her spouse, daughter, and mother in a home that she owns. María is an incredible woman who works hard, with the support of her husband, to provide for her family.

María would like to make repairs to her home so that her family can live more comfortably. She's therefore applying for a loan from FUSAI for the purchase of cement, sand, iron, bricks and other materials for home repairs. María hopes that she can rely on these funds and make these repairs as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, iron, bricks, and other materials for repairs to her home.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 50 years old, married and together with his spouse, they have been blessed with three children. He has an agro-vet business in Nyahururu town. He has been in this business for 10 years and it has been profitable. 

He plans to use this loan to buy veterinary supplies, animal medicine, fertilizer and cattle feed. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

This is his second loan from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loan successfully. His future hopes are to grow his business, be prosperous and be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy veterinary supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ma. Sol

texts.en:
Ma. Sol is 37 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Sol runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, diapers, noodles, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Sol would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Nelma works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. 

Nelma is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more charcoal to offer for sale.

Nelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Oseas Neftali

texts.es:
Oseas, tiene  necesidad de más capital de trabajo para comprar harina, manteca, azúcar, canela, etc. y también realizara reparaciones en el techo del negocio, cumplirá con las nuevas demandas y en el invierno trabajará sin molestias ocasionadas por la lluvia.
El financiamiento anterior le permitió tener insumos para elaborar la venta de pan, los ingresos están mejorando, la calidad de vida familiar es mejor y hasta la fecha no tiene dificultades en su negocio.
texts.en:
Oseas needs more working capital to buy flour, butter, sugar, cinnamon, etc., and to repair the roof of his business. He will meet his new orders and in the winter he will be able to work without any troubles caused by the rain.

The previous loan enabled him to have supplies for making bread to sell. His income is improving, his family’s quality of life is better, and so far he has not had any problems with his business.

loans.use: to make some repairs to the roof of his business and to buy flour, sugar, butter, cinnamon, and other things

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of maize so she can continue making tortillas to sell

loans.name: Yenoq

texts.en:
Yenoq is a hairdresser with eight years of experience working in that sphere. 

He works and lives in Armavir with his wife and 5-year-old son. 

Yenoq works at a local beauty salon. Due to the high quality work and service which he provides to his clients, Yenoq has a good clientbase. 

He has now applied for this loan to purchase tools and materials needed for providing hairdressing services. 

He will be very grateful to lenders for their support and trust. 

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for providing hairdressing services

loans.name: Isaura Patricia

texts.es:
Ella es Isaura, quizás puede ser una mujer muy humilde, no tener condiciones de vida optimas, pero tiene un gran corazón y ganas de progreso, su afán por mejorar en todo el término su vida, la llevo a pensar en implementar un proyecto que a la vez tiene un lindo sentido social.
Como saben un pc, internet son dos cosas que se han convertido en necesidad, pero en muchos rincones del planeta hay personas que sueñan con tener esto pero que no pueden, y todos estos impedimentos giran en base al capital que necesita para tenerlo que bien no es mucho, pero con eso pueden comprar un alimento.
Isaura pide una ayuda, para iniciar un negocio de café internet, con dos intenciones, una es tener una actividad económica para sostenerse y la otra es brindarle a este sector tan pobre un negocio para que disfruten de esta tecnología, por ende les pide el favor que le presten para la compra de computadores, pagar la conexión y software para administrar los tiempos.
texts.en:
Isaura is a very humble woman. She doesn’t have optimal living conditions, but she has a huge heart and the desire to get ahead. Her eagerness to improve her life, in every meaning of the word, led her to think of implementing a project that at the same time has a beautiful social significance.

As you know, a computer and the Internet are two things that have become necessary, but in many corners of the world there are people who dream of having these things but can’t have them. All of these impediments are centred on the capital that they need to get these things. What they have is not much, but with it they can buy food.

Isaura is asking for help so she can start an Internet café business with two goals: one is to have a job to support herself, and the other is to bring a business to this very poor area that will allow the people to enjoy this technology. Therefore, she is asking you to lend her the money so she can buy computers, pay for the Internet connection, and buy software for managing the time spent on the computers.

loans.use: to buy computers, pay for an Internet connection, and buy software for managing the time spent on the computers

loans.name: Agim

texts.en: Agim's son is pursuing a masters degree in political science. This is the reason why Agim is seeking your help again, to pay for his son's schooling fees. The father, Agim, and Moisi, the son, are in the photograph.

loans.use: to pay for his son's university schooling fees.

loans.name: Hector David

texts.es: Hector, tiene 27 años de edad, esta soltero, vive en compañía de su madre en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Siguatepeque, cerca a Taulabe. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura con su familia, y ya cuenta con su propio cultivo de café, ya que es mas rentable, esta producción la vende en la misma zona a intermediarios o mercados locales. Esta solicitando un prestamo por 25,000 lempiras para comprar abonos, e insumos y fertilizar su finca de café para preparar la próxima cosecha. Su plan es mejorar la producción y los ingresos.
texts.en:
Hector is 27 years old and single.  He lives with his mother in a village that is part of the municipality of Siguatepeque, near Taulabe.  He has been farming with his family since he was very young, and now he has his own coffee crops, since that is more profitable.  He sells his products to middlemen or at local markets.  

He is applying for a loan of 25,000 lempiras to buy manure and agricultural inputs to fertilize his coffee plantation to prepare for the next harvest.  His plan is to improve his production and income.

loans.use: to buy manure and agricultural inputs to fertilize his coffee plantation

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
Rubén es un hombre de 46 años de edad, felizmente casado que inicio en el año 2006 un negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la cual con responsabilidad, largas jornadas laborales, empeño, sacrificio ha ido convirtiendo en una salsamentaría, oferta productos como verduras, abarrotes, productos congelados, dulces, snaks, etc., una amplia variedad.
Con este negocio del cual aprendió gracias a su hermana logra generar los recursos para su familia, para sus padres, su esposa y al ser un negocio tan grande necesita un monto considerable para surtirlo, por ende solicita un préstamo para abastecer su negocio, comprando abarrotes, dulces, galletería, frituras en bolsa, chocolates, verduras y frutas.
Con el negocio aspira poder comprar una vivienda propia pero asegurando siempre la sostenibilidad y competitividad de su salsamentaría.
texts.en:
Rubén is 46 years old, happily married since 2006, and runs a grocery store, diligently putting in long days. Rubén's great efforts and sacrifices have allowed him to make the build a successful business. The store offers a great variety of vegetables, groceries, frozen goods, candies, snacks, and other items. 

It was Rubén's sister who taught him to run a store, and the business has allowed him to provide for his family, including his parents. The growth of the business means that Rubén needs a sizable amount of capital to stock it, so he's applying for a loan. He plans to use the loan funds to purchase grocery items, candies, biscuits, snacks in bags, chocolates, vegetables,a nd fruits.  

Rubén would like to use the income from the store to buy his own home, but also wants to ensure that his business is sustainable and competitive.

loans.use: to stock her business by buying grocery items, candies, biscuits, snacks in bags, chocolates, vegetables, and fruit.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat  is 45 years old, and a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo), who assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Nusrat is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers efficiently. She wants a boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers efficiently.

loans.name: Maria Irene

texts.es: Maria está muy agradecida y satisfecha con el crédito anterior ya que con el mismo ella pudo dar una mejor asistencia y mantenimiento a su plantación de café previo a la temporada de corta y gracias a eso el grano fue sólido, de buen tamaño y la cosecha fue buena de acuerdo a la cantidad de tierra que cultiva. Este año el precio del café estuvo bueno por lo que cancelaron antes de la fecha estipulada. Ella manifiesta que gracias a la ayuda y facilidad de pago que COMIXMUL dio logro los resultados esperados y eso es muy importante para ella y su familia mejorando los ingresos y su plantación de café. Ella solicita su segundo crédito para nuevamente asistir sus cultivos de café los cuales es una nueva temporada y requieren de mantenimiento y nuevamente atención para poder obtener nueva cosecha que mejorar la misma maximizando las ganancias y el bienestar en su familia esperando pueda ser apoyada por segunda ocasión.
texts.en: Maria is very grateful and satisfied with the previous loan since with it she was able to give better help and maintenance to her coffee crop from the previous season. Thanks to it, the bean was solid and had a good size. The harvest was good for the quantity of land she cultivates. This year, the price of coffee was good and they paid before the agreed upon date. She says that thanks to the help and ease of payment that COMIXMUL gave her the results were better than expected and that is very important for her and her family, improving the income and her coffee crops. She is asking for her second loan to help her coffee crops. It is a new season and they need maintenance and attention to be able to obtain a new harvest to improve it, maximize profits and her and her family's well being. She hopes to be supported this second time.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, foliar spray and to pay for labor to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Aasia

texts.en:
Aasia is a 42-year-old married woman.  She runs a small boutique at home along with her husband (also shown in the photo) to provide for her family. 

She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews, and then sells it to the people of her local area. 

She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Aasia  has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demands, and therefore improve her net income and her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demands

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat  is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of 3 children.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services  in her community. She has been doing it for many years. 

She's very well known for her stitching techniques. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  

She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to sew more dresses on time. 

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors, and packs of zippers and buttons to sew more dresses

loans.name: Hugo Rene

texts.es:
Hugo es un hombre de 28 años de edad, él está unido de hecho con su esposa  y tienen 1 hijo de 2 años que se encuentra todavía bajo el cuidado de su familia, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Hugo para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica desde hace 2 años a prestar sus servicios como policía municipal de tránsito en su comunidad. Hugo es un hombre que le preocupa la seguridad de su familia, ahora se ha puesto a ver en la necesidad de la familia y se a dado cuenta que una de las necesidades prioritarias es remodelar la casa, pero una de las limitaciones de Hugo es que no cuenta con una cantidad suficiente  para realizar esta remodelación, Hugo ahora ha considerado de que necesita de un prestamo, este prestamo él lo utiliza para comprar vidrios para ventana, balcones, puertas, piso cerámico.
 El sueño de Hugo es poder optar a este prestamo para empezar a remodelar su casa y darle a su familia una mejor casa pues el cuenta con la ayuda de la esposa quien la ayudara a pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Hugo is a 28-year-old man. He is married. He and his wife have a two-year-old son who is still in the care of his family. He lives in the community of Sololá.

In order to generate income and support his family, Hugo has been working as a municipal traffic officer in his community for two years. Hugo is a man who is concerned for the safety of his family. Now he has set himself to thinking about his family’s needs and he has realised that one of the priorities is to remodel his house, but one of Hugo’s limitations is that he doesn’t have enough money to do the remodelling. Hugo now thinks that he needs a loan. He will use this loan to buy balcony railings, doors, glass for the windows, and ceramic tiling.

Hugo’s dream is to be able to get this loan in order to begin remodelling his house so he can give his family a better house. He has the help of his wife, who will help him to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy balcony railings, doors, and glass for the windows

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 6 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a developing area and her primary customers are regulars. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of hair braids. Her business goal is to open more business branches within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will meet her family's financial needs. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of hair braids.

loans.name: Sol De Viracochasi Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOL DE VIRACOCHASIa,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate,provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia María tiene 50 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, abono entre otros.
La  socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank Sol de Viracochas, located in the district of Echarate, province of La Convención and department of Cusco.  She is 50 years old and separated, with 4 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her fruit cultivation business.  She has been doing it for a long time and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts in every day.  She wants to be able to continue working and therefore continue to support her family.  

Maria is applying for a loan to buy seeds and manure, among other things.  She feels grateful for the loan and she is committed to fulfilling her established quotas.  The other group members make a living in agriculture and animal husbandry.  The group members who appear in the attached photo asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure, among other things

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel is 41 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Jocel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell.

Jocel has borrowed and paid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Jocel aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
El señor Víctor Saritama un hombre de 60 años es felizmente casado esa relación tienen 7 hijos ya todos mayores de edad el mayor tiene 37 años y el último tiene 19 años, él se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería en la finca produce cacao y leche, la esposa le ayuda en la finca en la recolección del cacao y en el ordeño de la vacas, aprendieron de esta actividad en su niñez ya que fueron criados en una finca y sus padres se dedicaban a esta actividad, al negocio le dedican un promedio de 8 horas diarias entre el ganado y el cacao.
Ellos viven y tienen el negocio en el recinto playas del rio Blanco un lugar de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora, a este recinto llegan turistas nacionales y extranjeros a disfrutar de los maravillosos paisajes y sitios de descanso que encontramos en la vía.
El señor Víctor solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio del cacao comprará abonos para continuar con la producción, con esta nueva inversión mejorarán la producción de Cacao y los ingresos económicos y mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia, el señor Víctor agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Víctor Saritama is a 60 year old man. He is happily married and has 7 children, all of them grown. The oldest is 37 and the youngest is 19. He works in agriculture and raising cattle. In the farm, he produces cacao and milk. His wife helps him in the farm by harvesting the cacao and by milking the cows. They learned this activity in their childhood, as they were raised on a farm and their parents did this activity. They work at this activity an average of 8 hours a day between the cattle and the cacao.

They live and have the business in the community of Playas of Rio Blanco. It has a warm climate and is full of friendly and hardworking people. Tourists from the country and from abroad go to enjoy it's beautiful scenery and restful places found along the way.  

Víctor is asking for this loan to invest in the cacao business. He will buy fertilizer to continue with production. With this new investment, he will improve the cacao yield and his income, as well as improve his quality of life. Víctor is grateful to the Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the support and the opportunity that has been given.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and continue with production.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a 54-year-old married woman, and has four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Melinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Melinda requested a 17,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Melinda has been in this business for 18 years. 

In the future, Melinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Nora De Jesus

texts.es:
Ella es Nora una mujer soltera y cabeza de familia de 43 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos que necesita mucho de tu ayuda.
Hablando un poco de Nora una persona que desea iniciar empresa, una de confección para ser más exactos, es una mujer humilde y muy trabajadora, entregada cuerpo y alma a sus hijos, aprendió del oficio de la confección gracias a una hermana y a talleres donde se empleaba.
Como se mencionó anteriormente Nora  desea iniciar su propio negocio la razón es básicamente que trabajar como empleada en una fábrica demanda de muchas horas para cumplir la meta y el salario es muy bajo.
Por eso con tu apoyo Comprara una maquina fileteadora, insumos como hilos, telas, y accesorios de adornos de prendas con la intención de mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y sus 4 hijos que tiene a cargo.
texts.en:
Nora is a single mother and the head of her family. She is 43 years old and has four children who really need her help.

Nora wants to start her own business: a dressmaking business, to be more precise. She is a humble and very hard-working woman and is completely devoted to her children. She learnt how to make clothes from one of her sisters and at the workshops where she used to work.

As mentioned previously, Nora wants to start her own business. The reason is basically because working as an employee in a factory takes up many hours and the salary is very low.

For this reason, with your help, she will buy an overlocker, as well as supplies, such as threads, fabrics, and trimmings, with the intention of improving her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an overlocker and supplies, such as threads, fabrics, and trimmings

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is a 42 year old married man, from the village Chanieti. He lives with his wife and her family and doesn't have any significant income for covering even basic needs. The family only gets money from pensions and most members are temporarily unemployed, as in the region there is a high unemployment rate.
Zaza has just started work as an artisan's assistant and gets a really small salary. He has a great desire to purchase his own tools. These are necessary to do the work well, get costumers' loyalty, and start work on his own. Zaza needs financial support to realize his plans and requested a loan to local financial institutions. His request was rejected several times for not having enough income and for his family's poor living condition. After all of this, Zaza has been approved with this loan of 600 GEL, through the start-up program that gives chances to poor people to start or re-start their own businesses.
With the help of Kiva lenders Zaza will get the chance to increase productivity of his work, generate more, and get his own costumers. He awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase artisan's tools and increase productivity.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is a 49-year-old single woman from a small village in Tsoniarissi. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and little grandson. 

Manana supports the family on her own and does her best to create financial stability for its members. She works hard on the family-owned agricultural land, growing beans, tomatoes, cucumbers, and peppers. Manana also takes care of cattle and sells agricultural products at the local market. in addition to these activities, she is a teacher at the local public school and gets a small fixed salary.

She is the only employed person in the family, but she is unable to generate significant salary for her family's welfare. Manana requested a loan to improve her sources of significant income and to improve the financial condition of the family. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  

Manana will buy a mini-bus and use it on a bus-line, that will transport  local people from one district to another. 

She is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to ensure her family's living condition.  

This credit will be a great support for the family. Manana is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving her a chance to generate significant income.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus

loans.name: Melvin Carmen

texts.es:
Melvin, de 26 años de edad, es un joven muy responsable, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casado y su esposa se dedica a cuidar a su pequeña hija de 14 meses de edad.

Melvin, es empleado de una granja de gallinas, que está a 8 kilómetros de su vivienda, por esa razón se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para estar puntual en su trabajo.

Melvin, necesita el crédito, para terminar de construir un cuarto, para que él y su familia vivan más cómodos.

Sus sueños son, tener una casa más amplia, con un bonito jardin para que su hija tenga espacio para jugar y para cuando decida tener mas hijos, tambien desea tener un trabajo mejor.
texts.en:
26-year-old Melvin is a very responsible young man.  He studied until high school.  He is married and his wife is dedicated to taking care of their small 14-month-old daughter.  

Melvin is an employee at the chicken farm that is located 8 kilometers from his home, so he wakes up at 4 a.m. so that he can arrive at work on time.  

Melvin needs this loan to finish the construction of a room so that he and his family can live more comfortably.  

His dream is to have a more spacious house with a beautiful garden that his daughter can have space to play and for when they decide to have more children.  He also wants to find a better job.

loans.use: to finish the construction of a room in his house

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está soltera y se dedica a cuidar a sus padres, ya que todos sus hermanos se casaron e hicieron sus hogares.

Juana, es una mujer muy luchadora, siempre a dado todo por sus padres, su trabajo ahora consiste en comprar y vender cobijas y mosquiteros; su madre y ella atienden el negocio, no tiene hijos y vive unicamente con sus padres.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar más cobijas y mosquiteros y asi tener más ganacia y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Sus sueños son abarcar más territorio en venta y obtener mejores ganancia.
texts.en:
Juana is 46 years old. She went to school up to the third grade. She is single and she takes care of her parents, since all of her siblings are married and have started their own families.  

Juana is a woman who is a fighter. She has always given everything for her parents. Her work now consists of buying and selling blankets and mosquito nets. She and her mother run the business. She has no children and just lives with her parents.

She needs the loan to buy more blankets and mosquito nets so she can make more profit and improve her quality of life.

Her dream is to cover more sales territory and obtain more profits.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and mosquito nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks to renovate her bathroom

loans.name: La Paz Group

texts.es:
La Paz es el nombre de un grupo formado desde 2007 en una comunidad donde 90% de los habitantes ha entregado la mayor parte de su vida a trabajar en el campo en la siembra, cuidado y cosecha de la caña de azúcar. Algunos de ellos también siembran maíz, frijol y calabazas principalmente para autoconsumo y venta en ciertos casos.

El nombre del grupo surgió por el gran derecho de tener paz, y de un símbolo de tranquilidad en cada uno de los negocios, hoy en día el grupo está integrado por:

Dora - Agroquímicos                                    
Griselda,  Raquel - Antojitos                                      
Ma. Francisca -  Manualidades                                                                                
Erika - Dulces                                                          
Josefa, José - Abarrotes                                                             
Claudia – Ropa Americana                                          
Yolanda -Pollo                                     
Leyla – Frituras, Elotes                                                 
María – Servilletas                                        
Angélica -Chicharrones        
Lorena -  Ropa Por Catalogo  

Doña Griselda es conocida por todos como la Güera, es madre de 6 hijos de los cuales ya solo uno depende económicamente de ella. Griselda se convirtió en madre desde los 14 años y desde entonces ha enfrentado y superado demasiados acontecimientos. Hace 10 años, motivada por su hija Raquel, inició con la venta de antojitos en un local ubicado sobre la calle principal y más transitada del municipio. La primera semana de ventas fue difícil porque otros tres comenrciantes iniciaron con el mismo negocio, sin embargo, el servicio al cliente, la variedad de antojitos y su sazón es lo que ha hecho que su negocio sea productivo. Además Griselda trabaja en dos periodos al día: de 7:00 am a 2:00 pm vende antojitos y de 6:00 a 8:00 vende tacos y tortas, de esta manera las ganancias son mayores.

Todos sus préstamos los ha invertido en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los antojitos, refrescos, gas, sillas, mesas, manteles, platos, vasos y ha realizado algunos cambios en el local “Gracias a cada uno de los prestamos que me han sido otorgados he logrado el crecimiento en mi negocio, le he brindado una mejor calidad de vida a mi familia". Con el nuevo préstamo comprará tortillas de harina, carne, aceite, queso, chiles, platos, vasos, cacerolas y refrescos.“He formado un patrimonio para mi familia y sé que al igual que yo mi hija continuara con el negocio” Griselda expresa uno de sus grandes sueños.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el pequeño local donde "La güera" vende sus antojitos; ella viste blusa negra con cuadros color naranja y su hija Raquel una blusa color rosa.
texts.en:
La Paz [Peace] is the name of a group formed in 2007 in a community where 90% of residents have spent the majority of their life working in the countryside planting, tending, and harvesting sugarcane. Some of them also plant corn, beans, and pumpkins, mainly for their own consumption but in some cases to sell.

The group's name references the essential right to be at peace and it symbolizes tranquility for each of their businesses. Currently, the group includes: Dora (agrochemicals); Griselda, Raquel (snacks); María Francisca (handicrafts); Erika (sweets); Josefa, José (groceries); Claudia (American clothing); Yolanda (chickens); Leyla (fried foods & corn on the cob); María (napkins); Angélica (pork cracklings); and Lorena (clothing, by catalog).

Everyone knows Griselda as la Güera [the blonde]. She is the mother of 6 children, of whom only one still depends on her economically. Griselda became a mother when she was 14 years old, and from then on, she has confronted and overcome too many obstacles.

Ten years ago, motivated by her daughter Raquel, she started selling snacks from a location on the high-traffic main street of the city. The first week of sales was tough because three other sellers started the same business, but good customer service, a variety of snacks, and her seasoning have made her business successful. Also, Griselda works 2 shifts each day -- from 7am to 2pm she sells snacks, and from 6 to 8pm she sells tacos and sandwiches -- so she sees higher earnings.

She has used all of her loans to purchase supplies to make her snacks, soda, gas, chairs, tables, tablecloths, plates, glasses, and some changes to her locations. "Thanks to each of the loans that have been given to me, I have succeeding in growing my business. I have given my family a high quality of life." With this new loan, she will buy flour tortillas, meat, oil, cheese, chiles, plates, glasses, pots, and soda.

"I have started a heritage for my family and I know that, like me, my daughter will continue the business," Griselda says, expressing one of her greatest dreams.

*The photo was taken in the small shop where "la Güera" sells her snacks. She is wearing the black shirt with orange diamonds, and her daughter Raquel is in the pink shirt.

loans.use: to buy flour tortillas, meat, oil, cheese, chiles, plates, glasses, pots, and soda

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Gilda works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen food business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Gilda is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Gilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 46 years old,married, and has three children, one of whom is in school.

Erna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Erna has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Erna aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 57 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children.

She has been in the business of animal sales and purchase with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. 

Both are working hard to meet their family expenses. Now, Nasreen has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR. 

She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. 

She desires of improving her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, estudió hasta tercer año en la universidad, está soltero, se desempeña con el cargo de enlace gerencial y dedica su tiempo a esa laborar con mucho esmero y alegria.

Carlos, se siente orgulloso de trabajar porque gracias a eso puede pagarse sus estudios, em su tiempo libre ayuda a sus tias en un negocio de panaderia.

Carlos, necesita el crédito para terminar de pagar una computadora, ya que con eso puede hacer sus tareas de la universidad y obtener un mejor rendimiento académico.

Su sueño es terminar su carrera y obtener su titulo para desempeñarse en lo que ha estudiado.
texts.en:
Carlos is single and he studied until his 3rd year of university.  He makes a living as a managerial liaison and dedicates his time to happily carrying out his job with great care.
