Carlos is proud to be working because it allows him to pay for his studies.  In his free time, he helps his aunts with their bakery business.

Carlos needs this loan to finish paying for a computer which allows him to do his university homework and improve his academic performance.  

His dream is to finish his schooling and get his degree so that he can make a living in the field that he studied.

loans.use: to finish paying for a computer

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 42-year-old married woman, and the mother of 3 children. 

The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all the household expenses, so she initiated her business selling milk. She has been doing this for many years and has become popular for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business, and currently she has requested for a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta, 34 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. 

She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Shagufta  needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. 

She has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc., to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc., to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings

loans.name: Maria Pilar

texts.es: Doña Maria es agricultora y se dedica al cultivo de café actividad que aprendió a realizar desde muy pequeña ya que sus padres se dedicaron a este rubro toda su vida. Doña Maria se encuentra muy feliz y muy satisfecha ya que con la ayuda económica de su primer financiamiento el cual fue financiado por la cooperativa COMIXMUL en alianza con los inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA, pudo comprar los diferentes insumos para poder darle a sus cultivos de café el mantenimiento y cuidado posible como la limpieza, aplicación de abono, foliares entre otros que al final de la cosecha logro obtener excelentes resultados vendiendo el grano a sus intermediarios y recibiendo el capital esperado para poder salir con su compromiso de pago. Actualmente ya que su plantación quedo un poco deteriorada ya que mediante la corta del grano la planta se daña y queda débil y expuesta por lo que solicita un segundo financiamiento el cual invertirá en la compra de abono  y limpia a su plantación, preparación de tierra entre otros ayudando a mejorar su producción y agrandar su negocio. Su familia es muy numerosa compuesta por 6 hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando la primaria y a los cuales quiere seguir apoyando para que se gradúen, y su hijos mayores son el apoyo de ella, más el esposo que se dedica a la agricultura.
texts.en: Maria is a farmer and she grows coffee. She learned this activity from the time she was young, because her parents did this type of work her whole life. Maria is very happy and satisfied since with the financial help with her first loan, financed by the COMIXMUL cooperative in alliance with the Kiva platform.  she was able to buy different materials to do maintenance and care on her coffee crops. For example, weeding, applying fertilizer, foliar sprays and more. At the end of the harvest, she obtained excellent results selling the beans to intermediaries, receiving the capital she hoped for to be able to get ahead with her payment commitment. Right now, her crops are a little deteriorated since by harvesting the beans the plan is damaged and it is weak and exposed. That is why she is asking for a second loan to invest in buying fertilizer and in weeding the crops, preparing the soil, and more, to help the yield and to expand the business. Her family is very big, made up of 6 children, 2 of whom are in primary school. She wants to keep supporting them so that they can graduate. Her older children help her, as does her husband, who does farming.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials and to pay for labor to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Akotobu Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of five people who are involved in businesses in vegetables, meat, fish, maize, second hand clothing, cosmetics, and sauce pans. It includes people from the same area who have an obvious desire to improve their living conditions. 

Their main work involves small-scale commerce. Patience (standing at far right in the photo) is the featured borrower of the group. 

She is 35 years old, married, and her two children go  to school. She is very active in the group and has experienced good progress since joining it. 

She is a vendor of second hand clothing. She will purchase ladies second hand clothing to sell to her customers. 

She will use the profits in part to increase her savings and to develop her commerce, as well as to take care of her home.

loans.use: to purchase ladies second hand clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Hafeez

texts.en:
Hafeez is 59 years old, married, and a mother of 4 children. She has been doing tailoring for many years to assist her husband. 

Unfortunately, if her husband works alone, they will not be able to meet the household expenses and educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family as well. 

She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. 

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Now she has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces to meet the orders on time. 

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

Hafeez hopes to increase her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons, and laces to meet the orders on time

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 31 years old and married. Together with her spouse, she has been blessed with 2 children aged 10 and 3 years old. Esther also supports people in her family. 

She has a clothes selling business in Kapsabet town and has been in this business for 15 years. She will be using this loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Andrea works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables. Andrea is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Andrea has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha has successfully built her business selling animals with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 4th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats to inflate her sales to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats to inflate her sales to increase her earnings.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen  is 46 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Perveen ’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Perveen  has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires along with spare parts and tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Perveen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with spare parts and tools.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 49 years old and a single mother of two children. She also supports five children in her family. She does dairy farming in Kapsabet town and has been in this business for 15 years. 

She will be using this loan to buy dairy feeds for her dairy cows. She will use the anticipated profits to build houses for renting. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to be successful.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 54 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.  Adelaida works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Adelaida has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 50 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Arvin

texts.en:
Arvin is single and has a used clothing business in the Philippines.

Arvin requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase a bundle of used clothes to sell.

Arvin has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Arvin would like to save enough money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks to build extra rooms.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en:
Hameedan is a 47-year-old woman. She has been doing a business of animal sale and purchase for many years with her son (also shown in the photo). 

She is keen to provide her family with a better standard of living. Now, she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Alberto Enrique

texts.es:
Alberto es un joven muy decidido, y aterrizado en lo suyo, a sus 21 años de edad tiene su futuro como comerciante independiente muy definido sin dudas, ni nada, con esfuerzo, trabajo y ahorros inicio un negocio de venta de helados y legumbrera, actividad que inicio necesidad económica y por gusto al trabajo independiente. 
Alberto al iniciar primeramente con sus ahorros se le ha presentado necesidad que solo las puede cubrir invirtiendo y para lograr los objetivos que se trazó para este año 2015 como lo son expandir su local, sostenibilidad de su negocio, generar empleo, para lograr un objetivo a largo plazo de comprar vivienda debe invertir un poco.
Alberto solicita un crédito para la compra de estanterías y surtido para ambos negocios, dándole un impulso a su negocio con el afán de lograr una estabilidad económica y consolidación de sus dos negocios.
texts.en:
Alberto is a very determined young man who has come into his own. At 21, there is no doubt whatsoever that his future as an independent businessman is very clear.  With effort, work, and savings, he started a business selling ice cream and vegetables, an activity that he started out of economic necessity and a taste for working independently.

Alberto, having gotten started with his savings first, finds himself with necessities that can only be covered by investing, in order to achieve the goals that he set for 2015, such as expanding his store,  sustaining his business, and generating employment. In order to achieve his long-term goal of purchasing a home, he must invest a little.

Alberto is requesting a loan to purchase shelving and to stock both businesses, in order to boost his business.  He is eager to achieve economic stability and strengthen his two businesses.

loans.use: to purchase shelving and stock for both his businesses.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 53-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. 

Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of seven children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater for more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater for more customers.

loans.name: Laal  Khatoon

texts.en:
Laal  Khatoon along with her husband (also shown in the photo) has successfully built her business of a general store with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. 

They have attained a good number of customers and make a good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand their business. 

Now she is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase a stock of grains, oil, and biscuits along with cleaning products. This will enable them to increase their sales for better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of grains, oil, and biscuits along with cleaning products.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 27-year-old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. 

She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Najma ’s job is to look after the buffalos and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. 

However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Najma  has requested 35,000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers

loans.name: Nasim

texts.ru: Насим добрый и ответственный человек из городка Комибодом. Он человек, который хорошо знает свою работу и привык добиваться своей цели. Ему 25 лет. Насим имеет не большую столовую. Открытия данного бизнеса далось нелегко, но Насим справился со всеми трудностями. Сейчас он обратился за кредитом, потому что он хочет купить столовые приборы и оборудования для столовой. Для него это очень необходимо, чтобы удержать старых клиентов и привлечь новых. Финансовое положение страны сильно влияет на рынок и Насиму необходимо выдержать этот не легкий период. Поддержите Насима.
texts.en: Nasim is a kind and responsible person from the small town of Komibodom. He knows his trade well and is used to working hard to achieve his goals. He is 25 years old. Nasim owns a small diner. It wasn't easy to launch this business, but Nasim was able to overcome all difficulties. At present he has applied for a loan because he would like to buy silverware and equipment for his diner. This is necessary in order to retain existing customers and attract new ones. The financial situation in his country is impacting the market in a  major way, and Nasim needs to get through this challenging time. Please give Nasim your support.

loans.use: to buy silverware.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 35 years old and married. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Annabelle is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Annabelle has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 59 years old and widow with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Susan has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from boarding house rental and pig fattening.

Susan aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 61 years old, married and has five children. 

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Edna has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Monaliza works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from working in a general store. Monaliza is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Monaliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Most of Kenya’s young people struggle to put a plate of food on the table because of unemployment and lack of capital. This is true for Beatrice, 33, who is based in the Siongiroi area of Kenya and is an adorable mother. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years, and she has managed to earn a decent income.

Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal businesses she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated, “Feeding my cows.”

Her hobby is milking. She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet it. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will produce between 10-15 litres of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise.

Beatrice is very ambitious. In the near future she intends to start adding value to her milk business by packaging the milk before selling, and she also plans to start selling dairy products such as yogurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman and has been blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over four years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With the Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Seasonality is a major challenge in her business.

Ega decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan of KES 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot lives in Ejmiatsin town with his wife and two children. His wife is involved in a retail business and his two children attend the local secondary school. Ashot himself has specialized in sewing. He has good skills in sewing men and women's clothing and shoes and has a number of clients. 

Ashot has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. He needs this loan to be able to purchase materials for sewing and covering current orders.

loans.use: to pay for materials for sewing and covering current orders.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute in the family income. 

Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her eighth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will enable her to increase her milk sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Abdulbaki

texts.en:
Abdulbaki has had a long struggle to provide his children, who studied up to secondary school, with suitable living conditions. Abdulbaki lives with his large family in their own humble house in Sana'a city, Yemen.

Due to miserable family conditions, he couldn't complete his studies and started work to earn a daily wage. He has become older but has still been working as a fish seller for more than ten years. In truth, this business is the main source of income for Abdulbaki, his wife and their six children. The income from this business is very small and Abdulbaki is not able to cover the living expenses of his children. 

Abdulbaki has thought of another source of income for his poor children that he believes would be more profitable as well as suitable for him. That business is purchasing a taxi for him to work in as a driver. Unfortunately, Abdulbaki doesn't have sufficient money to get his humble business started. The purchasing of the taxi costs 1,000,000 YER. His income doesn't allow him to afford this but he didn't give up. Instead he turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank and asked for a loan of YER 1,000,000 to buy a taxi to start his new business as a driver to make money and save for his children.

Abdulbaki looks forward to opening a large commercial store alongside the taxi driving in the hope of making a better future for his children.

loans.use: to buy a taxi.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 39-year-old married husband and father of seven, aged 18,17,15,12,10, 8, and 6. All these children are school going and so he is faced with a challenge of school fees but he says since he is Muslim he can handle the challenge. 

He started this business of coffee and tea growing in 1998 to generate an income in Akayanja, Kitojo – Kakanju in the Bushenyi district. He works for eight hours a day and six days a week since he has to go to the mosque every Friday. 

He wanted to generate an income to support his family. Apart from the coffee and tea growing, he does cattle trade. This is his first loan from this institution and he has borrowed 3,000,000 UGX to buy fertilizers and goats for trade. 

His main clients are tea and coffee factories around Igara West constituency and for cattle and goats trade his clients are traders from the monthly markets in Bushenyi District. He faces a challenge of weather changes, especially the dry season which affects the tea output, and thus a reduction in incomes and price fluctuations that leave farmers in shock. Whereby a kilo of green tea leaves was at 500 UGX, now it’s at 200 UGX for coffee and tea trade but for cattle and goats trade he is faced with a challenge of diseases that attack the livestock and they end up dying. 

He hopes to buy a car to transport his tea leaves from the tea plantation to the tea factories around. He thanks UGAFODE Microfinance for the financial support that he has got from the institution and promises to be a good paying client so as to get another loan in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and goats

loans.name: Noyaa Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the Noyaa group of four women who are all merchants and live in the same neighborhood. They sell smoked fish, vegetables and waakye (cooked rice and beans).

Eva, age 42, is the group's representative. She's married and a mother. She's a merchant with more than eight years of experience in the field. She displays her waakye in her neighborhood where she sells to her customers. With this loan, she intends to buy more rice, beans, vegetables and cooking oil to prepare waakye to sell to customers. 

Her profits enable her to save money with ID-Ghana, pay her children's school fees, and also take care of her household expenses. Together all the members need a total amount of GHS 7,200 for their ninth loan cycle in order to expand their business. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans, vegetables and cooking oil to prepare waakye to sell to customers.

loans.name: Farangis

texts.ru: Фарангис молодая начинающая бизнес women не большого городка под названием Конибодом. Ей 24 года. Она пока не замужем. Фарангис по натуре очень добра и отзывчивая девушка. Она хочет открыть свою столовую. Фарангис в себе очень уверена, потому что она знает, ее поддержка и опора ее родители. Фарангис имеет свой бизнес план и огромное желание начать свой бизнес. Единственной преградой для нее является нехватка финансовых средств для покупки оборудования и кухонных приборов. Фарангис надеется, что сможете ее поддержать, и она сможет реализовать свою мечту.
texts.en: Farangis is a young novice businesswoman from the small town of Konibodom. She is 24 years old and not yet married. She is a very kind and thoughtful person. Farangis would like to open her own diner. She feels confident in herself and knows that her parents would give her support and assistance. Farangis has developed a business plan and is very enthusiastic about launching her business. The only hurdle is her lack of financial means to buy kitchen equipment. Farangis hopes that you will give her support and she will be able to make her dream a reality.

loans.use: to launch a new business and buy equipment for her diner.

loans.name: Masoud

texts.en:
Masoud, late 50s, is married with seven children. He has been selling stationery and offering printing services at his store for over ten years. He works from 8am to 9pm daily and earns a fair monthly income for his family. 

This is Masoud's sixth loan from Tujijenge. He used the previous loans to purchase items such as paper to sell at his store. He has successfully paid off all of his loans. 

Masoud plans to use this loan to purchase more inventory for his store. He hopes this loan will help him earn more profit so he can continue saving for a new printing machine. He also dreams of one day owning his own car.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his stationery store.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Grace works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugar cane. Grace is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling mats to the community. She faces a major challenge of transportation.

With the loan of Kes 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase more stock of weaving materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of weaving materials.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. The major challenge she faces is competition in her place of business.

Umazi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Tsovinar

texts.en:
Tsovinar and her husband live in the town of Ejmiatsin.  Tsovinar is engaged in the sale and breeding of ornamental birds, while her husband runs his own car as a taxi. She currently breeds a large variety of ornamental birds with great love and care. 

Tsovinar has applied for this loan to be able to renovate some lattices and purchase special forage for the birds. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of lattices and special forage for ornamental birds.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
The nice woman in the photo is Hasmik from Vayk, Vayots Dzor region. Hasmik has been involved in stone processing for four years already. In the small garage she runs a stone processing plant. After purchasing raw materials (stones), she organizes the processing with different tools and equipment and sells the final product (stones) in the local market.
 
Hasmik lives with her son, daughter-in-law and grandson. 

She has applied for this loan to pay for the renovation of the garage and to purchase materials (stone) for processing. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the garage and to purchase materials (stone) for processing

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married and she has two daughters. They are going to school. Maria is living in a rented house. She is a seamstress who fixes any kind of clothes. 

Maria needs a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine; that machine will be very helpful for her business. She would like to have her own workshop in the future. Her husband is trying to help her, but right now he is not making good money since he is starting as a salesman; so Maria is taking the responsibility to support her family. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Maclaud

texts.en:
Maclaud, who is in his early 50's is married with three children, who are still in school.  For seven years he has been running a pub business where he sells drinks and food.  He works from 11am to midnight daily and is able to earn a good monthly profit.

This will be Maclaud's 3rd loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to improve the restaurant by improving the cooking and improving the speed of making the food.  He also increased the drinks to meet customer demand.  He has paid back all his loans successfully and used the profit to pay school fees, to pay the loan dues, and cover household expenses.  

Maclaud will use this loan to increase food and drink stock.  He dreams of building his own house.

loans.use: to increase food and drink stock.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 21-year-old single woman. Two years ago, with the aim of supplementing the family’s income, she had to start working, as enhancing the family’s way of living was a necessity. She works from her home and she is a friendly and smart woman with a great knowledge on how to educate pupils. And now, she seeks a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l for buying an educational encyclopedia with the aim of expanding her experience. Fatmeh’s only objective is to teach her students well and help them attain higher levels in their life.

loans.use: to buy an educational encyclopedia

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 58-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children. The family members work together to be able in the end to please their needs. As for Sabah, she has been producing bread for the past nine years. She works at her domicile to produce fresh tasty bread. 

Presently, Sabah notes that she is in a real need of boosting her revenue for improving the family’s way of living. For that, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase raw materials and other supplies needed to increase her amount produced. Sabah is very thankful for Kiva lenders and says that this loan will definitely impact positively on her.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and other supplies

loans.name: Itab

texts.en: Itab is a 19-year-old single woman living with one parent and two working relatives. She pools resources with the family members to pay the operating expenses. Itab is a farmer who has been involved in this type of business since 2012. She works at a small plot of land where she cultivates her products. At present, Itab seeks an increase in her production as well as in her income; to do so, she is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. with the aim of buying agricultural supplies. In the future, Itab plans to open a grocery store where she will sell vegetables and fruits in addition to daily and dairy products.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Nawale

texts.en: Nawale is a 42-year-old Lebanese married woman. She has owned a beauty salon since 2011 and has one part-timer helping her serve her clientele. Nawale does her best to earn a sufficient income to afford the high cost of living and at the same time be able to pay her employee who has a family to support. With the loan she will obtain from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will buy a laser machine. Nawale says that she will be expanding her business by displaying this machine on the market, as there is a high demand for such service and that’s what will return her with superior revenue. Nawale will keep on borrowing Kiva loans for continuous improvements and developments.

loans.use: to buy a laser machine

loans.name: Hala

texts.en: Hala, a Lebanese woman, is the owner of a home appliances store. She is single and living with her parents. She cooperates with her father to receive eventually an adequate amount of money to live properly. Now, she is asking to receive a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase additional products to sell. Hala tends to attract a wider clientele by offering them their desired goods and consequently get a higher income. Hala appreciates the help that she will get thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques avec en moyenne 31 ans et 4 enfants, les quatre  femmes du groupe Benkola habitent toutes à Kalaban Koulouba l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban. Les membres du groupe font la restauration, le petit commerce de condiments, d’oignon, de fruits et légumes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à 1ier  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Robé  (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des fruits et légumes de meilleures qualités à Kalaban. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 sac d’aubergine, 5 bassines de tomate, 10 sacs de poivron, 10 planches de carotte et céleri. Elle se ravitaille à ces produits à Bamako, en carottes et céleri avec les jardiniers au bord du fleuve Niger. La revente se fait en détails au marché à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Robé espère avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui serait réinvestie dans l’activité afin d’augmenter son volume.
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkola group are married women living mainly in monogamous families. On the average, they are 31 years of age, with four children. They all live in Kalaban Koulouba, a neighborhood in the city of Bamako, and know each other as neighbors as well as through their work as vendors at the Kalaban market. The group members sell cooked dishes, cosmetics, onions, fruits and vegetables. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first solidarity loan.

Mrs. Robé (the one standing on the far left in the photo) is well known as a vendor selling  fruits and vegetables in Kalaban. She plans to use her loan to buy one bag of aubergines/eggplant, five baskets of tomatoes, 10 bags of peppers, 10 cases of carrots and celery. She stocks in Bamako and also buys carrots and celery from farmers along the Niger river. She retails the produce at the market, mainly to female customers. With this loan, Mrs. Robé anticipates earning an average monthly revenue of 50,000 West African francs, which will be reinvested in her business to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to finish renovating her home.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan is married and he has 4 daughters. They are going to school. Juan pays the rent and he works as a taxi driver. He has been driving for 10 years. His wife works as an itinerant saleswoman; she sells blankets. Juan needs a loan to pay for the maintenance of his car; it is very important to fix the front part also. He would like to have his own house in the future.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his car; it is very important to fix the front part also.

loans.name: Serengeti Group

texts.en:
Gabriel is in his early 50s, married, and has four children. For the past three years he has been purchasing spare bike parts and reselling them. He also works in a factory with his family to earn extra income. Gabriel's shifts vary, but he works about twelve hours per day and earns a minimal monthly income. 

This is Gabriel's second loan with Tujijenge. He used his first loan to increase his inventory of spare bike parts. He successfully paid back his loan and used the profits to pay for his children's school fees. Gabriel plans to use this loan to again buy more spare parts. He hopes this will help him increase his profits so he can provide a good education for his children and improve his living area. He also dreams of increasing his savings so that he can one day start a new business. 

Gabriel will be sharing this loan with his loan group, Serengeti, which consists of one other person. They will keep each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase spare bicycle parts to resell.

loans.name: Nike Air Group

texts.en:
Mohamedu is in his mid 30s, single, with two children who are in school. He has been traveling up-country to villages to buy traditional chicken. He has been in his business for five years now. Whenever he comes back from the villages he now works from 06am to take his chicken to the market place and sells up to 06pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mohamedu's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to keep on buying chicken and selling them and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. He will use this loan increase the stock of traditional chicken to meet his customers' demand. He dreams of buying a car so that whenever he goes up-country he will not need to board a bus.

Mohamedu, will share this loan with his loan group "Nike Air" which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to increase his stock of chicken to meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Mahmadraim

texts.ru:
На фотографии Махмадраим. Он проживает на районе Чилинкул. Ему 57 лет. С Махмадраимом живет его жена, две невестки и 4 внука. У него двое взрослых сыновей. На данный момент они находятся заграницей на заработках.
  Причина обращения Махмадраима за кредитом является открытие новой столовой. Он профессиональный повар национальной кухни. Он много лет работал по специальности и теперь хочет работать на себя. Махмадраим принял решение открыть столовую, он накопил денег, но достаточного капитала не имеет. Махмадраим надеется собрать необходимую сумму за счет кредита и сразу купить все оборудования, столовые приборы и многое другое. Махмадраим не так молод и он давно хотел открыть собственное заведение. Он не хочет оставлять свою мечту на долгое время. Вы сейчас можете помочь ему.
texts.en:
This is a photo of Mahmadraim. He lives in the Julikul region. He is 57 years old. He lives with his wife, two daughters-in-law and four grandchildren. Mahmadraim has two adult sons, who are outside of the country as migrant workers at present.

Mahmadraim is applying for a loan to open a new diner. He is a professional chef specializing in traditional national dishes.  After having worked in his trade for many years, he  would like to become his own boss now. Mahmadraim decided to open a diner and save some money, but his starting capital is still insufficient. Mahmadraim hopes to take a loan for the funds still needed and to buy all equipment, silverware etc at once. He is no longer the youngest and has been dreaming of his own business for a long time. He does not want to postpone his dream for much longer. It is now up to you to help him out.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies for opening a diner.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a Lebanese widowed woman living with her five children. Following her husband’s passing away, she became the main and sole income provider for the family. Financial problems brought out her tenacity, however; she was capable of starting her own small business, which consists of producing homemade food.  

Fatmeh is a hard-working woman and spends long hours trying to keep her occupation profitable.  With her requested loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she would like to purchase needed supplies, which will significantly ease her preparations. In the future, she looks forward to borrowing additional Kiva loans with the aim of opening her own food store.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies

loans.name: Tunaweza Group

texts.en:
Salma, who is in her mid 20s, is married with one small child. She has been running a beauty salon for three years now. She works from 09am to 08pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Salma's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her salon products and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to to help her husband take care of the household expenses and loan dues. She will use this loan to buy up to date salon products to meet her customers' requirement. She dreams of building her house.

Salma will share this loan with her loan group "TUNAWEZA" which has a total of eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up to date salon products to meet her customers' requirement.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is married with six children, five of whom attend school with the other child being too young for school.  She owns a house that does not have piped water nor electricity. 

Nyamvula has operated a coconut business, selling at the market to local customers.  She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in her business and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 50,000 KES loan she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 48 years old and lives in the Kaspi district of Georgia with his 2 sons.  Both sons are employed, one of them is an investigator and earns a fixed salary and the other works as the assistant of an artisan.  Gocha has great desire to contribute his bit to the family's welfare and start his own business. 

Gocha needs financial support to purchase a stock of products and to have money for working capital to start a trading business.  Gocha has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.  Gocha will purchase stock of various building materials and sell theml from the local open market, giving him a chance to earn income and become financially independent. 

The loan will greatly assist Gocha and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life.

loans.use: to start trading with building materials.

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena is 42 years old. She lives with her pensioner parents in Zugdidi district. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a cow, 20 hens and small agricultural land, where they grow fruits and vegetable. They produce dairy products and sell their harvested products locally.

Shorena wants to increase her family income and requested a loan for a business start up. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 3000 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of clothes at wholesale prices and will resell with price markup. This will increase her family income. Shorena awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to begin a clothing sales business.

loans.name: Hosniyeh

texts.en:
Hosniyeh is a 43-year-old married Lebanese woman. She has four children and works in cooperation with her husband to meet her children’s needs. She is a hairdresser, and a beautician as well, who has been working in this occupation for the past six years. 

Currently, she is seeking to get a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase cosmetics, with the aim of enhancing her services and pleasing her customers. Hosniyeh states that she is currently working at her house and she is now planning to make the use of additional Kiva loans to become capable of opening her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Palmira

texts.en: Palmira is 54 years old and she is in the jewelry business. She makes jewels, earrings, collars, and bracelets. She works at her home. She has two sons who are already independent adults. Her youngest son lives with her. Palmira has been working in the jewelry business since she was very young so she has experience. She needs a loan to buy materials to make more jewels. She is healthy and she would like to have a bigger workshop.

loans.use: to buy materials to make more jewels

loans.name: Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Charles is in his late 40s, married, and has five sons. For four years he has been selling milk as well as fruits and vegetables. From 8AM to 9AM he sells milk and then from 9AM until 9PM he sells fruits and vegetables. He earns a minimal monthly profit for his family.

This is Charles' second loan from Tujijenge. His first loan was used to purchase milk, fruits, and vegetables to sell. He successfully repaid his loan and would like to use this loan to open another food stand. He hopes this loan will help him earn more profit to pay for his children's school fees and other household expenses. He dreams of growing his business so that he can provide a good education for his sons and build a house for his family. 

Charles will share this loan with his loan group, Sisi kwa Sisi, which consists of ten people who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a new food stand.

loans.name: Hakima

texts.ru: Хакима проживает на районе Рудаки. Ей 45 лет. Она живет вместе с мужем, свекровью и сыновьями. Хакима добрая вежливая и гостеприимная женщина. Хакима в течение 11 лет занимается купля продажей скотин. У нее имеется несколько голов крупно рогатых скотин. Хакима хочет увеличить поголовья скотин. Она планирует купить мелко рогатых скотин и выращивать их. Для покупки скот она обращается за кредитом. Также на другую часть кредита Хакима приобретет корм. Для Хакимы этот кредит является необходимым. Она сможет расширить деятельность и улучшить финансовое состояние семьи.
texts.en: Hakima lives in the Rudaki district.  She is 45 years old.  She lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and her sons.  She is kind, polite and welcoming.  For the past 11 years, she has been buying and selling cattle.  She now owns a few head of cattle, and she would like to increase the size of her herd.  She is planning to buy and raise small livestock.  For this reason, she is applying for a loan.  With the extra money, she will also be buying some fodder.  Hakima really needs this loan, which will allow her to increase her activity and improve the financial situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy livestock and increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Эту молодую девушку зовут Фарзона. Ей 27 лет. Она проживает на районе Рудаки. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Фарзона занимается шитьем национальной женской одежды. Она любит свою работу и занята этим видом деятельности более трех лет. У Фарзоны сейчас трудное финансовое положение и она с мужем старается вырваться из данной ситуации. Сейчас Фарзоне необходимо получить кредит и на счет заемных средств увеличить производства товара. Фарзона купить по больше тканей и сразу приступит к работе. Она надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: This young woman's name is Farzona.  She is 27 years old and lives in the Rudaki district.  She is married and she has three children.  She sews traditional dresses for women.  She loves her work and has been involved in this activity for more than three years.  Farzona is now facing financial difficulties and she and her husband are trying to find solutions to improve their current situation.  Farzona really needs a loan and will use it to increase her production of sewn items.  Farzona will be buying more fabrics so that she can immediately resume her work.  She is relying on your help.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Watafutaji Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is in her mid 30s, single, and has two children. For the past six years she has been running her local restaurant, Mama Lishe, and she also sells clothing door-to-door. She works from 6am to midnight and earns a minimal monthly income for her family. 

This is Fatuma's second loan from Tujijenge. She used the first loan to improve her restaurant. She poured concrete for the floor, purchased tables and chairs, and also bought items for cooking. Fatuma successfully paid back her previous loan and with her increased profits she was able to purchase items for her home such as a table, a television and a radio. 

Fatuma plans to use this loan to buy a refrigerator for her restaurant so that she can sell soft drinks. She hopes this will help her increase her profits so that she can continue to improve her business and also to renovate her home. 

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group, Watafutaji, which consists of three people who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her restaurant so that she can sell soft drinks.

loans.name: Turdan

texts.ru: Турдан 58 лет, замужем, дети самостоятельные, живут отдельно, образование- среднее. Уже 19 лет она ведет свое хозяйство. Благодаря упорному труду Турдан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова, 1 лошадь и 60 овец, на участке мерою 3,0 Га она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Турдан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 телят и 20 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от бизнеса Турдан планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Turdan is 58 years old and married.  Her children are all independent and have now left the home.  Turdan has a secondary education and she has been running her own business for 19 years already.  She currently has one cow, one horse and 60 sheep on her farm. She also cultivates beans for resale on three hectares of land.  She makes a monthly income of 8,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som  (KGS) to buy two calves and 20 sheep, and thus increase the size of her herd. Turdan is planning to invest the earnings from her loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and 20 sheep in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Bermet

texts.ru: Бермет, 43 года, замужем, есть дочь и 2 сына. У Бермет высшее образование, она работает в школе учителем русского языка. Также 8 лет занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая семью дополнительным доходом. Благодаря упорному труду Бермет, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 10 овец. На ежедневной основе она продает экологически чистое молоко. Также имеется земельный надел, мерою 2,0 ГА, где Бермет выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,500 сом (KGS). Бермет обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы, меньшую часть кредита она направит на пристройку дома. Доходы от кредита позволят Бермет развить ее бизнес, улучшить условия проживания ее семьи.
texts.en: Bermet is 43 years old, married, and the mother of one daughter and two sons.  She is a college graduate and she works as a Russian teacher in a school.  In addition to her job, she has been involved in agriculture for the past eight years, thus providing her family with an additional source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has two cows and ten sheep on her farm.  She sells organic milk every day.  Bermet also owns two hectares of land on which she grows beans for resale.  She makes a monthly income of 8,500 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy one cow.  With the extra money, she will build an extension to her house.  The earnings from her loan will help her to grow her business and to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase one cow in order to produce and sell higher volumes of organic milk, and also to build an extension to her house.

loans.name: Gogoni Group

texts.en:
Seseni is in his late 40s and has been running a video shop for the past three years. He also has a motorcycle taxi to make additional income. He works from 8AM to midnight and earns a fair monthly income. 

This is Seseni's second loan from Tujijenge. His first loan was used to repair his TV and improve his store by buying chairs. He plans to use this loan to purchase a projector display for his store so he can attract more customers. He hopes this will help him earn more profit so he can further improve his business, pay for his household expenses, and one day buy a plot of land. 

Seseni will share this loan with his loan group, Gogoni, which consists of four individuals who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a projector for their store to attract more customers.

loans.name: Javier Alberto

texts.es:
Generar empleo, aumentar su cantidad de inventario disponible, comprar vivienda, pagar la educación de sus dos hijos que tienen 7 y 5 años de edad, es lo que da vueltas en la cabeza de Javier, un empresario de 32 años de edad propietario de un taller de motos, profesión que aprendió gracias a un amigo, y estando rodeado de personas fanáticas de las motos.
Javier necesita tu apoyo para mejorar su negocio, le hace falta herramienta, insumos como aceite y algunos repuestos muy pedidos diariamente, el caso es que no cuenta con capital para pagar la factura y para él es más fácil pagar por cuotas, por ende solicita un crédito para comprar aceites, herramienta de mano, y repuestos.
Tu apoyo será muy significativo dado que Javier tendrá la herramienta e insumos necesarios para seguir desarrollando su actividad.
texts.en:
Providing jobs, increasing available stock, buying a home, paying for his seven- and five-year-old children’s education – these are just some of the things going round Javier’s mind. At 32 years old, this businessman owns a garage. He learned this trade from a friend and his life is now filled with other car fanatics.

Javier needs your support in order to improve his business. He needs tools, supplies such as oil, and some commonly-requested spare parts. Unfortunately, Javier does not have the capital to purchase these items. It is easier for Javier to pay in smaller quotas; he is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy oil, hand tools, and spare parts.

Your support will be very important as it will give Javier the necessary tools and supplies to continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy oil, hand tools, and spare parts.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María es una mujer alegre, trabajadora, creativa, rebuscadora, curiosa de 33 años de edad, es madre de familia de un pequeño de 12 años el cual ama y trata de auto-superarse cada día para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida.
Se dedica al trabajo de alquiler de lavadoras, una actividad muy solicitada en barrios humildes, los cuales no tiene acceso a estos electrodomésticos ya sean por su precio, o quizás por su consumo que no pueden que económicamente no puede mantener.
Adopto esta actividad en el año 2001, pues se separó de su esposo y no iba a quedarse de brazos cruzados.
Ella solicita un crédito para la compra de dos lavadoras, para tener más cobertura en la zona y por ende mejorar sus ingresos.
Su sueño es pagar una vivienda propia construida en material de concreto y no en madera y pagarles la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is a happy, hard-working, creative, self-sufficient and curious 33-year-old. She is a mother to one son, 12 years old, whom she loves. María tries to do better in life every day so that she may offer her young one better living conditions.

María makes a living running a launderette, a much sought-after business in poor areas where inhabitants cannot afford to buy electrical appliances, or do not have the money to maintain them.

María started her business in 2001 when she separated from her husband and did not want to sit around doing nothing.

María is applying for a loan in order to buy two washing machines so that she can offer service to more people and thus increase her income.

María’s dream is to buy a house built with concrete, not with wood, and to pay for her children’s up-bringing.

loans.use: to buy washing machines for her business.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza es una mujer de 42 años de edad, muy afectada por circunstancias de la vida, es madre cabeza de familia de 3 hijos de 20, 13 y 15 años de edad, quedo como cabeza de familia debido a que su esposo falleció.
Desde dicho acontecimiento Maritza ha tenido que buscar alternativas para generar ingresos y lo que hace en el momento es vender cremas que para las personas que no conozcan el término son helados caseros.
 Con dicha actividad de momento sostiene su hogar, pero necesita capital de trabjo para impulsar y fabricar en masa que le sale mucho más económico, por eso solicita un crédito para la compra de pulpas de frutas, queso, bocadillo, milo, chocolate y palillos de madera para hacer sus cremas.
texts.en:
Maritza is 42 years old and has had to live through some difficult times in life. She is a mother to three children, ages 20, 15 and 13 years old, and had to become head of her family after her husband passed away.

Since this time, Maritza has had to look for ways to earn an income. She now sells what are known as “creams” in Colombia – these are like homemade ice-creams. 

This work allows Maritza to support her household but she needs capital in order to give her business a push forward and produce her goods in bulk, which will be more economical. As a result, Maritza is applying for a loan in order to buy fruit pulp, cheese, snacks, hot chocolate and lollipop sticks to make her creams.

loans.use: to buy fruit pulp, cheese, snacks, hot chocolate and lollipop sticks to make her creams.

loans.name: Miriam Lizeth

texts.es: Doña Miriam se encuentra muy feliz, muy contenta y muy satisfecha porque gracias a su primer financiamiento brindado por la cooperativa COMIXMUL ella pudo asistir sus cultivos de café logrando comprar la urea, la fórmula 12-24-12 y la 18-46-0 con lo que pudo aplicar a sus cultivos manteniendo sanas las plantas y el grano. El grano de café fue vendido a intermediarios de la zona ya que así evitaron hacer el gasto de trasladarse a las bodegas que se dedican a la compra venta de este. Actualmente solicita un segundo crédito en el cual espera nuevamente ser apoyada permitiendo comprar suministros agrícolas como ser abono, fertilizantes, entre otros y podrá realizar la limpia de su propiedad. Esto permitirá obtener una mejor producción sobre su negocio ya que doña Miriam su primer crédito le ayudo en su producción grande mente para asegurar su cosecha por lo que nuevamente solicita se le apoye por segunda ocasión para que sus metas, planes y sueños puedan ir poco a poco convirtiéndose en una realidad
texts.en:
Miriam is happy and very satisfied because, thanks to her first loan from COMIXMUL, she was able to help her coffee crops by buying urea, 12-24-12 and 18-46-0 fertilisers to apply to them. This kept the crops and the beans healthy.

Miriam sold the coffee beans to local wholesalers, allowing her not to have to pay the cost of travelling to individual shops that sell coffee.

Miriam is now applying for a second loan and hopes to receive support again. This loan will be used to buy farming supplies, such as manure and fertilisers, and to carry out cleaning work on her property. This will allow Miriam to attain better production, which is what happened with her first loan. This loan will guarantee a good harvest. 

Miriam is applying for support so that her goals, plans and dreams may gradually become a reality.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to look after her coffee crops.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Avec en moyenne 30 ans et 3 enfants, les quatre femmes du groupe Danaya sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques; Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban Koulouba l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, chaussures plastiques, atiéké, échalote, oignon, fruits et légumes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à 1ier  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sanata  (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’atiéké dans le quartier de Kalaban. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 400kg d’atiéké à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails en ambulant et au marché à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sanata espère avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four women of the Danaya group are, on average, 30 years old and have three children. They are married mostly into monogamous households and they all live in Kalaban Koulouba, one of the neighborhoods in Bamako. 

These women know each other from neighborhood ties and their work in a market in Kalaban. The group members work in small-scale commerce, selling plastic shoes, atiéké, shallots, onions, fruits, and vegetables. With the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first group loan.

Sanata (the woman's standing on the far left in the photo) is a successful merchant who sells atiéké [a dish made from fermented cassava couscous] in the Kalaban area. She plans to use her loan to buy 400 kilograms of atiéké in Bamako. 

Sales are made at retail at a market and by traveling around to mostly female customers. 

With this loan, Sanata hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA, which will be used to take care of the small needs of her household.

loans.use: to buy atiéké [a dish made from fermented cassava couscous]

loans.name: Sebesse Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Sebessé sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques; Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 04 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban Koulouba l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, produits cosmétiques,  condiments,  tubercules, fruits et légumes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 6ème   cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam  (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande renommée dans la vente des fruits et légumes de meilleures qualités au marché de Kalaban. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de concombre, 3 bassines de tomate, 5 bassines de poivron et 10 sacs de choux pommés en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails au marché à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mariam espère avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 110 000 FCFA dont une partie sera réinvestie dans l’activité et le reste pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The six women of the Sebessé group are married mostly into monogamous households. They are, on average, 44 years old and have four children. They all live in Kalaban Koulouba, one of the neighborhoods in Bamako.

These women know each other from neighborhood ties and from their work at a market in Kalaban. The group members work in small-scale commerce, selling cosmetics, condiments, tubers, fruits and vegetables. With the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their sixth group loan.

Mariam (the woman seated on the far left in the photo) is well-known for selling the best quality fruits and vegetables at a market in Kalaban. She plans to use her loan to buy five sacs of cucumbers, three baskets of tomatoes, five baskets of peppers, and 10 sacs of cabbages at wholesale from the grand market. 

Sales are made at retail at a market to mostly female customers. With this loan, Mariam hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 110,000 francs CFA, of which a part will be reinvested in her business and the rest will go to ensuring her children's healthcare.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Yelema Group

texts.fr:
Avec en moyenne 37 ans et 5 enfants, les quatre femmes du groupe Yèlèma sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques; Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban Koulouba l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de condiments, de fruits et légumes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à 1ier  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ami  (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande renommée dans la vente des fruits et légumes de meilleures qualités au marché. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 sacs d’aubergine, 3 bassines de tomate, 5 bassines de poivron et 10 sacs de choux pommés en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kalaban à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Ami espère avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 65 000 FCFA dont une partie serait réinvestie dans l’activité afin d’augmenter son volume.
texts.en:
The four women of the Yèlèma group are married mostly into monogamous families. They are, on average, 37 years old and have five children. And they all live in Kalaban Koulouba, one of the neighborhoods in Bamako. 

These women know each other from neighborhood ties and from their work at a market in Kalaban. They work in small-scale commerce, selling condiments, fruits, and vegetables. With the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first group loan.

Ami (the woman seated on the far left in the photo) is well-known for selling the best quality fruits and vegetables at the market. She plans to use her loan to buy 10 sacs of eggplants, three baskets of tomatoes, five baskets of peppers, and 10 sacs of cabbages at wholesale in Bamako.

Sales are made at retail in Kalaban to mostly female customers. With this loan, Ami hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 65,000 francs CFA, of which a part will be reinvested in her business in order to increase her volume.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Monica Andrea

texts.es:
Monica es una mujer soltera de 28 años de edad sin hijos, muy trabajadora, creativa y con aspiraciones a mejorar a presente y futuro.
Se desempeña como vendedora de mercancía la cual la realiza ambulantemente, tocando puertas, ofreciéndole a familiares, amigos, vecinos, en almacenes, en pocas palabras en todo lugar donde le abran las puertas.
Ella solo compra mercancía que ya está vendida, no se tira a la deriva esperando vender alguna prenda si no que va a la fija, pero la idea es mantener esta metodología, pero iniciar a vender prendas de vestir desde su casa, con ello podrá brindarle trabajo a una persona y seguir con sus labores de venta.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de vitrinas, ropa y surtido de materia prima para realizar otras actividades la cual es venta de yogurt y alimentos.
texts.en:
Monica, 28, is a single woman without children. She is hardworking, creative and has aspirations to improve her present and future.
She is a street vendor, which she does by knocking on doors, offering to family, friends, neighbors, in warehouses, anywhere where you can open the door.
She only buys second hand goods, not to throw away but she hopes to sell them on to be fixed. The idea is to keep this methodology, but start to sell clothing from home, thus she can employ someone to help and continue to work.
She is applying for credit to buy display cabinets, clothes and an assortment of raw material for other activities such as selling yogurt and food.

loans.use: to buy display cabinets, clothes and assorted raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Maria Gracia

texts.es:
Ella es María una morena muy alegre, extrovertida que se goza su vida, es madre de 4 hijos, tiene un restaurante famoso por sus buenos precios y sazón casera, esos sabores que te recuerdan a las comidas que solo tu mamá saben preparar.
Por sugerencia de entes de sanidad necesita realizar algunas adecuaciones pero su problema es que no tiene el capital para hacerlo por tal razón solicita un crédito para cubrir esta falencia y tener su negocio listo para la próxima inspección y por así decirlo, satisfacer las demandas de este ente regulador.
texts.en:
María is a very happy, outgoing woman who enjoys life. She is a mother of 4 children and has a restaurant which is famous for its good prices and homemade seasoning, those flavors that remind you of the meals that only your mom knows how to prepare.
At the suggestion of health entities, she needs to make some adjustments, but the problem is that she does not have the capital to do it for that reason, she is requesting a loan to cover this shortcoming and make her business ready for the next inspection and so to speak, meet the demands of this regulator.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food in her restaurant.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel tiene 43 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida, su hija y su nieta. Manuel es un hombre trabajador quien se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de fruta. Para él lo más importante es su familia y desea darle lo mejor. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, lámina galvanizada, hierro, etc. dado que desea reparar el techo de la casa y construir un nuevo  cuarto. Espera poder contar con dicho financiamiento y de esta forma dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en: Manuel is 43 years old and lives at home with his life partner, their daughter and granddaughter. Manuel is a hard worker who works in agriculture and sells fruit. To him, the most important thing is his family and he wants the best for them. With the desire to improve their living conditions, he is requesting a FUSAI loan to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, brick, galvanized steel, iron, etc. as he wants to repair the roof of his house and build a new room. He hopes to have such funding and start improving it soon.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, bricks, galvanized steel, iron, etc. to repair the roof and build a room in his house.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.es:
Ella es Jennifer una joven de 22 años de edad, muy emprendedora, tierna, simpática, alegre, que con mucho esfuerzo, ahorros y préstamos logro montar un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas.
Ella ha tenido varios problemas como lo son la inseguridad en su sitio de trabajo, alto costo de insumos y la fuerte competencia en el sector.
Ella a pesar de todas las dificultades, sigue en pie en su negocio, elaborando ideas para impulsar su negocio, pues quiere que este le de recursos para comprar una vivienda propia.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de una fritadora industrial, e insumos de carnes, harina, aceite, pues la idea es diversificar su oferta, ofreciendo productos como fritos, y antojos.
texts.en:
This is Jennifer, a 22-year-old, enterprising, sweet, kind and cheerful young woman. With a lot of effort, her savings and some loans, she managed to set up a fast food business. 

She has had several problems such as insecurity at her workplace, high cost of ingredients and fierce competition in the sector. Despite all the difficulties though, her business is still standing and she goes on developing ideas to improve it. She wants it to be stable enough to allow her to buy her own house.

She requests a loan to buy a commercial deep fryer and food supplies like meat, flour and oil, since her idea is to broaden the range of dishes offered
to include assorted deep fried snacks and sweet and savory corn dishes.

loans.use: to buy a commercial deep fryer and food supplies like meat, flour and oil among others.

loans.name: Jaime Enrique

texts.es: Jaime inicio su  negocio con el propósito de mejorar sus ingresos, este emprendedor hombre de 60 años de edad decidió comprar unas promociones de productos que hacen parte de la canasta familiar para comercializarlos entre sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, compró inicialmente cereales como arroz, aceites vegetales, legumbres, azúcar, pastas y poco a poco fue adicionando más productos en la medida que su negocio obtenía éxito. Su idea de negocio surgió en el año 2011,  hoy en día cuenta con muchos más clientes a quienes les brinda facilidad de pago, para que ellos  puedan cancelar según su flujo de efectivo. Él realiza sus compras de contado a almacenes de cadena, sin embargo su capital le ha sido insuficiente para cumplir con algunos pedidos de víveres, por esa razón está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en arroz, aceite, legumbres, Carnes frías y detergentes.
