The interest and passion to help other people is what prompted Angélica to study for her nursing degree. This 26 year old youth is worried about the health of society. She studies at university every Sunday. She works during the week and takes care of her two year old child along with her husband. She is also supported morally and economically by her sister and her parents who have owned a sewing shop for many years.

Angélica is ready to get her degree in Nursing which puts a satisfied smile on her face. For this reason she is requesting a loan to pay for her courses and be able to finish this important stage in her life. Doing this she will be able to work with her degree. Amongst her goals are to work professionally and in the not too distant future, study to specialize.

loans.use: to pay for her courses.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio owns several cows and lives from selling their milk. He sometimes finds it difficult to make ends meet, as he spends a significant part of his revenue on buying LP gas, chemical fertilizers, and wood. 

Antonio decided to invest in a waste-to-energy system in order to reduce his financial burden and become more self-sufficient by producing his own renewable energy (biogas) and organic fertilizer from his cows' manure. By putting his cows' waste into the system, he will not only save money by displacing these costly and unsustainable external inputs, but he will also protect the environment and improve his quality of life. Indeed, the manure will no longer contaminate underground water sources nor emit greenhouse gases, and Antonio's wife will cook with biogas instead of wood, which was causing her and her family to inhale toxic smoke on a daily basis. Antonio is looking forward to living on a fossil fuel-free and sustainable farm, where there is no waste, but only resources.

This loan represents 50% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Janneth Alexandra

texts.es: Alexandra  tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera y su hijo tiene 13 años de edad y le gusta mucho estudiar, Alexandra comenta que sola saca adelante a su hijo y que para eso se dedica a trabajar de empleada domestica,  Alexandra crecio en el campo y por esto aprendio a a trabajar en la agricultura Alexandra  tambien se dedica a la crianza de animales y a sembrar pequeñas hueras de papas y algunos productos mas que son propios de su zona, el crédito lo  va a invertir en la compra de abono y fungicidas para tener sanos sus cultivos, ella aspita seguir adelante con sus cultivos y de las ganancias cubrir los gastos de educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Alexandra is 28 years old, she is a single mother, her son is 13 years old and he likes to study very much. Alexandra says that she alone helps her son get ahead, and to do that she works as a house cleaner. Alexandra was raised in the countryside, and because of this she learned to work in agriculture. Alexandra also works in animal breeding, and sowing small patches of potatoes and other products that grow in the area. 
She will invest her loan in the purchase of manure and fungicide to have healthy crops. She aspires to continue with her crops and with the profits be able to cover the expenses of her son’s education.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fungicide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Kuña Guapa, lo que quiere decir mujeres trabajadoras, todas ellas ponen todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y conforme a ello poder salir adelante.
Cada una de ellas se esfuerza cada día, entre las que se destaca la Sra. Silvina, quien tiene una despensa variada, con todo tipo de productos. Comenta que al principio le costó mucho, pero se ha abierto camino y hoy día ya tiene muy buena clientela. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo para poder ayudar a su familia y seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, frutas, bebidas varias, lácteos, carne y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This group is called Kuña Guapa, which means hardworking women. They all put forth all of themselves to be able to grow and get ahead. They are part of the poverty elimination program, which will permit them to become aware of the living situation of each one, and according to that, be able to get ahead. Each one of them pushes herself every day, among them Silvina stands out, who has a varied general store with all types of products. She comments that at the beginning, it cost her a lot, but she has opened a path and today she already has a very good clientele. She is thankful for the opportunity that she receives to be able to continue growing in order to be able to help her family and her loved ones.

She is applying for this loan to be able to buy vegetables, fruits, various drinks, dairy products, meat and others, in order to be able to continue with her sales like she's doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, various drinks, dairy products, meat and others.

loans.name: Kaarendy Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas y cada una de ellas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a sus familias, dándoles todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
La Sra. Pastora forma parte de este grupo, según su encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, se encuentra en una situación de pobreza extrema, y cada día se esfuerza para poder ir superándola por medio de su esfuerzo. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, y es con este trabajo que se esfuerza por poder dar a su familia todo lo que no pudo tener y que no pasen por necesidades como las que ella paso.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras frescas y de estación, de manera a poder seguir luchando por su familia y por sus seres queridos. Ellas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben y que les será de mucha ayuda para ayudar a sus familias. En la foto aparecen 17 personas ya que son 17 las mujeres que integran este grupo, pero solo 15 retiran dinero en este ciclo.
texts.en:
The group forms part of the poverty elimination program, where each and every one of them is putting forth their best effort to be able to help their families, giving them everything that they couldn't have. Pastora forms part of this group. According to her poverty elimination survey, she is found in a situation of extreme poverty, and every day she pushes herself to be able to go improving it by means of her efforts. She works selling fruits and vegetables, and it is with this work that she strives to be able to give her family everything that she couldn't have and that they don't go without necessities like what happened to her.

She is applying for this loan to be able to buy in-season fruits and vegetables, so to be able to continue fighting for her family and for her loved ones. They are thankful for the opportunity they receive and that this will be a big help for helping their families. In the photo, 17 people appear since there are 17 women who make up this group, but only 15 are taking out money in this cycle.

loans.use: to buy in-season fresh fruits and vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 49 years old and residing at Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and blessed only with three children, two of whom are still in their school age. 

She joined PMPC in March 2013 in order to access the programs and services of the said co-op. Recently, she's accessing her third loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP for additional working capital of her existing business to buy a variety of commodities so she can sell a variety of agricultural products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of agricultural commodities

location.town: Sindangan-Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Los Azares Group

texts.es:
Los Azares es el nombre que lleva el grupo integrado por personas responsables, trabajadoras y comprometidas con su familia y el bienestar de las mismas. La zona donde viven es productora de caña y alberga uno de los ingenios (fábrica de azúcar) más importantes del país. Durante la temporada de corte se puede observar una reactivación de la economía gracias a los ingresos de los trabajadores. Es durante estos seis meses que los integrantes de Los Azares aprovechan para realizar una inversión mayor en cada una de sus actividades económicas:

Eulogio -Estética
Juana –Cocina Económica 
Irma –Cosméticos 
María – Ropa Americana 
Miriam –Comida 
Griselda -Pollo
Felisa –Calzado Por Catalogo 
Maricela –Ropa 

Eulogio es conocido por todos como Gio. Desde hace 15 años, después de haber cumplido uno de sus sueños y aprender el oficio de estilista para el cual estudió, hoy en día ofrece sus servicios desde la comodidad de su casa donde ha adecuado un pequeño espacio que permanece abierto de domingo a sábado con un horario de 10:00 am a 7:00 pm, además de que Gio también suele ir directo a la casa de sus clientes.

Gio comenta que decidió independizarse y poner su propia estética desde hace 15 años, después de haber trabajado en una estética con alto prestigio donde aprendió tanto de su actividad. Ahora, su trabajo lo recomienda y su propia estibilidad se debe al éxito de su estética; incluso el comité organizador de la fiesta patronal de su comunidad lo invitó a formar parte del evento para seguir ofeciendo su servicio.

Actualmente Gio necesita invertir en tintes, peróxido, acondicionador, tijeras, peines y capas. Con sus ganancias cubre los gastos de la renta de la casa donde vive, solventa los gastos personales e invierte en su pequeña estética. “Gracias a cada una de las personas que hacen posible nos sean otorgados los prestamos, con los cuales nuestras actividades han tomado mayor fuerza y nos generan más ganancias.”

*La fotografía fue tomada en la cocina económica de doña Juana donde cada 14 días los integrantes se reúnen para dar el pago del préstamo, Gio es quien viste blusa negra con vivos dorados.
texts.en:
Los Azares is the name of this group made up of responsible, hardworking people who are committed to their family and their well-being.

They live in a sugarcane producing region which is home to one of most important "ingenios" (sugar mills) in the country. During the harvest, a reactivation of the economy can be seen thanks to the income received by the workers. It is during these six months that the members of Los Azares take advantage by making bigger investments in each of their work activities:

Eulogio - beauty salon stylist; Juana - homemade food eatery; Irma - cosmetics; Maria - american clothing; Miriam - food;  Griselda - chicken; Felisa - catalog shoes; Marisela - clothing.

Eulogio is known to all as Gio. Having reached one of his dreams, becoming a beauty salon stylist for which he studied, he now offers his services from the convenience of his home. He set up a small space that remains open from Sunday to Saturday and from 10 am to 7 pm. Gio also works attending clients in their own home.

Gio comments that he decided to go independent and set up his own salon fifteen years ago, after working for a prestigious salon where he learned a great deal about his work. Nowadays, his work speaks for him, and his stability is due to his successul results. He was invited by the committee that organizes the patron saint celebrations in his commmunity, to take part in the event by offering his services.

Gio needs to invest in haircolors, peroxides, conditioners, scissors, combs, and hair caps. 

With his profits, he pays the rent of the home where he lives and covers his personal expenses, as well as investing in his small beauty salon.

"Thanks to everyone who makes it possible for us to receive the loans, with these our work activities have grown stronger, generating better income."

The photo was taken in Juana's eatery. Every fourteen days, the members meet to make their loan payments. Gio is wearing a black and gold shirt.

loans.use: to buy haircolors, peroxides, conditioners, scissors, combs, and hair caps.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en: Janice faces considerable preparation for the post-harvest operations of her corn farm in Siloy, Misamis Occidental. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her loan proposal to Paglaum MPC. Janice hopes to see all her children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for labor for post-harvest of corn land

loans.name: Madilyn

texts.en:
Madilyn operates a motor transport business; her husband is the driver. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

For her to continue her business, she availed herself of a loan to pay for motorcycle spare parts and repair. She dreams to own motor units and be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle spare parts and repair

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (variety) store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Geraldine is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Lupercio

texts.en:
Lupercio is 60 years old and lives in Sipaloc, Sibutad. Lupercio has experienced hardships, especially in raising his family. This industrious man finds himself plowing the rice field. In need of additional working capital, Lupercio joined Paglaum Cooperative. He has received several loans and recently requested a loan for 5,000 PHP, which he will use to buy three sacks of fertilizer. 

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, Lupercio has been able to manage his income and provide for the daily needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 51 years old, married to a fisherman, and has four children. They live in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Elsa is a diligent and persevering mother when it comes to the welfare of her family, since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She is earning a living through snack vending, and to generate more income, she and her husband decided to give "agal-agal" (seaweed) culture a try, after she learned that she can avail herself of financial assistance through PMPC. 

Consequently, she requested a loan to buy materials and accessories for this project. With the help and support of her children, Elsa smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing them a good education.

loans.use: to buy materials and accessories  for an "agal-agal" (seaweed) culture project

location.town: Sindangan - Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 51 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children who are now adults. Cherry has been engaged in managing her sari-sari store, hot cake making and a coconut buy-and-sell business for 25 years already. She is also engaged in mango production and earns approximately PHP 30,000 each month. She helps her husband in providing for their family's needs. 

Cherry has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of groceries and other consumable products for her sari-sari store business. Cherry has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, Cherry hopes to expand her sari-sari store and hot cake making business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a very supportive wife. She carefully manages their farm, for this is the main source of their income. Through the income generated from the rice production, she successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. 

Currently, she has applied 30,000 PHP and GDMPC management would not hesitate to approve the new loan because she has gained the trust from the cooperative due to her good repayment history.

She will use the funds for rice field preparation for the next planting season, such as labor cost and to buy organic fertilizers. Her goal is to increase the next harvest to invest in a new line of business to have an extra income and to increase the family savings.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost and to buy organic fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Leah Kathleen

texts.en:
In 2008, Leah Kathleen had her first loan in PMPC. She is from Sindangan, Philippines. She is 51 years old and is a widow with four children. As the breadwinner, she experienced hardship in raising her children, most especially with their education. Leah Kathleen was playing with the idea to start a bakery business, since she had the baking skills but had no capital. PMPC stood by her as she started her bakery business. 

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional raw ingredients to increase her production to provide for more customers. And she has planned to roll over her additional revenue to gain more profit and save enough for the future of her children. Leah Kathleen is thankful for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients to increase her production to provide for more customers

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 30 years old and single. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Alona has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from a general store. Alona is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Imaculada

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Imaculada to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, biscuits, eggs, Sagiko, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite and candy. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Imaculada independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, biscuits, eggs, Sagiko, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite and candy.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana is taking a loan of 600 USD to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as wheat flour, oils and sugar. Joana opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of 200 USD. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, oils and sugar

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 40 years old and married with four children. With three of her children in school, Florenda works very hard to provide for them.

Florenda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Florenda has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Florenda would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
A 600 USD loan is offered to Josefa to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of 100 USD. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like milk, water, cigarettes, sugar, salt, eggs, books, coffee, biscuits and oils. Josefa is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk.

Josefa has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Josefa is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy milk, water, cigarettes, sugar, salt, eggs, books, coffee, biscuits and oils

loans.name: Maris Stella

texts.en:
Maris Stella is married to a responsible factory worker man. She supports her husband in all the family needs. She earned revenue from her general store business, from which she repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. 

She applied for a new loan of 50,000 PHP to invest another line of business: a rice retailing business. GDMPC approved the loan, and she's now happy for her dream come true. She plans to save most of her income from the retailing business to improve her family's living conditions and for the family's future needs.

loans.use: to invest a new line of business: a rice retailing business.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique has successfully repaid his previous loan from GDMPC. At his old age, he still doing the usual business he used to to earn for the family's daily needs and for future emergencies. 

He applied for a new loan from GDMPC with the amount of 25,000 PHP to purchase a new engine for his fishing boat to continue fishing for the family. He plans to have a retirement with his wife.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for his fishing boat.

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida lives in Ermera. She is married and has three children. She has been involved in business activities since 2010; she started with her own working capital of $500. Her husband is a driver. 

Now she is requesting a loan of $600 to improve her business, so she is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin. She will use it to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including slippers, detergents, cooking oils, milks, sardines, biscuits, Aqua, sugar, salts, candles, cigarettes and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks. 

She is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can run her business to be bigger in the future and her income can be increased. 

She has animals at her house like pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: to buy slippers, detergents, cooking oils, milk, sardines, biscuits, Aqua, sugar, salts, candles, cigarettes and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Chhay, 49, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has seven children in total; four are single and three are married. To make a living, she has been involved in the farming business since 1990, growing rice and selling her agricultural produce to local dealers and customers at the market. She is able to generate a net profit of USD 2.50 a day, on average.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farmland. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from HKL through KIVA now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as chili peppers, salt, and flavorings

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lucila is 53 years old and has one child in school.

Lucila has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. Lucila requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase nail cutters and other materials needed for her business.

Lucila has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Lucila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase nail cutters and other materials needed to provide her service

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ma. Luz works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. 

Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ma. Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for college tuition fees.

loans.name: San Antonio 2 Group

texts.es:
San Antonio 2 está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde ellas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante y mejorar su situación de pobreza.
Gricelda integra este grupo, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es  decir que está en un novel medio de pobreza que va mejorando a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo en la venta de prendas varias, que le es de ayuda para su familia.
La Sra. Gricelda  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de sus prendas tales como remeras, short, camisas, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“San Antonio 2” is in its fourth cycle of the women’s committee program where they all work and help each other get ahead.  They are participating in the poverty elimination survey, where they are putting in their best effort to be able to get ahead and improve their poverty situation.
Gricelda, a member of this group, is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. She fell within Level 2 on her last poverty elimination survey, which means that she is in a medium poverty level. Her level is improving through her efforts and work selling various types of clothing, which is helpful to her family.  Gricelda is requesting this loan to purchase clothing such as T-shirts, shorts, and shirts, which will help her to solidify her business plan, and consequently improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as T-shirts, shorts, shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Samrith

texts.en:
Samrith, age 53, comes from Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has only one son who currently works as a Credit Officer. She is a bread seller and earns, on average, an income of USD 7.00 a day. So far, she has been involved in this type of business for six years. 

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them fund the loan so they can improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Myrna is 54 years old and has four of her children in school.

Myrna has a fishing business in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Myrna has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Merlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a vulcanizing shop in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store. Merlyn is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy interior and other materials needed for her vulcanizing shop business.

Merlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy interior and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Gerardo Stiven

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo es un hombre muy emprendedor y creativo, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de Café Internet

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que él salga adelante con su negocio.

De este negocio dependerán su esposa y su hija a la cual desea enseñarle del negocio y dejarle un legado.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar el negocio en el que actualmente trabaja (café Internet).

Con un préstamo podrás apoyar a un hombre lleno de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
Señor Gerardo is a very entrepreneurial and creative man. For a long time, he has wanted to be independent and have his own Internet cafe.

At the moment, he is able to realize his dream thanks to his abilities at work, the support he receives from the Interactuar corporation, and the people that want him to move forward with his business.

Gerardo's wife and daughter will depend on this business, and he wants to teach it to his daughter, and eventually leave her an inheritance.

Gerardo is requesting economic support to buy the business where he currently works (an Internet cafe).

With this loan, you will support a man who is full of life and spirit for his family!

loans.use: to buy the business where he currently works (an Internet cafe).

loans.name: Sarem

texts.en:
Sarem is 30 years old and resides in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has six children in total, four are married and live independently while other two are single and live under her support. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business in a small rice farmland which is located in her community.
So far, she has been in this type of business for twenty-four years. Currently, she would like to request a KIVA loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of traveling. She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Vera Angiely

texts.en: Vera Angiely is now a married mother and she still owns and manages a rice farm to earn a living. After a couple of years cultivating her farm, she earned enough money to support her child and was able to sustain her business. She has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. She has a new loan from GDPMC micro credit to help her rice plants reach full production as the cropping is fast approaching. In the future, she and her husband want to make improvements to her house and for her child's education.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and organic fertilizer for full rice production.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San, 51, lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of six children.

To make a living, she has been involved in an agri-business since 1980. By owning farmland, she grows cassava and sells the crops to the local dealers and sometimes she sells directly to customers at the market.  On average, she is able to make an income of 5 USD per day.

In this season, San would like to hire some laborers to help her in the harvesting process in order to get the crop in on time. Due to the shortage of money, she is applying for a Kiva loan to pay for hiring laborers. San is thankful to all lenders for their finical support, and she is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for hiring laborers

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina has made a living from selling dried fish in the market located in her local community. She invested in a new line of business, the so-called transport business. From her transport business income, she successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC.

Currently, she again took a new loan to pay the cost of motorcycle registration renewal and maintenance cost for repair in order to sustain her transport business. The revenue generated from her transport business will be used to improved her family's living conditions and for savings.

loans.use: to pay the cost of motorcycle registration renewal and maintenance cost for repair

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 40 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Nilda works very hard to provide for them.

Nilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages and groceries.

Nilda has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as junk foods, biscuits, candies, coffee, and other groceries. 

In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages and groceries.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 62 years old and married with five children. With of her children in school, Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, coffee, condiments, and groceries.

Rosalina has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, junk foods, coffee, and candies. 

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, coffee, condiments, and groceries.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 44 years old and married with four children.

Rowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, condiments, soap, and groceries.

Rowena has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rowena aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, condiments, soap, and groceries.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 50 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for 3 years and she sells a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, junk foods, dried fish and other groceries. 

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items like canned goods, beverages, and groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ferney Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Ferney en su afán por salir adelante, desea con muchas ansias una gran oportunidad para demostrar sus habilidades y para conseguir el sustento diario de su hogar.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar semillas de arroz y elementos para manutención de cultivos como abonos, riegos y fungicidas.

Con estos elementos y con su gran empuje, podrá cumplir ese anhelado sueño de ser un agricultor exitoso y poder impulsar a su familia hacia el bienestar
texts.en:
Señor Ferney, in his ambition to get ahead, yearns for a great opportunity to show his abilities and provide for his household.

He is requesting a loan to buy rice seed and provisions to care for his crops such as fertilizer, irrigation, and fungicides.

With these provisions and his great spirit, he will be able to achieve this longed for dream of being a successful farmer, and be able to improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and provisions to care for his crops such as fertilizer, irrigation, and fungicides.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 20 years old and married with one child. Marjorie works very hard to provide for them.

Marjorie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell including eggs, canned goods, beverages and groceries. She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, soy sauce, oil, straw, shampoo, soap, pencil, and eggs.

In the future, Marjorie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Michelyn

texts.en:
Michelyn is 40 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Michelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.  She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Michelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Samnan's Group

texts.en:
Samnan is a villager of a small town in Steung Treng province. She is 29 years old and married with three young kids.

Her main source of income is from rice farming, but her secondary source is from raising pigs to sell. She manages to earn roughly 5 USD a day. As a new member with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and a leader of her group, Samnan is seeking a loan of 300,000 KHR to support her pig sales. The loan will be used to buy piglets and pig feed.

She hopes that the profit from the sales will enable her to repair her house and for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Thala Barivat District

loans.name: Sokrun's Group

texts.en:
25 year-old Sokrun is married with two children living in a small village of Kampong Cham province. One of her children is under the age of 6 and another one is attending primary school. For five years, she has been a housemaid to support her family, while her husband has been a construction worker. Together, they can earn around 8 USD a day.

Having been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for three cycles, Sokrun has been a trustworthy client. Sokrun and her teammate are seeking a loan of 2,000,000 KHR each. She will use her portion of the loan to buy a motorbike. Being a construction worker, her husband needs to arrive at work on time to avoid having his wages cut down and he also needs a motorbike to travel around looking for works. She hopes that the motorcycle will help their lives by facilitating transportation and reducing their expenses on motor taxis.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
Abelardo es un hombre muy trabajador y organizado, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de personas e su Carro a través de las veredas del municipio de Sonsón posibilitando el desplazamiento de la comunidad hasta las distintitas áreas del municipio.
Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, es casado y padre de 2 hijos a los cuales siempre ha procurado ofrecerles la mejor vida posible.
Solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento y reparación a su automóvil ya que es su único medio de trabajo.
Con este crédito podrá mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo y podrá continuar prestando su servicio con total seguridad y sin poner en riesgo su vida ni la de sus clientes.
Apoya a Abelardo con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Abelardo is a kindhearted man, but also very well-organized, industrious, and entrepreneurial. He is a husband and the father of two children, for whom he has always striven to provide the best life possible. Abelardo makes a living driving passengers around the municipality of Sonsón in his car, making it possible for them to travel between the different parts of the region.

He is applying for a loan to pay for maintenance and repairs for his car, which is his only source of work. This loan will thus improve the car's condition, and allow Abelardo to provide his transportation service in complete security. He then won't have to risk his life or the lives of his passengers. 

Support Abelardo with a loan today!

loans.use: for auto maintenance and repairs as the car is his only means of work.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
A $800.00 USD loan is offered to Carolina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day and she also sells in the market. She will buy some additional supplies to sell to people such as rice, detergents, soaps, toothpaste, sugar, balm, cooking oils, candies, soft drinks and other things to sell. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012, with her own working capital. She feels so comfortable in running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Carolina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. With the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Carolina also cultivates animals in her place like pigs, chickens, goats and dogs.

loans.use: To buy rice, detergents, soaps, toothpaste, sugar, balm, cooking oils, candies, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Chanthon's Group

texts.en: A Keo Seima resident, Chanthon is a middle-aged married woman with two secondary school children. She has been operating a small grocery store at home for four years. Her secondary sources of income include cassava and cashew nut plantations. Chanthon has been a member of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) obe time before. Leading her group, she is seeking for a loan of 1,600,000 KHR. Her intention for the loan is to buy supplies for her grocery store. She hopes that her grocery store will go well and earn her more profit.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery store.

loans.name: Universo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario, está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (Elbira Senaida,Nidia y Marlene Rebeca), todas viven en Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron hace un año, con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para accesar a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios, aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Elbira Senaida, vende bastimentos verduras y frutas, Nidia tiene una pequeña pulpería y Marlene Rebeca vende ropa usada. 

Con el préstamo anterior brindado por PANA PANA y financiado con fondos KIVA, le permitió Elbira Senaida diversificar su negocio con otros productos, tales como bastimentos, frutas verduras y comprar mariscos. A nidia, le permtio incrementar su inventario de productos de uso domestico para su pulpería, percibir mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Elbira Senaida: Es una joven de 27 años, coordinadora del grupo solidario, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, casada con 2 hijos, en edad escolar. Desde hace 11 años se dedica a la venta de mariscos y pescados de manera ambulante, en un termo con hielo en un carretón de madera, de esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar y en los estudios de sus hijos. Solicita financiamiento para comprarle a los buzos y pescadores más productos de mariscos: pescado, camarón, langostas, caracoles, ya que son uno de los alimentos básicos que consumen las familias de Bilwi. Ella y su esposo sueñan construir su vivienda de concreto (cemento) porque es de mayor durabilidad.
texts.en:
This group has 3 members, all women: Elbira Senaida, Nidia, and Marlene Rebeca.  They live in Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas.  They organized the group to support their joint effort to access Pana Pana loans and maintain and grow their small businesses.  Their goal, they say, is to increase their incomes and help their families secure a better quality of life.  Elbira Senaida sells seafood, fruits and vegetables; Nidia has a small corner store; and Marlene Rebeca sells used clothing.

A previous PANA PANA loan, financed by KIVA lenders, helped Elbira Senaida add fruits and vegetables to the mix of seafood products that she has long sold.  Nidia, too, used the loan to stock a wider range of products for her business and says that she saw an increase in sales that helped her to improve her family's quality of life.

Elbira Senaida, 27, is the group's coordinator.  She was born and raised in Puerto Cabezas.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  She has worked as a street vendor for 11 years, selling all kinds of seafood.  She has a cart with an ice chest and her earnings from the business go to household expenses and her children's schooling.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy seafood products from local fishermen and divers: fish, shrimp, prawns, etc.  The loan is a good investment because seafood is a basic staple of the local diet.  For the future, Elbira Senaida and her husband want to build a house of cement because cement is more durable.

loans.use: to stock her seafood sales business.

loans.name: Jannette

texts.en: Janet is a 38 year-old mother who has three school-aged children. She owns and manages a small retail store while her husband works on their farm. Due to financial hardships, they aspire to improve their status of living in order to educate their children and give them a better living. She wants to further improve her store but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, laundry soaps, beverages and seasonings to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will be a great help for her so she can improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, laundry soaps, beverages and seasonings to resell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a very approachable businesswoman, she has countless friends and clients who use her beauty services provided to the local community. Through her salon business income, she can provide for all the needs of her family and she's successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. She took a new loan to purchase new materials needed in her salon such as styling tools, service trays, plastic shampoo bowls, styling products, hair colors, and hair treatments for clients. Her future plan is to have another investment aside from salon business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and accessories for the salon.

loans.name: Gloria Nubia

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Sonson desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como lo son los tamales, chorizos, empanadas, arepas, entre otros.
Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Gloria y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.
Gloria desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de algunos utensilios de cocina y compra de insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas como pollos, harina, queso, entre otros.
Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia, oportunidad que le brinda la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Gloria is a humble and hard-working woman that has spent most of her life raising her children. She lives in the municipality of Sonson where she works spectacularly in the kitchen. Her business prepares meals to order, such as tamales, sausages, empanadas, arepas, and other items.

She sells the meals mostly to her neighbors in the area that are familiar with Gloria's flavor and know that they will always receive delicious and very well prepared meals. Gloria wants to increase her food sales, and wants to work more comfortably. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy some kitchen utensils and ingredients to keep making her recipes such as chicken, flour, cheese and other items.

This loan will allow her to move her business forward and obtain the necessary income to give her the opportunity to continue supporting her family; an opportunity that is brought to her by Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy some kitchen utensils and ingredients to keep making her recipes such as chicken, flour, cheese and other items.

loans.name: Ender Manuel

texts.es:
Con mucho empuje y perseverancia, Ender desea iniciar un negocio de cría y levante de cerdos en su casa ubicada en el municipio de Lorica.

Esta idea surge a partir de la necesidad de generar unos buenos ingresos para colaborar con el sostenimiento del hogar en que vive con sus padres.

Se caracteriza por ser un joven alegre y muy colaborador, cualidades que han hecho que se gane el cariño y respeto de la gente de la vereda.
Con este préstamo podrá dar inicio a este negocio.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de cerdos pequeños y en materiales para construcción de una cochera.
texts.en:
With much energy and perseverance, Ender wants to start a business raising pigs at his home located in the town of Lorica. 

This idea came about from the necessity to earn a good income in order to contribute to the expenses of the household in which he lives with his parents.

He is known for being a cheerful and cooperative young man, qualities for which he has earned the affection and respect of the people in his area. With this loan, he will be able to start this business.

The money will be used to purchase small pigs and materials to build a pig sty.

loans.use: to buy small pigs and materials to build a pig sty.

loans.name: Aurelio Antonio

texts.es:
Aurelio, un Padre de 58 años de edad con 2 hijos a su cuidado de ha podido sostener a su familia gracias a que trabaja como productor agropecuario en la finca de sus padres. 
Solicita un crédito para iniciar su propio negocio, una pequeña empresa que iniciaría con Pollos pequeños los cuales criara y alimentara en los campos de sus padres, la iniciativa la tomo básicamente por sus hijos porque quiere disfrutar con ellos de una mejor vida, que estudien y que todos los días tengan un motivo para sonreír. 

Apoyen a este empresario que quiere demostrar que con fe y con amor a la familia todo se puede lograr.
texts.en:
Aurelio, 58, has 2 children and makes a living working his parent's land.  He is applying for a loan to start his own business raising and selling chickens.  He plans to buy chicks, raise them in a yard on his parent's property and sell them when they are ready for market.  He started the business because he wants to give his children a good education and a chance for a better life.  He hopes too to give them, every day, a reason to smile.  

Please help this enterprising man show what faith and love can do to pull a family ahead.

loans.use: to start a poultry business.

loans.name: Mok

texts.en:
Mok, 35, is a married man who lives in the small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has three children who are currently in school. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland which is located near his house. On his farmland, he grows rice and sells his agricultural product to the local dealers. On average, he can generate an earning of USD 2 per day.

The current farmland that he owns is small and it can provide less benefit to him. He wants to enlarge his farmland area but he can’t without money. Therefore, now he would like to get a Kiva loan to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice. He hopes this additional farmland will help to improve his living conditions. 

He is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Monica De Carmen

texts.es:
Monica es madre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre. Aparte de su familia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 6 años. 
Aprendió de este negocio empíricamente, es decir a través de la práctica y la observación de otras personas. Ella y su familia viven en zona rural de Jardin en la cual no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros como los que ofrece la Corporación Interactuar. 

Su crédito lo piensa usar en la compra de insumos agropecuarios como semillas, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para realizar mantenimiento y sostenimiento a sus cultivos de papaya.

Gracias a este crédito, la economía y  calidad de vida de su familia mejoraría pues podrá aumentar sus ingresos.  
 
Monica sueña terminar con la legalización de los papeles de su tierra y así tener en pleno el control de sus tierras.
 ¡Impacte la vida de Monica y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Monica is a mother of 2 children, living in a common law marriage. Apart from her family, she has devoted herself to farming for the last six years. She has learned the business through experience, that is to say by doing it her self and by observing others.

She and her family live in Jardín, a rural area where access to financial services such as those offered by Corporación Interactuar is hard to come by.
She intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, pest control products, and fertilizers to maintain and sustain her papaya crop.

Thanks to this loan her family’s finances and quality of life would improve as her income would increase. Monica dreams of finishing with the legal paperwork regarding her land, thereby gaining complete control over her property. 

Make a difference for Monica and her family with a loan!

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, pest control products and fertilizers to maintain and sustain her papaya crop.

loans.name: Neva

texts.en:
Neva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct selling natasha products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of natasha products to sell for her business.

Neva has been in this business for four years. Neva earns more income from food vending.

Neva has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of natasha products to sell

loans.name: Alcides De Jesus

texts.es:
A sus 40 años de edad Alcides logró consolidar un negocio de tejeduría gracias a la experiencia que tuvo trabajando en talleres, trabaja de lunes a sábado entre 9 y 11 horas diarias dependiendo la cantidad de trabajo y sabe que gracias a sus clientes tiene buen negocio. 
Quiere ampliar sus horizontes y lograr ofrecer trabajo a las personas más necesitadas por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como hilos y aceites para sus tejidos con la que podrá expandirse a nuevas empresas y tener mejor volumen de trabajo dándole la oportunidad a una persona de trabajar. 
Su sueño es seguir creciendo y conformar un taller y así un día contar la historia de que gracias a colaboradores y prestadores del portal Kiva y a la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar pudo montar un gran negocio.
texts.en:
At forty years of age, Alcides has been successful in putting together a textile business, thanks to the experience he has had working in wearving shops.  He works from Monday to Saturday, between nine and eleven hours a day, depending on the amount of work he has, and he knows that, thanks to his clients, he has a good business.
Alcides wants to broaden his horizons and be able to offer work to some needy people and for this reason is asking for a loan for supplies, such as yarn and oils for textile manufacture, with which he will be able to expand into new businesses. This will give him a greater volume of business and provide the opportunity to another person to work. His dream is to continue to grow and to set up a new facility and so one day tell the story of how, thanks to the partners and lenders of Kiva and the help of Corporacion Interactuar, he was able to establish a fine company.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as yarn and oils for the manufacture of fabrics

loans.name: Virgina

texts.en:
Virgina is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as onions, garlic, and vegetables.

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Natalina is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy onions, garlic, and vegetables

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
Catarina lives in Ermera, and she is married and has three children. She has a store and every day people always buy some goods in the market, so she had the idea to open her store in that place. So now she is applying for a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including cooking oils, aqua, biscuits, noodles, milk, sardines, sweets, lighters and other things to sell, including soft drinks. 

Catarina has been involving in business activities since a few months ago. She started with her own working capital of $200. She is earning a good income from her business because many people like to buy it, so she is still happy to do her business. And with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she hopes to make her business a bigger store. She also has animals like cows, pigs, chickens, and dogs.

loans.use: to buy cooking oils, aqua, biscuits, noodles, milk, sardines, sweets, lighters, and other things to sell

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
A villager of Thala Barivat district in Steung Treng province, middle-aged Mom is married with four children. Mom has been planting sweet potatoes and raising pigs for four years, which earn her 5 USD profit each day. 

As a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for the second time, Mom is applying for a loan of 1,600,000 KHR for her sweet potato plantation. It is intended for hiring workers to clear the land and to harvest the potatoes. She wishes that the profit from the potato plantation will help her family financially.

loans.use: to hire workers to clear the land and to harvest the potatoes

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Thala Barivat District

loans.name: Luz Margoth

texts.es:
Luz, de 45 años, inicio con un negocio de masajes hace aproximadamente 10 años con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.
En el momento, encuentra su motivación para trabajar incansablemente en sus tres hijos y es así como desea ofrecerles lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo Y se han convertido en la alegría de esta mujer trabajadora.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como una camilla, aceites y materiales de trabajo.
Con este préstamo podrá sostener su negocio y a sus hijos brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor.
Apoya a Luz para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Luz, age 45, started a massage business approximately ten years ago.  She did this out of the desire to find a business activity to generate income for her in order to be able to survive.

At the moment, she finds her motivation to work tirelessly in her three children.  This way she wishes to give them the best for the lives and their development.  They have become the joy of this hard-working woman.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies like a massage table, oils, and work materials.  With this loan she will be able to sustain her business and her children, providing them with a better quality of life.

Support Luz so that she will be able to continue with her business activity.

loans.use: to buy supplies like a massage table, oils, and work materials.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma enjoys raising livestock for sale and has earned enough income for the family's daily needs. She has successfully repaid her previous loan from GMDPC from her livestock income. Norma has received an approved new loan to purchase organic feed and vaccination medicines to avoid viral infections and bacterial diseases. She plans to expand her duck raising business to increase revenue for better living and for savings for old age.

loans.use: to purchase organic feed and vaccination medicines for the ducks.

loans.name: Jose Rosario

texts.es:
Jose tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en esta comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en este sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto Jose espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ganancias y le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 22 years old, unmarried and lives in his own house in the district of Pucará in the province of Cajamarca, which is located in the northern highlands of Peru. Life in this community is tranquil and people earn their living in agriculture, raising livestock and commerce.

José works in the cultivation of coffee. He has ten years of experience in this agricultural sector and has very good personal and work references in the region. This loan will go to the purchase of compost and fertilizers for the improvement of his coffee crop. He hopes to offer coffee of higher quality to his clients, generating increased income and permitting him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers to maintain and improve his coffee crop.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy, 29 years old, has five children, two of them in school. Juvy works very hard to provide for them. For the past year, Juvy has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as canned goods, sugar, beverages, groceries, etc. to sell. In the future, Juvy would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as canned goods, sugar, beverages, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Gladys Isabel

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer de campo con empuje y perseverancia, vive con sus 4 hijos en una humilde finca en zona rural de Lorica. Ella es madre responsable y durante todo este tiempo ha tenido el valor y coraje de sacar a sus hijos por sus propios medios.
Ella se gana la vida con la cría y producción de cerdos de engorde, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años con el fin de obtener los recursos suficientes para la manutención de su familia. Ella trabaja todos los días ya que sus cerdos requieren de aseo, alimentación y monitoreo constante para su correcto desarrollo y posterior venta.

Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar concentrado y alimento para sus animales, dándole la oportunidad de tener unas crías mejor alimentadas y con mejores condiciones para el consumo.

Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos como profesionales y con la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Gladys grew up in the country and is known for her perseverance and drive.  She and her 4 children live on a modest farm in a rural part of Lorica.  She is a responsible mother and has long found the strength and courage to provide for her children without depending on help from anyone else.  She has operated a business raising and selling pigs for 10 years and has always earned enough to support her family.  She works every day because her pigs require daily feeding and constant monitoring to develop properly.

Gladys is applying for a loan that she will use to buy animal feed.  The investment will give her the capital she needs to ensure that the pigs are well-fed and raised to a standard that will maximize her income when she sells them.

For the future, Gladys wants her children to get good educations and go on to paid careers.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pig sales business.

loans.name: Adriana Patricia

texts.es:
Adriana es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la confección, prestando el servicio a terceros.
Todo comenzó hace unos meses cuando trabajaba como operaria en un taller de confección; hoy en día, a sus 50 años de edad, ya tiene su propio taller en el que genera 1 empleo directoa un joven; trabaja todos los días y su fortaleza es la fabricación de pantalones y camisas de uniformes; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en el mantenimiento preventivo a sus maquinas, así podrá cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna, con el fin aumentar la producción y adquirir nuevos contratos, que permitan darle continuidad a su microempresa.
Adriana sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción para generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia como la de las personas que influyen diariamente en su labor.
texts.en:
Adriana is a dedicated and hard-working micro-entrepreneur. Her field of work is sewing clothes, and she provides service to third-parties (wholesale). Everything began a few months ago when she was working as an operator of a clothes making workshop. Today, at the age of 50, she now has her own workshop which has one direct employee, a young man [pictured above]. She works every day and her specialty is making pants and shirts for work uniforms. In this manner she generates sufficient resources to support her husband with the financial responsibilities of their home.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the preventive maintenance of her machines. Thus she will be able to fulfill the requirements of her customers and deliver the orders on time, with the goal of increasing production and acquiring new contracts that will allow for continuity in her small business. Adriana dreams of continuing to strengthen her workshop and having a greater level of production each day in order to generate new opportunities for employment and to improve the quality of life for her family and for the people that are influenced each day by her work.

loans.use: to invest in the preventive maintenance of her sewing machines.

loans.name: Maria Yanibe

texts.es:
Maria, a sus 35 años de edad, es madre de 1 hijo, al que ha sacado adelante con arduo esfuerzo y dedicación. 
Durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado como comerciante independiente en su propio almacén de ropa; allí trabaja todos los días durante 10 horas y ha logrado generar los ingresos para solventar las necesidades familiares.
Expresa que su interés con el crédito es invertir en la compra de surtido al por mayor como blusas, jeans, pantalones de dama, entre otros para abastecerse lo suficiente y poder satisfacer los gustos de su clientela con la variedad que ofrecerá; esto le ayudará a mejorar las ventas  y los ingresos que recibe, además le hará frente a su mayor desafío que es sostenerse frente a la competencia desleal que se presenta en el sector. 
Maria manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y pagar la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria is 35 years old. She is the mother of one child, whom she has moved forward with great effort and dedication. For a long time, she has worked as an independent merchant in her own clothing store. There, she works for 10 hours every day, and she has managed to earn an income to support her family's needs.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise at wholesale such as blouses, jeans, and pants for women, among other things, in order to stock up and satisfy the tastes of her customers with the variety that she will offer. This will help her improve her sales as well as the income that she receives. In addition, this will help her face her greatest challenge, which is defending herself against the unfair competition that is present in the sector.

Maria states that her greatest desires are improving her housing conditions and paying for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale such as blouses, jeans, and pants for women, among other things, in order to stock up.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith, 41 years old, is married and has four children, all in school. Judith works very hard to provide for them. For the past 2 years, Judith has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to purchase a solar lamp. In the future, Judith would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Maruf

texts.ru: Маъруф мужчина 36 лет, женат, счастливый отец четверых детей. Маъруф родился в сельской местности и вот уже на протяжение пятнадцати с лишним лет занимается земледелием.В начале он работал у соседей на поле, ухаживал за скотом и выращивал овощи в огороде. Со временем накопив деньги Маъруф смог на купить семена овощей и фруктов и посадил их на своей земле. Маъруф работал день и ночь, оплодотворял почву, срывал сорняки. Сейчас у него большой участок земли, где он выращивает картошку, морковь и другие фрукты и овощи. Весь урожай Маъруф отвозит на рынок с последующей продажей. Он хочет закупить семена и оплодотворить почву, но в настоящее время у Маъруфа нет полной суммы денег. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Маъруф надеется, что МДО Арванд откликнется на его просьбу о помощи и выделит ему нужную сумму. Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Maaruf is a 36-year old man, married and the happy father of four. Maaruf was born in a rural area. He has been raising farm crops for over 15 years. At first he worked in his neighbors field, took care of livestock and grew garden vegetables. Eventually Maaruf has saved up to buy fruit and vegetables seeds for planting on his own land. Maaruf worked day and night fertilizing the soil and removing weeds. At present he has a large land plot, where he grows potatoes, carrots and other fruits and vegetables. All harvested produce is brought to the market for sale. Maaruf would like to buy seeds and fertilizers but is short of the full amount necessary. This is why he has applied to the Arvand microfinance institution for financial support. Maaruf hopes that Arvand will respond to his plea and grant him the loan for the amount still needed. He thanks you in advance for your trust and support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his land.

loans.name: Fritang Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario esta formado por tres mujeres: Sarah, Aimojean y Magdalena) de la  ciudad de Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan  por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de: Pulpería, venta de frito y venta de ropa usada. Con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida, se organizaron hace un año para acceder a financiamiento con garantía solidaria.

 Sara: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora jovial de 47 años de edad, casada, tiene 7 hijos: 4 de ellos son mayores de edad e independientes y 3 menores de edad. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de frito, con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos y apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar insumos e ingredientes: filipitas, pollo, repollo, tomate, vinagre, sal, aceite y chivería, para diversificar sus productos y poco a poco establecer una pulperia. Su sueño es tener una tienda de ropa usada.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of three women; Sarah, Aimojean, and Magdalena, from the city of Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas.  They are enterprising women who struggle to make their small businesses grow.  Their businesses are a grocery store, selling fried food, and selling used clothes.  In order to improve their quality of life, they organized themselves a year ago in order to access a group loan.

Sara is a member of the communal bank.  She is a jovial, 47 year old woman.  She is married and has seven children.  Four of them are grown and independent, and three of them are minors.  She has been selling fried food for three years.  She does this in order to have her own source of income and to pay the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies and ingredients like bananas, chicken, cabbage, tomatoes, vinegar, salt, cooking oil, and snacks in order to diversify her products and to, little by little, establish a grocery store.  Her dream is to have a used clothes store.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients to make fried food.

loans.name: Nen's Group

texts.en: Nen, a 48-year-old mother and wife, lives in a rural village in Koh Sotin district, Kampong Cham province with her family. Nen has been a rice farmer for 30 years. She manages to save $5 US a day. As a new member of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, Nen is leading her group to request a loan of 900,000 KHR. She plans to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her rice plantation. She anticipates that the profit from the rice farm will help her financially and allow her children to go to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Et

texts.en:
Et, 34, lives in a rural area of Kampong Chan Province, Cambodia. He has two children who are currently in school. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business in a small farmland. He primarily grows rice and sells his agricultural product to local dealers and customers at the market. So far, he has been in this type of business for 20 years. 

On average, he is able to make an earning of USD 2.00 a day. Currently, he would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow him to have a personal vehicle so that he can experience a convenient way of travelling. He is thankful to all lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Virgen De La Misericordia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de la Misericordia  está en su ciclo número 15 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo que viene trabajando desde hace ya muchos ciclos, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Zulma quien se dedica a la venta de lencerías varias, teniendo su propio ingreso , también se debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación, que hace un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Zulma solicita de este préstamo para la compra de lencerías, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Virgen de la Misericordia group is in its 15th loan cycle in the program of women's committees. It is a group that has been working for many cycles, where all work and help each other to get ahead. They are completing the poverty elimination questionnaire to be able to know the life situation of each one.

One of the members is Zulma who works selling a variety of lingerie, having her own income, and who also stands out in her work at the foundation, which has an ongoing process of training and verification that in some ways demands and at the same time motivates the woman to fight to be able to overcome the poverty.  

Zulma asks for this loan to purchase lingerie, which will help her to formalize her business plan, which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando es un hombre de 37 años de edad el cual se desempeña como padre amoroso y como agricultor, en vista de que los ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, comenzó con una actividad que realiza en los ratos libres que le quedan como jornalero en otras fincas y es la cría y venta de cerdos de engorde con los que intenta mejorar las condición es de vida de su familia ya que como cabeza de familia está a cargo de todos los gastos en su hogar por lo que no le queda mucho capital para invertir en su negocio. 
Es por esta razón que requiere un crédito para la compra de cerdos de engorde y concentrados con los que podrá mejorar sus ventas e impulsar esta actividad, teniendo más activas en su micro negocio y haciendo más atractivo a la vista de los clientes pues tendrá más cerdos para ofertar.
Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad pues es algo que vivió y que lo afecto de gran manera por esta razón trabaja incansablemente por sus hijos y su esposa.
Apoya a un campesino del campo Colombiano con grandes sueños para su familia!
texts.en:
Rolando, 37, is a farmer and a loving father.  He works as a day laborer and started his business in the time he has between jobs.  He started the business because his income from temporary work doesn't stretch far enough to support his family and the business--raising and selling pigs--is his means of making an extra income and better providing for his family.  

Rolando has very little money left after paying for everyday expenses so he is applying for a loan to fund the growth of his business.  He will use the loan to buy pigs and pig feed, an investment that will help him to expand the business and increase his income.  The business will be more attractive to customers, he says, if he has more pigs to sell.  For the future, Rolando hopes to ensure that his wife and children never lack for anything that they need and says that he will continue to work tirelessly for his family.

Please support this Colombian campesino and his dreams for his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed for his animal sales business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 47 years old and a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.
