Angelita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Angelita has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 59 years old and married with seven children. With one of her children in school, Letecia works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as cigarettes, canned goods, junk foods, groceries, etc.

She has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as cigarettes, canned goods, junk foods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Liliana Maria

texts.es:
Liliana es una mujer emprendedora de 46 años de edad, madre de dos hios de y convive con su compañero sentimental en unión libre. 

Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en diferentes talleres de confecciones como operaria de máquina, razón por la cual posee experiencia y conocimientos en el manejo de este tipo de negocios; pero, ya cansada de trabajar en otros talleres y con el ánimo de pasar más tiempo con su familia, decidió emprender su propio taller de estampacion, para lo cual solicita el crédito que será invertido en la compra de tres sublimadoras.

Esto le permitirá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar un buen impacto en el sector para que le genere una rentabilidad favorable y así lograr cumplir el sueño de posicionarse en el mercado. 

Con su empuje y ambición se proyecta en un futuro a mediano plazo generando empleo siempre de la mano de la Corporación Interactuar
texts.en:
Liliana is an enterprising woman, 46 years old, mother of 2 children who lives with her partner in a common-law marriage.

During her working life, she has worked in different clothing workshops as a machine operator, so she has experience and knowledge in running this type of business. But, tired of working in other shops and wanting to spend more time with her family, she decided to open her own stamping shop, for which she is asking for a loan which will be invested in the purchase of three dye sublimation machines. 

This will allow her to initiate her work project with which she hopes to make a good impact in the sector so that it generates a favorable profit and in this way manage to achieve her dream of positioning herself in the market. 

With her drive and ambition, she projects in the medium-term future generating jobs, always with the hand of Coporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to purchase three dye sublimation machines to begin.

loans.name: Olga Victoria

texts.es:
Olga es una joven con toda la energía y disposición para enfrentar el mundo y superarse.

Desea iniciar un negocio de venta de productos Amway, con este negocio podría obtener ingresos para poder mantener y sostener a su madre.

Es una joven muy aplicada pues estudia y tiene deseos de salir adelante y ser profesional.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de productos de esta marca.

Con este préstamo puede cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y darle a su madre todo lo que necesite, además de poder pagar sus estudios y progresar gracias al apoyo de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya el proyecto de una joven emprendedora Colombiana!
texts.en:
Olga is a young woman with all the energy and disposition to face the world and improve herself.

She wants to start a business selling Amway products. With this business, she would be able to get income to be able to maintain and support her mother.

She is a very diligent young woman since she goes to school and has desires to get ahead and be a professional.

She asks for a loan to purchase an assortment of products from this brand. 

With this loan, she can achieve her dream of being independent and giving her mother everything she needs, in addition to being able to pay for her schooling and progress thanks to the support of Kiva and Corporación Interactuar.

Support this enterprising young Colombian's project!

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of personal care products.

loans.name: Yim's Group

texts.en:
An elderly mother of seven, Yim resides in a small rural village in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham. She and her husband have been farming rice for 38 years. Yim's secondary income is from raising livestock. The couple saves around $6 US daily. 

Yim is a new member of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and leader of her two-member loan group. She is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR for her rice farm. She plans to hire workers to plow her rice field and to buy good quality rice seed. Her purpose is to keep expanding her rice plantation.

loans.use: to hire workers to plow her rice field and to buy good quality rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nancy Andrea

texts.es:
Nancy, una campesina muy amorosa y de gran pasión por la naturaleza, trabaja con animales, pero no sacrificándolos ni vendiéndolos solamente, trabaja con la leche de las vacas; es tanta la admiración y respeto por los animales que prefiere que mueran por vejez antes de tener que sacrificarles para conseguir una rentabilidad por su carne. 
Es madre de 1 niña de 2 años de edad trabaja enseñándole la pasión por el campo, por amar la naturaleza y el amor por los animales. 
Pensando en su vivienda y en su hija la señora Nancy quiere expandirse y por tal motivo tiene un dinero juntado para comprar una vaca lechera pro lo que requiere un crédito para ajustar el dinero suficiente para comprar la vaca pues si abona un capital y queda debiendo el otro los interés serían muy altos y estaría pagando el doble de la vaca. 
Con la ayuda de esta vaca tendrá más producción lechera garantizando una vida económica estable para el futuro de ella y su hija. 
Sueña con tener una finca con muchas vacas rodearse de estos mamíferos que le ayudan a llevar el sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Nancy, a very loving farmer with a great passion for nature, works with animals, but not just butchering and selling them; she works with cow's milk.  Her admiration and respect for the animals is such that she prefers that they die of old age rather than butchering them to make money from their meat. 

She is the mother of a two-year-old little girl; she works demonstrating her passion for the county, for loving nature, and for loving animals. 

Thinking of her home and her daughter, Nancy wants to expand, which is why she has some money saved up to buy a dairy cow.  She needs a loan to reach the amount of money she needs to buy this cow, as if she puts some money down while still owing more, the interest will be very high and she would end up paying double for the cow.  

With the help of this cow her milk production will increase, which will guarantee stable finances for hers and her daughter's future. 

She dreams of having a farm with a lot of cows, surrounding herself with these mammals that help support her family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for her farm.

loans.name: Na's Group

texts.en: Elderly mother Na is living with her husband and two of her seven children in a rural village of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She has been a rice farmer for 34 years to support the family. Sometimes, she also helps neighbors with harvesting to earn extra income. Na is able to contribute around 5 USD to the family budget daily. Being a member with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for 5 cycles now, Na is a leader of her group of two and applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. The loan will be used to buy good quality rice seed for her rice farm. Since the previously loans had helped improving their living standard, Na hopes that the profit from the rice farm will allow her to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy good quality rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.en: Demetrio owns and manages his farm happily. His farm activities are planting and harvesting crops and selling rice in the local community to earn for the family's needs. Demetrio earned and repaid GDMPC on his previous loan from his farming income. He got a new loan to buy organic fertilizers and pesticides for the full production of his rice farm. He hopes to increase his profit generated from farming to expand his rice fields and to have retirement for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers and pesticides for full rice production

loans.name: Flor Nohelia

texts.es:
Laboriosa y soñadora, son dos palabras que describen perfectamente a Flor, una mujer trabajadora y de familia, que hace lo que este a su alcance para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposo.
Se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos en el municipio de Caparrapi.
Esta es una actividad muy común en esta región y gran parte de sus habitantes la practican.
Ella posee gran conocimiento en esta materia y considera que necesita un pequeño impulso para incrementar sus ventas y aumentar su negocio, es por esta razón que solicita un auxilio económico para invertirlo en la compra de materiales para el mantenimiento del corral donde alberga sus animales además de poder comprar más lechones y alimento para los mismos.
Con este préstamo podrá continuar con su actividad que es la única fuente de ingresos de su familia.
Se siente agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva y con la Corporación Interactuar que hacen posible que su negocio crezca y mejore.
texts.en:
Hardworking and a dreamer are two words that describe Flor perfectly; she is a hardworking family woman who does what she can to offer her children and husband a better quality of life. 

She works raising and selling pigs in the municipality of Caparrapi.

This is a very common profession in this region and a large part of its residents work in it. 

She is very knowledgable about this field and she believes she needs a small boost to increase her sales and expand her business.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to invest in materials to maintain the corral where she keeps her animals, as well as to buy more piglets and feed for them. 

With this loan she will be able to continue with her business, which is her family's only source of income. 

She is thankful to Kiva's lenders and to Corporación Interactuar, who are making it possible for her business to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy materials to maintain the corral where she keeps her animals

loans.name: Luz Carmensa

texts.es:
Luz de 29 años de edad, se ha ganado el cariño de todos sus vecinos por su amabilidad y buen sentido del humor. Ama su familia, la cual es el motor principal para luchar cada día y generar el sustento para sobrevivir. Aunque no contaba con recursos para iniciar su negocio, esto no fue impedimento para cumplir su sueño de convertirse en comerciante, con un pequeño capital, esta mujer inició con un negocio de tienda de abarrotes.
Sus sueños no paran, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de estanterías para ubicar sus productos y hacerlos más visibles y atractivos a sus clientes, además comprara surtido de productos de la canasta familiar para abastecer su negocio. 
Espera poder mejorar su condición económica, poder tener una vejez sin preocupaciones monetarias y garantizarle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Luz, 29 years old, has earned the affection of all her neighbors for her friendliness and good sense of humor. She loves her family, which is her primary drive to struggle each day and generate the sustenance to survive. Although she didn't have resources to open her business, this was not an impediment to achieve her dream of becoming a businesswoman. With a little capital, this woman opened her grocery store business.

Her dreams don't stop, for this reason she is asking for a loan that she will invest in the purchase of shelving to hold her products and make them more visible and attractive to the customers. In addition, she will purchase an assortment of basic pantry products to stock her business.

She hopes to be able to improve her economic condition, to be able to have an old age without monetary concerns and guarantee a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase shelves to hold her products and make them more visible.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hard-working entrepreneur who is a glass and aluminum dealer in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional glass and aluminum for her business.

Arlene has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional glass and aluminum for her business

loans.name: Walter De Jesus

texts.es:
Walter es un hombre con gran empuje y emprendimiento, desde hace un tiempo se determino a encontrar una actividad que le generar buenos ingresos y que le permitiera ser independiente, es así como desde hace 8 años inicio con un negocio de bar en el municipio de Medellín.
Es un negocio bastante popular en el sector y se ha convertido en punto de encuentro para adultos.
Con tan poco tiempo en el mercado ya tiene cierto nivel de reconocimiento gracias a la buena gestión de Walter.
El solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de un amplificador de sonido para su negocio en la parte donde tiene ubicadas las mesas ya que quiere hacerla mucho más atractiva y cómoda para sus clientes.
El trabaja solo y desea generar empleos.
texts.en:
Walter is a man with great drive and entrepreneurship. A while ago, he set out determined to find work that would allow him to earn a good income and be independent. Therefore, 8 years ago, he started a bar business in the city of Medellin. His business is very popular in the sector, and it has become a meeting place for adults. Even though it has been in the market for such little time, this business already has a certain level of recognition as a result of Walter's management.

He is requesting a loan to buy a sound amplifier for his business, which he will put in the place where the tables are located. He hopes to make his bar more attractive and comfortable for his customers. Walter works alone, and he wishes to create jobs.

loans.use: to buy a sound amplifier for his business.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 66 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Celia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to pay the laborers salaries for land cultivation.

Celia has been farming rice for 40 years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay the laborers' salaries for land cultivation

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 62 years old and widowed with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Lilia has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: A $600 loan is offered to Cecilia to improve her business. Cecilia lives in Ermera. She is married to a teacher, and she has four children. Most of Cecilia's daily income is from selling cows so she is happy to do her business. She started selling cows in 2012, with her own working capital. With her husband, she was going to add money to their principal amount to buy another cow, because it has become their activity. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more cows in the future. And she will to has a management for her business. She also cultivates animals in her place such as cows, pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Corriente De Agua Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está conformado por 4 mujeres alegres: Prisca, María Sebastiana, venden nacatamales en sus viviendas de tambo de madera, Hilda vende ropa usada y Edelmira tiene una pequeña pulpería. Todas viven en Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron hace 2 años, con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para accesar a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios, aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.

Prisca: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora amable de 65 años de edad, casada, con 10 hijos mayores de edad. Desde hace 4 años, vende nacatamales, enchiladas y frito en su casa de tambo de madera. De esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar insumos e ingredientes para los productos que elabora: Masa, carne de cerdo, hierba buena, papas, tomates, filipitas, vinagre, repollo, pollo, arroz, aceite, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 4 cheerful women. Prisca and María Sebastiana sell nacatamales [a kind of tamal wrapped in banana leaves] from their wooden stilt homes. Hilda sells used clothing and Edelmira has a small grocery store. They all live in Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. 

They got together 2 years ago with the purpose of working together to obtain loans from Pana Pana to have the chance to improve their small businesses, increase their incomes, and thereby improve the quality of life for their families. 

Prisca is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a pleasant 65 year old woman, and is married with 10 grown children. For the last 4 years she has sold nacatamales [a kind of tamal wrapped in a banana leaf], enchiladas and fried snacks from her wooden stilt home. This is how she contributes to her household income. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase supplies and ingredients for the products that she makes: masa dough, pork, mint, potatoes, tomatoes, bananas, vinegar, cabbage, chicken, rice, and oil among other products. She dreams of opening a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients to make fried snacks, nacatamales and enchiladas.

loans.name: On's Group

texts.en: Residing in a small town in Koh Sotin district, Kampong Cham province, 31-year-old On is a wife and a mother of three. Her kids are still attending school. Her primary source of income for 13 years has been farming rice. In her free time, On weaves silk to earn additional income. She manages to save 6 USD a day for future use. This is the first time that On is with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her group includes three people with her being the leader. They are applying for a 1,400,000 KHR loan each. Her portion of the loan will be used to buy potash for her rice farm and silk for weaving. She wishes for her family situation to be improved and for her kids to complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy potash and silk

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Justino

texts.en:
Justino is 62 years old, married and blessed with three children. He has been in farming for six years and has able to sustain his business up to this present time and provide for his family's daily needs. 

He joined GDMPC four years ago, and recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC to buy organic fertilizers for his rice farm. He hopes for an increased harvest for the upcoming harvest season so that he could save more and could expand his rice farm. The profit generated from the farming expansion will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers for full rice production.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 43 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Elvira is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Elvira has been raising livestock for two years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Liliana Patricia

texts.es:
Liliana es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su labor. Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le han presentado. 
Desde hace 15 años inició su propio negocio, un salón de belleza que ubicó en un espacio de la casa donde reside, además, también presta el servicio a domicilio, según el requerimiento de sus clientes. 
Trabaja todos los días durante 5 horas sola
Esto le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y a solventar las necesidades de su única hija. 

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de un secador para el cabello e insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, shampoo, acondicionador, esmaltes para uñas, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes, de una manera más ágil y eficiente; lo que beneficiará el margen de utilidades que percibe por su labor. 

Liliana manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder continuar con su labor, acreditar y fortalecer bien su negocio para lograr ser más competitiva en el mercado y así tener la capacidad para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Liliana is a woman dedicated to her family and her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to get ahead, surpassing diverse obstacles that have presented themselves.

15 years ago, she started her own business, a beauty salon that was located in a space in the house where she lives. Additionally, she also offers door-to-door service, according to the requirement of her clients.

She works alone every day for 5 hours. This has allowed her to generate sufficient resources to support her husband with the economic burden of the home and settle the needs of her only daughter.

She will invest the loan she's applying for in a hairdryer and supplies in bulk (hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner, nail polish, among others). This will allow her to continue with her work and offer a more complete service to her clients, in a more agile and efficient manner. This will benefit the profit margin that she earns for her labor. 

Liliana says that her greatest desire is to be able to continue with her work, accredit and strengthen her business well to be able to achieve being more competitive in the market and therefore have the capacity to offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy a hairdryer and supplies in bulk (hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner, nail polish, among others).

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
Mary Cris is 22 years old with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Cris runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, sugar, groceries, etc.

Mary Cris has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Mary Cris would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, sugar, groceries, etc.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
John, con 49 años de edad, se ha dedicado por muchos años a vender abarrotes en una tienda en el municipio de Yarumal; de esta forma complementa los ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido luchar incansablemente, siempre buscando la manera de salir adelante, esto lo impulsa a solicitar el crédito para comprar una vitrina y comprará surtido al por mayor como mecato, gaseosas, dulces, productos de panadería, entre otros, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y tendrá más variedad de artículos para ofrecer a los clientes, mejorando así las ventas y los ingresos.

John manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir un local propio ubicado en el centro de la ciudad para montar su negocio y lograr que sea mucho más rentable y que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

El confía en el apoyo de la Corporación interactuar y en los prestamistas de Kiva para lograr este objetivo.
texts.en:
John is 49 years old and has been selling groceries for many years at a store in the town of Yarumal. This is how he supplements his income with which he has raised his children. His tenacity and perseverance have allowed him to fight tirelessly, always looking for a way to get ahead. 

This is what is motivating him to request this loan with which he will buy a display case and a supply of merchandise at wholesale such as snacks, soda, candy, baked goods, etc. This will allow him to keep his business running and to have more variety of items to offer his customers, thereby improving his sales and increasing his income. 

John states that his greatest challenge is acquiring a shop of his own for his business in the center of the city where it would be much more profitable and financially stable. This would allow him to provide a better quality of life for his family. He is relying on the support of Interactuar and on Kiva lenders so he can achieve this objective.

loans.use: to buy a display case and a supply of snacks, soda, candy, and baked goods at wholesale.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Maxima works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Maxima is borrowing PHP 4000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Maxima has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Sengyan's Group

texts.en:
A Tbaung Khmum resident, Sengyan is 52 years old and married. Three of her five children are living with her and her husband.

To finance her family, they have been raising pigs for sale and farming rice for 27 years. They manage to keep 6 USD for saving every day.

Sengyan has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) once before. Leading her group, she is applying for a 2,000,000 KHR loan for her pig sale business. It will be used to buy piglets and pig feed. She believes it will bring her more profits.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sola's Group

texts.en:
Thirty-six-year-old Sola is from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She has three children. One of them is in primary school, and the rest are still under the age of six.

To manage her family’s finances, Sola and her husband have been raising pigs for sale and farming rice for 17 years. Together they can save roughly 6 USD a day.

This is the second time that Sola is with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Leading her group, she is seeking a loan of 4,700,000 KHR for her group. Her portion of the loan will be used to buy piglets to raise for sale. She hopes to gain more profits from this.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Noem's Group

texts.en: Noem is a married woman with three children. She is living with her family in a remote village of Thala Barivat district, Steung Treng province. For 30 years, Noem and her husband have been farming rice and fishing to support the family. They manage to save 6 USD per day. Noem has been a member of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for two cycles already. Leading her group of three, she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR for her rice farm. She is going to buy potash and rice seed for it. She wishes to repair her house with the profit from her harvest.

loans.use: to buy potash and rice seed

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Thala Barivat District

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy millet.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 56 years old and has six children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Conchita is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

Conchita has been raising cattle for five years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Conchita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her cattle

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina, age 63 and married, runs a general store to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for seven years. In her store, she sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, coffee, sugar, and candies.

Fedelina requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Fedelina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jeline

texts.en:
Jeline, age 35, is a fish vendor. She has been engaged in this business for five years. She and her husband have four children, all of whom attend school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jeline requested a loan in the amount of PhP 8,000. She will use her loan funds to buy more fish to offer for sale.

In the future, Jeline would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Myriam De Jesus

texts.es:
Myriam, con 69 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, una visionaria y buena negociante. 
Siempre ha trabajado como comerciante, vendiendo calzado en el municipio de Medellin y, desde hace 20 años tiene su propio negocio.  
Ha sabido superar tiempos difíciles en el comercio y sueña con comprarse su casa propia y tener un negocio que perdure en el tiempo; es por ello que Myriam acudió a solicitar un préstamo, el cual utilizará para comprar surtido e inventario de calzado. 
Myriam es una mujer muy organizada aunque ha tenido que enfrentar la competencia comercial del sector.  
La suma de todos sus esfuerzos le brindan a toda su familia una calidad de vida excelente.
texts.en:
69 year old Myriam is married and is the mother of 4 children. She can be described as a very responsible, hardworking woman; a visionary, and a good business woman.
She has always worked in business, selling shoes in the city of Medellín, and she has had her own store for 20 years. 
She has learned to overcome difficult times for the business and dreams of buying her own house and having a business that endures. This is why she decided to request a loan which she will use to buy supplies and inventory of shoes.
Myriam is a very organized woman though she has faced competition in the commercial sector. 
The outcome of all her efforts is that she can offer her family an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and shoe inventory.

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer pujante, servicial y trabajadora, a sus 50 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Desde hace 7 años se desempeña en el campo de la confección, prestando el servicio de confección a terceros y a clientes directos, el oficio lo aprendió a través de clases y trabaja sola todos los días, así genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

Actualmente se motiva a solicitar el crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor como telas, hilos, resorte, entre otros, esto le permitirá tener material disponible para cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos que tiene pendientes, logrando fidelizar a sus clientes actuales.

Gloria manifiesta que desea continuar realizando su labor con mucho empeño, pues quiere ampliar su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo, además de garantizar una estabilidad económica para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is a vigorous, helpful, and hardworking woman. She is 50 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children who she has raised with much effort and dedication.
She has worked in the dress-making business for 7 years, offering tailoring services to third parties and selling directly to customers. She learned this work through classes and works alone every day. In this way, she generates sufficient resources to support her husband with the household expenses. 
She is currently requesting a loan to buy supplies wholesale such as cloth, threads, and other items. This will enable her to have material available to complete her pending orders in a timely manner, earning her the loyalty of her current customers.  
Gloria tells us that she is determined to keep doing this work and that she wants to grow her business and be able to generate employment opportunities in addition to guaranteeing economic stability so that she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies such as fabric, thread, elastic, and other items.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel es un experimentado carpintero el cual a desde hace muchos años aprendió este oficio gracias a la experiencia obtenida trabajando en muchos talleres de maderas y con el paso del tiempo fue independizándose hasta montar su propio taller con el cual, a pesar de las adversidades, ha logrado salir adelante junto con su familia.

Su mayor orgullo es haber construido una muy buena reputación y prestigio gracias a su buen trabajo; construyo los muebles con sus propias manos y casi todo lo encontrado en su humilde hogar es fabricado por el mismo.
 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de madera que le permitan fabricar más muebles y lograr tener una buena rentabilidad por sus trabajos.

Su principal sueño está enfocado en sus hijos, puesto que quiere darles una muy buena educación y que en un futuro sean personas muy exitosas.
S
iempre pensando en Interactuar como su aliado y compañero en su proceso productivo.
texts.en:
Miguel is an experienced carpenter who learned his trade many years ago thanks to the experience he gained working in many woodworking shops and who became more independent with time until he set up his own shop which, despite challenges, has allowed he and his family to get ahead.  

His greatest pride is having built up a good reputation and prestige thanks to his good work; he built his furniture with his own hands and almost everything to be found in his humble home he built himself. 

He is requesting a loan to buy wood, which will allow him to build more furniture and make good profits from his work. 
 
His main dream is focused on his children, as he wants to give them a good education so that in the future they will be successful.  

He thanks Interactuar for being his ally and friend throughout the working process.

loans.use: to buy wood, which will allow him to build more furniture

loans.name: Sreyleak's Group

texts.en:
Sreyleak is a young mother of two kids who are her dependents. They are living in a rural village of Srey Snom district in Siem Reap province. Her kids are very young. One of them is below the age of 6 and another one just started school. 

To finance the family, she and her husband have been doing a cassava plantation and growing vegetables. Their additional income is from raising pigs. They can earn roughly $5 USD daily. 

Sreyleak is not new with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. This is her fifth time, and she is now a leader of her group. They are applying for a 4,000,000 KHR loan. Her portion of the loan will be used to buy cassava to sell and to hire workers to harvest the cassava. She hopes that her cassava plantation will be fruitful so that she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy cassava and to hire workers to harvest the cassava

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Munnin

texts.en:
Munnin, 25 years old, lives in a rural area of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has only one little child. He is a construction worker and earns, on average, 5 USD a day. So far, he has been in this career for fifteen years.

Currently, Munnin would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow him to have a personal vehicle so that he can experience a convenient way of travelling. He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mary Bessie

texts.en:
Mary Bessie is a 55-year-old mother who has three children. She has managed a small retail store for almost 23 years while her husband works on their farm. Mary Bessie aspires to improve her business and increase her income in order to support her youngest child's education. 

Mary Bessie wants to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers' demands but she doesn't have enough capital. She would like to access a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more stock of hog feed, rice, soft drinks, LPG tanks and grocery items to resell. She is hoping to get her loan so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of hog feed, rice, soft drinks, LPG tanks and grocery items to resell

loans.name: John Mico

texts.en: John Mico is now pursuing his university studies for seafaring. He has committed himself to finishing them in order to have a stable job in the future that could help his parents and settle his own family into a better one. He has patronized GDMPC products in this semester with a loan of 8,000 PHP to pay his tuition fees, as per the school's statement of account. John Mico is looking forward to the great chance of earning knowledge, with the help of GDMPC and KIVA, with loans that change lives.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for the current semester

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, age 49, buys and sells ready-to-wear clothing to earn a living. She and her husband have one child, who attends school. Gemma is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has been engaged in her business for two years.

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 17,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy a stock of clothing items like shorts, t-shirts, pants, and blouses to offer for sale.

Gemma would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothing items  like shorts, t-shirts, pants, and blouses to offer for sale

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 32 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children are in school. Ma. Luz is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Luz has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a married woman with two children. She is 32 years old and both of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lilibeth has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested an 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina, age 58 and widowed, runs a general store to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for three years. She has seven children, the two youngest of whom still attend school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Catalina requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase canned goods, eggs, and other grocery items to offer for sale in her store.

In the future, Catalina would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase icanned goods, eggs, and other grocery items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es:
Catherine, es una joven de 29 años de edad que desde hace algún tiempo se ha dedicado a diversas actividades laborales pero siempre con un deseo en su mente que era el incursionar en el área comercial, fue así como desde inicios del año 2011, monto su negocio ofreciendo elementos de miscelanea, con el cual ha tenido gran acogida durante los años que lleva de funcionamiento. 
Trabaja sola durante 9 horas todos los días.

Catherine se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, amable, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por esta razón que se anima a solicitar un crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía como accesorios, elementos de decoración, entre otros, con el fin de darle una mejor imagen al negocio, que logre atraer más clientes y así ofrecerles una variedad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades y gustos de todos los que visiten el negocio. 

De esta manera logrará obtener ingresos para continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar y ahorrar para montar varias sucursales de su negocio y así tendrá un futuro más próspero, donde podrá mejorar notoriamente su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Catherine is a young woman of 29 years of age who has worked for some time in various job, but always with the desire in mind to get into business.  This is why, at the beginning of 2011, she started a business selling miscellany, and this business has been very well received for all the time that she has been running it. 
She works alone for 9 hours a day. 
Catherine can be described as an enterprising and kind woman who has vision and a great desire to succeed. This is why she decided to request a loan to buy merchandise such as accessories, decorative elements, and other items. Her goal is for her business to have a better image so that she can attract more customers and offer them a variety of products that will satisfy their needs and tastes. 
In this way, she will achieve the income she needs to keep contributing to the household economy and to save-up so that she can open more branches of her store in order to have a more prosperous future where she can significantly improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as accesssories, decorative elements, etc.

loans.name: Maria Aracelly

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.
Tiene un almacén en el que vende productos de uso personal como crtemas, lociones y desodorantes. 

Inicio el negocio hace 20 años y ha tenido buena acogida en el sector.
Ella desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser mas prospera. 
El dinero será invertido en la compra de mercancía con la que actualmente no cuenta como juguetería y cosméticos.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de entidades como Interactuar que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman who is all charged up to face the world and to have a full life, thanks to her own efforts.
She has a store where she sells personal products such as creams, lotions, and deodorants. 
She started this business 20 years ago and has been well received.
She wants to increase the range of products she offers and to improve her sales by injecting some capital into her business. This is why she is requesting a loan and seeking the opportunity to be more prosperous. 
She will use the money to buy merchandise that she currently doesn't have such as cosmetics.
She has great hopes for her store and thinks that her future can improve considerably thanks to the support of entities such as Interactuar that make it possible for people to dream of a better, more stable life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise that she doesn't currently have such as  toys and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a glass display window, stainless table, bulk ingredients, and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old and married with seven children. With three children currently in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of sanitary pads, juice, soft-drinks, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Gina has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as sanitary pads, juice, soft-drinks, coffee, detergent soap, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of sanitary pads, juice, soft-drinks, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Илхом молодой парень в возрасте 29 лет женат имеет 2-х детей. Он окончил финансы и кредит, и поэтому хочет работать по специальности.  Илхом недавно устроился в хорошую организацию, но очень хочет устроиться работать в банке. Кредит  хочет  получить для оплаты за обучение в университет своего племянника. Его племянник хочет быть похожим на Илхома, таким же умным и интеллигентным. Для этого Илхом с радостью хочет помочь своему племяннику. У его племянника нет возможности оплатить  за обучение и Илхом не против, поэтому он обратился в Арванд за поддержкой и надеется что все у него получится.
texts.en: Ilhom is a 29-years man, married, and the father of two children. He has graduated from college majoring in Finances and Credit Management and would like to work in his field. He recently got a job with a good firm, but he would really like to work for a bank. He is taking out a loan to help pay for the university education of his nephew. His nephew wants to be like Ilhom: smart and well-educated. Ilhom is happy to help his nephew, who lacks the funds to pay for tuition. Ilhom agreed to help and applied to Arvand for financial support. He is hoping for a positive outcome.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition of his nephew.

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en: Sangke district villager, 34-year-old Sina, is married with two children. To support the family, she has been selling snacks from home and raising pig to sell. Sina has a reliable reputation with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has been a member for three cycles now and is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy piglets to raise for selling, and to buy pig feed.  She hopes to expand her pig sale business so that she can send both of her kids to school.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Tum's Group

texts.en: Tum is a 35-year-old married woman with two young children from Srey Snom district, Siem Reap province. She has been farming rice for 17 years in order to earn an income and it provides the family with $5 US daily. Tum has successfully been a member with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), having already taken out four loans. For her fifth loan, she is requesting 1,500,000 KHR to buy wood to repair her house. She believes her children will be healthier with better and more hygienic living space in the newly repaired house.

loans.use: to buy wood to repair her house

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en:
Mariafe, a 38-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Palawan, has been operating her transportation business for several years, and she makes a good income from this activity. She and her husband are blessed with two children, who attend high school. She is determined to work harder to provide for her family.

She has a tricycle vehicle that allows her to carry up to four passengers. She transport her passengers to their destination within the community, and the tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Her customers are members of the local community. She earns a minimum of PhP 1,000 every day.

Mariafe would like to apply a for a loan in the amount of PhP 50,000 to allow her to continue operations of their business. She will be utilizing the loan funds to buy spare parts and accessories as well as to pay for maintenance of the vehicle.

In the future, her goal is to own another tricycle vehicle, because she hopes to grow and expand her transport business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories for her vehicle, as well as to pay for essential maintenance

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosita is 55 years old and one of her children is in school.

Rosita has a buy and sell of fruit business in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 2,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Rosita has been in this business for one year. In the future, Rosita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.en:
Ivonne, age 42, runs a general store to earn a living. She has been engaged in this activity for three years. She and her husband have four children, all of whom are in school. Ivonne is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

She requested a loan on the amount of PhP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase groceey items to offer for sale in her general store.

In the future, Ivonne would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en: Estrellita, 44 years old, is widowed and has four children, all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 12 years, Estrellita has operated a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more cloth, etc. for her business. In the future, Estrellita would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more cloth, etc. for her tailoring  business

loans.name: Maria Yasmid

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.
Tiene un pequeño negocio de preparación y venta de alimentos como arepas, tamales comidas regionales y comidas rapidas.

Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por su hijo de 4 años quien es el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente.
Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.

Maria solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de mesas, sillas y una carpa para atender a sus clientes de una mejor manera y comprar surtido de ingredientes para sus preparaciones

Con tu ayuda Maria Podrá pagar la educación de su hijo que es uno de sus más grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Maria is a very enterprising and tenacious woman with big dreams that she has been cultivating and trying to fulfill.
She has a small business preparing and selling food such as arepas, tamales, regional food, and fast food.
Day in and day out she does this work in order to be successful and to improve her family's living conditions. Her family is comprised of her 4 year old son, who is the purpose for her life and her motivation to strive everyday. 
Her major difficulty is competition in her sector. But, with her great capacity for work, she is able to sustain herself and to progress. 
Maria is requesting a loan to buy tables, chairs, and a canopy to service her customers in a better manner and to buy ingredients for the food she prepares. 
With your help, Maria will be able to pay for her son's education, which is one of her greatest dreams!

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and a canopy to serve her customers.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 53 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Magdalena has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

Magdalena has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Magdalena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Theary

texts.en: Theary is married and has two school-going children. She resides in a rural village in Ponhea Leu district, Kandal province. Theary and her husband have been farming rice for 15 years. Theary has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, before and it helped to send her children to school. She is now applying for a loan to sponsor her children to get higher education in nursing. She hopes that all of her children will get proper education so that they can have bright futures.

loans.use: to sponsor her children to get higher education in nursing

loans.name: Chanthol's Group

texts.en: A villager from Srey Snom district, Siem Reap province, middle-aged Chanthol is a mother and a wife. She has five children. Two of them are now paid workers in Thailand, two more are in secondary school, and the last one is under the age of six. Her family's main sources of income have come from farming and selling food for 22 years. She also raises a pig for sale. She is able to keep 5 USD for saving each day. As a member of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the fifth time, Chanthol is leading a group of two, seeking a loan of 2,000,000 KHR each. Her purpose of the loan is to buy a pig to raise and then sell for profit. She hopes that the pig will grow well and be profitable.

loans.use: to buy a pig

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, están en su primer ciclo del programa de comités, además forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liz, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, es decir está en un nivel medio de pobreza, luchando por mejorar cada día. Ella tiene una ferretería hace un buen tiempo y ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela que siempre va hasta su negocio, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que se está esforzando cada día.
La Sra. Liz pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su ferretería, de manera a poder surtirla y poder seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que piden.
texts.en:
This group consists of 17 women in their first cycle of the committee program. In addition they are part of the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Liz. At her last survey she demonstrated a poverty level of two, which is in the middle poverty level, fighting to improve every day. She has had a hardware store for some time and today she has a good customer base who always shop at her business. She is a very hard-working woman who puts forth great effort every day.

Liz seeks this loan to be able to buy various supplies for the hardware store, and in this way be able to stock it and be able to continue giving her customers everything that they are seeking.

loans.use: to buy various supplies for the hardware store.

loans.name: Ninoska

texts.es:
La socia Ninoska pertenece al banco comunal LAS HIJAS DE MARIA;la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de licores, la socia agradece el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas mensuales, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de licores entre otros.
texts.en:
Ninoska is part of the Communal Bank “Las Hijas de Maria” [The Daughters of Mary]. She continues to manage her business where she sells liquor. Ninoska appreciates the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her monthly payments. She is a responsible and industrious person. Ninoska wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy liquor and other products.

loans.use: to buy liquor and other products.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had greatly enriched her business.  She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can continue to improve her business if you will let her borrow again in the amount of 15,000 PHP.  This new loan will go toward additional grocery items, toiletries and beverages she needs to grow her product inventory.  Simultaneously, she can sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Jovelyn wants to expand her business so that she will be able to help support the educational needs of her children.  She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles works hard to support her family. Angeles is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like canned goods, fish, meat, spices, etc.

Angeles has been in this business for three years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Angeles would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like canned goods, fish, meat, and spices

loans.name: Sheena

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Sheena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of home products business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing. Sheena is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more home products to sell.

Sheena has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more home products to sell

loans.name: José Wilson

texts.es:
Jose, de 47 años, inicio con su oficio de construcción y reformas de viviendas en el municipio de Sonson, negocio que inicio con el afán de sostener a sus tres hijos y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
En el momento en que nació su ultimo hijo, encontró su motivación para trabajar incansablemente y así ofrecerle lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.
Hoy en día su hijos tienes 16, 14 y 5 años y se han convertido en la alegría de este hombre trabajador.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para iniciar con una obra a todo costo que le generar buenos ingresos, estos materiales serian arena, ladrillos, cemento, entre otros.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener a sus hijos y a su esposa brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor y una optima estabilidad económica.

Apoya a Jose con un préstamo para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Jose, 47 years old, started his construction and home remodeling profession in the municipality of Sonson, a business that he started with the desire to support his three children and offer them a better quality of life. When his last child was born, he found motivation to work tirelessly and in that way offer him the best for his life and development. Today his children are 16, 14, and 5 years old and have become the happiness of this hardworking man.

He requests a loan to buy construction materials to start a full cost project that will create good income. The materials are sand, brick, and cement, among other things.

With this loan he will be able to support his children and his wife, providing them a better quality of life and optimal economic stability.

Support Jose with a loan so that he can continue his business!

loans.use: to buy construction materials to start a full cost project.

loans.name: Gladys María

texts.es:
Gladys, a sus 45 años de edad vive con su hijo.  
Desde que tenía 16 años, ella comenzó a laborar en el campo de la confección, pues le colaboraba a una Tía que tenía una empresa grande y allí se encargaba de pulir y revisar las prendas, cuando cumplió la mayoría de edad fue vinculada a la empresa, donde laboró por algunos años. 
Hace aproximadamente 15 años, Gladys se independizó y montó su taller con gran empuje; afianzó su taller con la esperanza de que las ventas aumentaran y así fue, comenzó a conseguir contratos con terceros. De esta forma ha obtenido los ingresos para el sustento de su familia. 

Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar una máquina plana industrial, con el fin de brindarle a sus clientes una prenda bien elaborada y con excelente terminación, así aumentará los contratos y podrá generar mayores ingresos para poder cumplir el sueño de tener una línea propia, además de brindar oportunidades de empleo a otras  personas. 

Ella sabe que Interactuar es un gran apoyo para el crecimiento de su empresa!
texts.en:
Gladys is 45 years old and lives with her son. At 16 years old she began to work as a seamstress, collaborating with an aunt that had a large business and there she was in charge of finishing and reviewing the clothing items. Once she became an adult she was hired by the business, and she worked there a few years.

Approximately 15 years ago Gladys opened her own shop through great efforts. She financed her shop with the hopes that her sales would increase and they did, so she began to hire additional help. In this way she has obtained income to support her family.

With the loan she seeks she wants to buy an industrial-grade machine, with the goal of providing her customers a well-made item of clothing with excellent finishing. Thus her contracts will increase and she will be able to generate greater income in order to be able to achieve her dream of having her own clothing line, in addition to providing employment to others.

She knows that Interactuar is a great support in the growth of her business!

loans.use: to buy an industrial-grade machine.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El Comité Primavera  está en el 3er ciclo, es un grupo
Que están iniciando con muchas expectativas que quieren invertir para poder tener más ingresos en la casa y así  poder salir de la pobreza. 
Isabel, una de las integrantes, se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma se encarga de hacer y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante por su barrio. Es muy buena en lo que hace, y es con ello que tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y tener mejores ingresos. Está contenta por formar parte del programa de comités, ya que a través de su trabajo y con las capacitaciones de la fundación puede ir mejorando cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir haciendo sus comidas e ir mejorando cada día más.
texts.en:
The communal bank Primavera [Spring] is in its third cycle. The group is starting with a lot of hope because they want to invest so that they can have more income in their homes and in that way be able to get out of poverty. 

Isabel, one of the members, works selling food that she makes herself and later sells on the streets in her neighborhood. She is very good at what she does and with her work she has the means to be able to help her family and have better income. She is happy to be a part of the communal bank program, since through her work and with the foundation’s trainings she can improve each day. 

She asks for this loan to be able to buy ingredients to make her food, such as vegetables, condiments, greens, and other things, so that she will be able to continue making her food and improving more each day.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, greens, etc.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 15 señoras que apuntan a una mejor  y buena calidad de vida, todas y cada una de ellas están luchando por mejorar la vida de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juliana, es la tesorera de este grupo, tiene 5 hijos, todos ya mayores de edad con sus respectivas profesiones, que ella pudo criar con mucho esfuerzo. Ella es macatera (vendedora ambulante) y agricultora, tiene cría de animales lo cual le provee de huevos y leche, la señora vende a buen precio en su despensa, cabe resaltar que la Sra. Juliana es muy activa en su comunidad. Cuenta con el  apoyo incondicional de su familia. Ella está contenta por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su vida.
Solicita este préstamo para poder surtir su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, frutas, y otros, de manera a poder seguir surtiendo su negocio para poder dar a sus clientes lo que piden.
texts.en:
The committee is made up of 15 women who aim for a better and good quality of life, each and every one of them is striving to improve the lives of their families. 

One of the members is Juliana, she is the treasurer of the group. She has five children, all now grown up with professions of their own, whom she brought up with a great deal of effort. She is a travelling saleswoman and farmer. She raises animals which provide her with eggs and milk, which she sells at a good price from her larder. It is also worth highlighting that Juliana is a very active member of her community. She can count on the unconditional support of her family. She is happy to have the opportunity to be able to improve her life.

She is asking for this loan to be able to stock her larder with items such as vegetables, meat, fruit and other things, so that she can continue to supply her business and be able to give her customers what they ask for.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruit and other items to sell.

loans.name: Amada

texts.es:
Amada vive en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, ella proviene una familia de Agricultores, ella es muy humilde y trabajadora, donde con la ayuda de sus familiares se independizo y monto un negocio propio hace 10 años.
Ella tiene una despensa, y comenta que le va muy bien y que puede enviar a sus hijos en la escuela por medio de su trabajo.
Ella pide este pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, carne, embutidos, bebidas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
Amada lives in Coronel Oviedo City. She comes from a family of farmers. She is very humble and hard-working. With the help of her friends she launched her own business 10 years ago. She has a store and says that it is going very well and that she can send her children to school because of her work.

She seeks this loan to be able to buy a variety of products for her store, such as vegetables, fruit, meat, canned goods, beverages, and other items. In this way she will be able to continue working. She is thankful for the opportunity she receives to be able to continue improving every day.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, meat, canned goods, beverages and other items.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
El señor Teodoro es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, se dedica a la compra y venta de materiales de construcción hace ya 15 años, tiene su local de materiales en un lugar muy bien ubicado, que le permite recibir a muchos clientes todos los días.
Él es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante, es por ello que se esfuerza  mucho siempre.
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere comprar materiales de construcción para poder surtir su negocio y seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Señor Teodoro is from the city of San Lorenzo.  He has worked buying and selling construction supplies for the past fifteen years.  He has his supply shop in a very good location, which allows him to have a lot of customers every day.

He is a very hardworking and persistent person who wants to get ahead.  It is because of this that he always works so hard.

He is asking for this loan because he wants to buy construction materials to be able to stock his business and continue with his sales, as he has been doing.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to sell

loans.name: Lucila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lucila inicio la venta de variedades específicamente elementos de uso personal, hace 2 años, actividad aprendida gracias a una amiga, buscó esta actividad como una alternativa de generar dinero y como mujer pujante y emprendedora busca desesperadamente el sustento para su hogar conformado por su hijo de 16 años. 

Debido al costo de vida tan alto, Lucila se ve en la necesidad de generar un mayor volumen de ingresos, es por este motivo que necesita un apoyo económico que la ayude a mejorar la variedad de productos que exhibe y que diariamente ofrece a sus clientes y a personas puerta a puerta. 
Trabaja sola todos los días durante 6 horas.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de accesorios y lociones para añadirlos a su portafolio de productos de uso personal.

Su principal sueño es poder convertirse en la propietaria de un almacén con gran variedad de productos y sabe que está por buen camino de la mano de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Lucila started selling a variety of products specifically personal use items two years ago. She learned this business from a friend looking for a business as an alternative to generate money. As a forceful and enterprising woman she was desperately searching for sustenance for her household comprising of her 16 year old son.

Due to the high cost of living Lucila she sees the need to generate a greater amount of income. It is for this reason that she needs economic support which will help her to improve her variety of products that she shows daily that she offers to her clients and other people going door-to-door. She works 6 hours daily.

She is requesting a loan to buy accessories and lotions to add to her portfolio of personal use products. Her main dream is to become the owner of a store with a great variety of products and knows that working hand in hand with the Corporación Interactuar is a good path to take.

loans.use: to buy accessories and lotions to add them to her personal use portfolio.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is married and she has seven children. She has a very high interest in doing business. She has been involved in business activities since 2008 with her own working capital of $400, and she made her best of it. 

She is earning good money, but she still wants to improve her management of her business, and she is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional items to keep in her store, including slippers, sugar, cooking oils, noodles, detergents, shampoo, milks, candles, candies, books and other things to sell. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. She also has animals in her place like cows, pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy slippers, sugar, cooking oils,  noodles, detergents, shampoo, milks, candles, candies, books and other things to sell.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
Asuncion tiene 45 años de edad, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Cañaris que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de esta comunidad se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, cuenta con experiencia en este sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo de café, con esto Asuncion espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que va a generarle mayores ingresos que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Asuncion is 45 years old.  He lives in his own home in the Cañaris district, which is located in the Ferreñafe province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  The people in this community mainly work in agriculture, trade, and ranching.

He works in farming, specifically in coffee farming.  He has experience in this area, and he has very good personal and job references in his district.  This loan will be for the purchase of soil amendments and fertilizers for his coffee crop.  With this, Asuncion hopes to offer coffee of better quality to his customers.  This is going to generate higher earnings, which will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and soil amendments for his coffee plants.

loans.name: Anabela

texts.en: Anabela is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as kitchen utensils, plates, bowls, spoons and glasses. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $400. She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils such as plates, bowls, spoons and glasses.

loans.name: Lasimin

texts.en: Lasimin work as a scavenger. He lives with his wife in the village of Gilimanuk, west Bali. Every morning, he and his wife look for used items that will be sold back to the big buyers. During that time, he was just looking for junk around each residence. Now he has a plan to search for the junk out of the region to get more results. For that, Lasimin requires additional capital. He borrowed 5,000,000 IDR from MUK with a monthly payment system to buy more junk. With more collecting of junk, he hopes to get more results. Lasimin has a dream to repair his house, which is still small, and become a big buyer for junk collectors in his village.

loans.use: to buy more junk

loans.name: Heuidy Jose

texts.es:
Heuidy tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a brindar los servicios de seguridad, contando con herramientas propias y con más de 1 año de experiencia en el negocio, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para invertirlo en capacitaciones en servicios de seguridad llevando cursos y talleres prácticos, con esto el espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le va a generar mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Heuidy is 34 years old.  He is single and lives with his family in the Oyotún district, in a rural area located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  Life in this community is calm and quiet.  The people work in agriculture, ranching, and raising small animals.

He works offering security services.  He has his own tools and more than a year of experience with this business.  He has very good personal and work references in the area.  The loan will be used to invest in training programs for security services—courses and practical workshops.  In this way he hopes to offer his clients better service.  This is going to earn him a bigger income  and, in the end, will improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to invest in training programs--courses and practical workshops--for security services.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with ten children, five of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilou is 46 years old.

Marilou has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Marilou has been in this business for three years. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines for 4 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing.  She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more frozen foods to sell to her customers from her frozen foods vending business.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria Luisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.
