She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to customers of her business.

Maria Luisa has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from a general store.

Maria Luisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 26 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Mylene has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ma. Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Ma. Virginia is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of coconut wine to sell for her buy-and-sell coconut wine business.

Ma. Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Tierra Prometida Group

texts.es:
Tierra Prometida es un grupo formado en la ciudad de San Pedro, una zona bastante alejada de la zona de la capital del país, que aún está en crecimiento, donde en su mayoría las integrantes se dedican a actividades rurales.
La señora Maria, una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se destaca por ser una persona que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante y crecer, para poder ir mejorando su economía y la de su familia. Ella tiene una Despensa, en la cual todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano, procurando un mejor ingreso para su familia y para sus seres queridos. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y luchando para que pueda dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser carne, bebidas, frutas, verduras y otros. Maria está agradecida, ya que por medio de su trabajo podrá ir superándose cada día.
texts.en:
Tierra Prometida (“Promised Land”) is a group formed in the city of San Pedra, which is a remote place in the area near the capital of the country. Although the area is growing, most of its residents are dedicated to rural activities.

Maria is one of the members of this group. She stands out as being a person who makes an effort to go forward and grow, so that she can improve her finances and that of her family. She has a store, in which she works everyday from very early in the morning. She earns a better income for her family and for her loved ones. Her goal is to be able to continue growing and fighting so that she can give her loved ones all that she wasn’t able to have.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of supplies for her store, including meat, drinks, fruits, vegetables, and other things. Maria is thankful, since through her work she will be able to overcome everyday.

loans.use: to buy meat, drinks, fruit, vegetables, and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to resell

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is a 27-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur in the Philippines who does business buying and selling household products. 

She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more household products to sell.

Crisanta has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more household products to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lucy requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and ingredients for her business.

Lucy has been in this business for 10 years now and earns additional income from fishing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lucy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 49 years old and has four children. She is a married woman.

Estrella is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Estrella requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Estrella has been in this business for 10 years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Estrella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro ha sido un hombre muy dedicado, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia conformada por sus 2 hijos y su esposa; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía desde hace 20 años, pues es responsable de llevar la carga económica del hogar junto con su esposa y necesita generar los recursos para hacerlo. 

Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja solo todos los días en su negocio y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productivo como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor de artículos didácticos para niños y elementos escolares para completar su portafolio de productos, pues es una gran oportunidad en esta época del año, esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada escolar dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Alvaro manifiesta que su mayor deseo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y dar educación a todos sus hijos, para verlos convertirse en profesionales y tengan un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Alvaro has been a very dedicated man, always looking after his family that is formed by his two children and his wife. He has always liked working as an independent businessman. He started selling his merchandise 20 years ago, since he is responsible for being in charge of the economy of the home together with his wife and he needs to create the resources to do it.

His clients are neighbors, family, and friends in the area. He works alone every day on his business, and in his work he finds the advantage of being able to look after his family and at the same time be productive as a businessman.

Currently he requests the loan to buy a range of wholesale educational objects for children and school supplies to complete his portfolio of products, since it is a great opportunity for this time of year. This will allow him to stock up with more variety to satisfy the demand that increases in the school season, resulting in better income for his family.

Alvaro states that his greatest desire is to continue supporting his family economically and to give all of his children an education, to see them become professionals, and that they have a successful and prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy a range of wholesale educational objects for children and school supplies.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn is 28 years old, and she is married with 4 children. Her husband is a barber, but the income he earns is not sufficient to cover all of the family's expenditures. 

Jennelyn joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2013, and she earns 4,000 PHP per month. 

Jennelyn has taken a loan in order to buy more cooking ingredients for her food vending business. She cooks and sells pinoy delicacies and viandes every day in order to earn a living. 

Jennelyn plans to have her own eatery in the future so she can earn a better income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more cooking ingredients for her food vending business.

location.town: Sto. ñino, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Gilmer

texts.es:
Gilmer tiene 27 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pimpingos, que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra Norte del Perú. Los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica al cultivo de café variedad catimore que es resistente a enfermedades, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en este sector y con muy buenas referencias personales en su distrito. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, cuyes, patos, cerdos, entre otros. El préstamo será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto Gilmer espera tener una producción de mejor calidad lo que le asegurará un mayor volumen de ventas lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gilmer is 27 years old. He lives in his own house made of rustic materials in the district of Pimpingos, which is located in the province of Cutervo in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. The residents of this area are dedicated to agriculture and livestock for work.

He grows the Catimor variety of coffee, which is resistant to diseases. He has 5 years of experience in this field, and he has very good personal references in his district. Additionally, he raises small animals, including hens, guinea pigs, ducks, and pigs, among other animals. 

The loan will be used to buy manure and fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop. With this, Gilmer hopes to have a better quality production, which will ensure him a bigger volume of sales. This will then increase his level of income and will improve the quality of his and his family’s life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Kuña Joaju Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Joaju, está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty,  es una zona que aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Y las integrantes de este grupo quieren salir adelante con las capacitaciones y acompañamiento que tienen para estar en un buen ambiente en la zona y que puedan generar su propio ingreso.
La Señora Sonia,  es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de gallina que ella misma cría. Con ese trabajo genera su propio ingreso y ayuda a solventar los gastos de su familia, desea que el grupo pueda salir adelante, e ir mejorando, todo esto con su esfuerzo.
Solicita  este préstamo para la compra de gallinas para criar y luego revender  ya que es una de las fuentes de ingresos que tiene para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group “Kuña Joaju” is in its first cycle of the program for female groups. They are from the city of Curuguaty. It is an area that is growing. The members of this group want to go forward with the training and company that they have because they are in the good atmosphere of the area and so that they can earn their own income.

Sonia is one of the members. She sells hens that she raises. With this work, she earns her own income and helps to cover her family’s expenses. She wants the group to go forward and to continue improving with her efforts.

She requests this loan to buy hens to raise and then to resell. This is one of the sources of income that she has to help her family.

loans.use: to buy hens to raise.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.  Elsie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, milk, spices, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, milk, and spices

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 38 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like coffee, sugar, soft-drinks, noodles, beers, shampoo, cereals, etc. to sell.

Jona has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling ready to wear.

Jona aspires to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, sugar, soft-drinks, noodles, beers, shampoo, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Meralyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Meralyn works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fish vending. Meralyn is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Meralyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Judilyn

texts.en:
Judilyn is 25 years old and married with three children, who are in school. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines, where she fattens pigs. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Judilyn has been in pig fattening for three years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rubeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rubeline works hard to support her family. Living in the Philippines, she has a fishing business and also earns  income from food vending.

Rubeline is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Rubeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials that she needs for her fishing business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Patricia is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Patricia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Patricia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell 

Patricia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Patricia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 44 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is in school.

Janeth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Janeth requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Janeth has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Janeth would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 48 years old and married with five children.

Felisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, cigarettes, eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Felisa has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and earns additional  income from buying and selling coconut wine.

Felisa aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, cigarettes, eggs, canned goods, and groceries

loans.name: Phina's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Thmor Koul district in Battambang province, Phina is a 35-year-old widow with two young children. As a single mother, the family burden is growing heavy on Phina’s shoulders. She has been planting vegetables and farming rice for the last 10 years. She manages to save 6 USD a day for her family's future needs.

Phina is a longtime member with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. It is her ninth cycle, and she is seeking a loan of 1,600,000 KHR. Her portion of the loan will be used to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed for her rice farm and vegetable plantation as well as to hire workers to look after the plantations. She hopes that it will financially help her family and allow her children to receive an education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed and to hire workers

loans.name: Richelle

texts.en:
As a married mother of 3 children, Richelle works hard to support her family.

Richelle has a shop in the Philippines selling cellular phones, and she also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy inventory to sell from her shop such as cellular phones, accessories, etc. 

Richelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as cellular phones, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a married mother with 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 23 years old, and both of her children are in school.

Jenelyn has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. She has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more inventory of clothing to offer for sale.

Jenelyn has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Deolita

texts.en:
Deolita is 49 years old and has 9 children. She is married, and 3 of her children are currently in school.

Deolita is in the agricultural business, raising pig in the Philippines. She has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Deolita has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and she has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Deolita would like to save enough money to continue sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria Luz tiene 43 años de edad, reside en casa propia junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, ademas de el comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora (bebida tradicional de la región), actividad que realiza en su domicilio contando con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El presente crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de insumos para la elaboración de la chicha de jora así como para la compra de baldes y utensilios de cocina para su negocio, con esto Maria Luz espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir incrementar su nivel de ventas y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria, 43, lives in her own home with her daughters in the Buenos Aires district, Morropón province, Piura region of Peru’s Northern Coast.  Life in the community is peaceful, and the people are engaged in farming and ranching as well as trade.

Maria is engaged in selling “chica de jora” [a traditional regional drink], and conducts this activity in her home.  She has experience in this business where she has regular customers that can provide good personal and work references for her.  The purpose of this loan is to purchase more supplies such as buckets and kitchen utensils for her business in order to make the “chicha de jora”.  With this, Maria hopes to offer her customers a better product, which will permit her to increase sales and therefore, improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies such as buckets and kitchen utensils for her business in order to make the “chicha de jora”.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, grocery items, snack foods, fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is married and has 2 children. She lives with her family in a village in North Tajikistan. 

Fotima’s husband has been occupied with animal husbandry. Like her husband, Fotima also has been busy with animal husbandry for some years. She is a hardworking woman. She mainly feeds cows and sells their milk to her local community, including her neighbors. Fotima’s husband is a kind man, and he helps her with managing the business. 

For some years now, Fotima has been planning to repair her family's house, as it in bad condition. She and her husband earn a small income, and so they need to seek financial support. 

Fotima is requesting a loan of 10,000 TJS in order to buy building materials for repairing their house, such as cement, wood, paint, etc. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paint, etc.

loans.name: Samin

texts.en:
Living in the Memot district of Kampong Cham province, Samin is an elderly mother of six. Four of her children are her dependents. Only one of them receives a university education and three of them have dropped out of school. She has been involved in cassava plantation for 20 years in order to finance her family.

Samin has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four cycles already. She is seeking a loan to send her son to study nursing at a university. She believes that her son will have a brighter future and will help the family and the country as a nurse.

loans.use: to send her son to university, to study nursing

loans.name: Santa Luisa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Luisa  está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty,  una zona aun en crecimiento, y que está bastante alejado de la capital del país.
La Sra. Vidalina,  es una de las integrantes, ella tiene una despensa que poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo va armando y surtiendo, es una persona que está luchando para poder crecer y mejorar y ayudar con ello a su familia. Ella se esfuerza para poder ir creciendo y mejorando cada día, ya que con ello da a sus seres queridos todo para una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar arroz, fideos, azúcar, pan, leche, enlatados, chorizos y demás, de manera a poder tener una buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Santa Luisa group is in its second cycle with the women’s committee program.  The group is from the city of Curuguaty, an area that is still growing.  It is pretty far from the capital of the country.

Vidalina is one of the members.  She has a store that she, little by little and with great effort, is putting together and stocking.  She is a person who is struggling to be able to grow, to improve, and to help her family in this way.  She puts out great effort in order to be growing and improving every day.  With this she gives her loved ones everything for a decent life.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy rice, noodles, sugar, bread, milk, canned goods, sausages, and other items.  This way she will be able to have a good variety to offer her customers.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is getting, which will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, bread, milk, canned goods, sausages, and other items.

loans.name: Jenard

texts.en: Jenard is still continuing his studies in higher education to have a good job in the future and to be financially stable. Currently, he has taken another loan from GDMPC to pay his tuition fee for the semester. His plans are to help his parents and to be a successful individual.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fee for the semester.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson tiene 44 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijas, en el distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú, donde la vida es tranquila ya que es una comunidad rural y pequeña donde los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y venta de leche, este ganado se encuentra en un pequeño establo cerca a su domicilio, cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Wilson espera ofrecer mayor producción de leche a sus clientes lo que tendrá gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos y le ayudará a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilson, 44, lives with his spouse and two young daughters in the Cayaltí district, located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on Peru’s Northern Coast.  Life is peaceful there because it is a small rural community where the people are mainly engaged in farming and raising livestock.
He is engaged in selling milk and raising cattle, which he keeps in a small barn near his home.  He has over five years in the business, and has good references in his district.  He is requesting the loan to purchase more cattle to increase his business’s stock and with this, Wilson hopes to provide his customers with a greater production of milk, which will have a great impact on his income level, and help him improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to increase his business’s stock.

loans.name: Sucipto

texts.en:
Having two children who are still in school requires Sucipto to work hard to fulfill his family's needs and meet his children's school expenses. He makes a special effort as a fisherman who sells fish to an aquarium. His wife has a small shop at the front of their house and sells daily necessities, such as rice, vegetables and oil. 

Sucipto wishes to borrow 5,000,000 Indonesian rupiahs from Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil. He will use the loan to purchase various types of fittings for fishing, such as strings, hooks and nets. This loan will also be used to buy merchandise for his wife's shop. 

Sucipto and his wife want to expand their businesses. Sucipto is hoping for better results, because his family's needs and children's school expenses are getting expensive.

loans.use: to purchase various types of fittings for fishing, such as strings, hooks and nets, and to buy merchandise for his wife's shop

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros, 58, is married to a farmer, and they are blessed with six children. Milagros has owned and managed a recycling business in her village for almost two years. She earns a net daily income of 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Her net income is usually spent on her family's daily expenses. Due to insufficient capital, she would like to avail herself of a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase used plastic bottles, scrap and steel to sell. She is hoping to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase used plastic bottles, scrap and steel to sell.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Salvacion works hard to support her family. She has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. 

Salvacion is now borrowing 13,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou is thankful that she was previously granted a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which she used to purchase various grocery items and other products needed in her general store. Through her earnings, she has been able to send her child to school and meet her family's daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a loan of 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items for retail, such as rice, rice noodles, charcoal, frozen foods and soda. She knows that having more items in her store will yield more sales, thus increase her earnings. The income from her store is a stable source of funds to sustain her family's basic needs and pay for her child's education. 

Analou thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that she will receive. She dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her child the best education possible to allow her better opportunities in life. Every week, Analou meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza was born in 1982. She is a very kind woman. Firuza is married and has 2 children.  Firuza’s husband doesn’t work and that’s why they live poorly. 

Four months ago, Firuza started her own business buying and selling dried fruits. She buys dried fruits in bulk and sells them in a local market. She wants to increase her working capital in order to develop her business. 

She took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ provided by a women's organization and got a certificate. 

She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy dried fruits for her new business. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy dry fruits

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, 36, is married and has one child. She works in agriculture, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for two years. She has borrowed four times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to sustain her business.

Anita has now requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos from NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Anita would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. 

This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages

loans.name: Iliyas

texts.en:
Iliyas is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Applied Mathematics and Informatics. Here is his story:

“Education, health and ability to help other people are of vital importance for my family. My father is a Police Officer and my mother is a scientific employee of the National center of Cardiology and Therapy. They receive small salaries as they are the workers of the budgetary sphere, but they are glad to spend all their time, from morning to evening, at work carrying out their duties and helping people. My parents are exemplary people and I would like to be like them.

My family doesn’t have other sources of revenue or business. We live modestly; we don’t have a car and don’t buy expensive clothes. As my parents were always budgetary workers, they're used to saving money and living within their means. I know that in the Western countries or in the USA, budgetary employees earn good money and they are respected, unfortunately, that is quite the contrary here. Even so, we consider my parents’ jobs the most important ones and I am glad to be their son, as thanks to them people are healthy, there is a peace in my city, and people become tolerant and well-bread.

When I was in the seventh form, I knew exactly that I would enter AUCA. Here the studies are conducted in English, which opens big opportunities and prospects in the future. High aspiration to a goal, intellectual development, independence, strong convictions, democracy, adherence to principles – the qualities inherent for the most AUCA students. AUCA is my long-term goal, but it can’t be achieved without money. 

Certainly, we don’t have the possibility to pay the full tuition of AUCA, which why I hope that Kiva lenders will give me a chance to study here and get a Bachelors Degree.”

loans.use: to pay for his studies in Applied Mathematics and Informatics
